loans.use: To purchase DVDs to sell

loans.name: Marieme

texts.fr:
Madame Marieme D. est une femme mariée d’une trentaine d’années  qui gère 3 enfants et habite dans la localité de Camberene. Elle est parente bénéficiaire  et s’active dans le commerce de poissons depuis plus de 5 ans. Cette  dame a choisi cette activité  et juge que c’est une intéressante  source de revenu. Elle  a choisi le marche de Camberene pour acheter et revendre son poisson car c’est un lieu très fréquenté  par la population. Les  bénéfices  qu’elle gagne lui permettent de compléter  la dépense  quotidienne  assurée par son mari car ce dernier dispose de revenus faibles. Ainsi pour renforcer son commerce elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs pour augmenter son fond car le poisson constitue actuellement une denrée qui devient de plus en plus chère.
Madame D. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce à cette coopération, les parents  de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit à des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008 jusqu’au mois de juin  2009, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui ont  varie entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs.
texts.en:
Marieme D. has been married for about 30 years, has given birth to three children and lives in the city of Camberene. She is a beneficiary parent in a development project and she has sold fish for the past five years. She has chosen this business and she believes that it is a good source of revenue. She has chosen the market place of Camberene to buy and sell her fish, because it is a very popular place. With this income she can support her husband to take care of the daily family expenses, since he has a low income. In order to improve her business she is requesting a loan of 150 000 frs to increase her operating funds, since fish is a product that is becoming more and more expensive. Madame D. is the beneficiary of a collaborative project between U-IMCEC and PDEF, the Program for Child Development and the Family (PDEF)Seydina Issa Laye. The goal of PDEF is to reduce poverty in the community and especially to protect children from impoverished families. Thanks to this cooperation, parents in such families can obtain credit at more flexible conditions. Since the program was launched in December 2008, until June 2009, 120 parents have received financing, ranging in size from 50,000 to 150,000 frs.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase operating funds.

loans.name: Basile

texts.fr: D. Basile est né le 02 Janvier 1962 à Zinvié au Bénin. Basile réside depuis 25 ans à Sékou Centre à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique au Bénin. Basile est marié à AKOWANOU Bernadette, une revendeuse de produits divers. Le couple a quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Basile vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Basile a été à l'école jusqu'au cours secondaire. Depuis 25 ans environs, pour faire face à ses besoins, Basile vend des tonneaux à Sékou. Basile s'approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, et aussi à Bohicon au Bénin. Basile a déjà obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé, et a bien remboursé le crédit. Basile sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de l'institution, afin d'augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de la clientèle.
texts.en:
D. Basile was born on January 2, 1962 in Zinvié, Bénin. Basile has lived in Sékou Centre, in Allada, in the Atlantique Department of Bénin for 25 years. Basile is married to Akowanou Bernadette, who sells a variety of products, and they have 4 children, all in school. Basile lives together with his wife and children, and he and his wife provide for the family.
Basile attended school up until high school. For roughly 25 years Basile has made a living selling barrels in Sékou. Basile stocks up in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin, and also in Bohicon.
Basile has already received and repaid a loan from Alidé. Basile is seeking a second loan in order to increase his stock and better respond to customer demands.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 20 barrels

loans.name: Adebayo

texts.en: Adebayo A. is 45 years old and married with 3 children. He sells engine oil to make a living in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. He hopes for a loan of NGN 170,000 to purchase more engine oil to sell. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He hopes to expand his business in the future. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil to sell

loans.name: Tanekasu Ii Group

texts.en:
These are a group of small-scale entrepreneurs in the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They formed themselves into a group they named Tanekasu II in order to apply for a loan from Kiva lenders through SMT. They are requesting a loan of SLL 500,000 each in order to expand their businesses, both in terms of size and quality. Consequently, their sales and income level will improve so that they can better support themselves and their children.

On the left in the photo is Mohamed S., the leader of this group of five. Mohamed was born in Lunsar, in northern Sierra Leone about thirty-seven years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and they now live in Magburaka town together with their five children. Their children are attending secondary and primary schools respectively.

Mohamed is a carpenter. He has been in this profession for more than fifteen years now. He wants a loan in order to buy working materials and make nice beds to sell. Thus with his share of this loan, he will buy boards, polish, nails, casters, velvet cloth and so on. (Attached on the left is a group member not present for the group snapshot.)

loans.use: Buy boards, polish, nails, casters, velvet cloth and so on

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is married with a child. She is 43 years old. She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to lift her business and family above poverty.

Sandra sells wine and juice to make a living. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits during this season. Her greatest joy is the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She hopes for a loan of NGN 170,000 to purchase more wine and juice to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more wine and juice to sell

loans.name: Rosine

texts.fr: A. Rosine est née en 1973 à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique au Bénin. Mariée à MEGNON Honorat, un agent de la SBEE (Société Béninoise d'Electricité et d'Eau), Rosine est mère de trois enfants. Certains enfants sont scolarisés. Rosine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants à Dogoudo à Allada, depuis environs 5 ans. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Rosine n'a pas été à l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Rosine fabrique et vend du savon local (fait à base de soude, de soja et d'huile de palme) à Houègbo à Allada. Rosine s'approvisionne à Bohicon, dans le département du Zou, et aussi à Allada au Bénin. C'est depuis 14 ans que Rosine mène cette activité. Rosine a déjà obtenu deux fois de crédits à ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Rosine voudrait augmenter le stock de ses produits et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, mais elle manque de moyens financiers pour y arriver. C'est pourquoi Rosine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Rosine was born in 1973 in Allada, in the Atlantique Department of Bénin. She is married to Megnon Honorat, who works for the SBEE (Société Béninoise d'Electricité et d'Eau). Rosine has three children, some of whom are educated. Rosine has lived with her family in Dogoudo, in Allada, for roughly 5 years. She and her husband provide for the family.
Rosine did not attend school. To make a living, Rosine makes and sells local soap (made out of soda, soy and palm oil) in Houègbo, in Allada. Rosine stocks up in Bohicon, in the Zou Department, and also in Allada. Rosine has been in this business for 14 years.
Rosine has already received and repaid two Alidé loans. Rosine would like to increase her stock to better satisfy her customers, but she does not have the necessary means. This is why Rosine is requesting a third loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 8 bags of soda, 34 kg of soy and 5 containers of palm oil

loans.name: La Primavera Group

texts.es:
El Comité D. Mujeres D. nombre La Primavera, se conformó en fecha 29 D. enero del 2009, gracias a que la Directora General, la Sra. Juliana B. D. S., quien es artesana, se acercó a la Fundación Paraguaya informándose con respecto al programa y  D. la forma D. trabajo que tiene el Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 21 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto  en el  3° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa
El crédito  va destinado para diferentes actividades tales como: venta D. bebidas, venta D. carbón,  venta D. mercaderías para la despensa arroz, azúcar, fideos, lácteos, panificados, yerba, etc.), venta D. ropas, venta D. miel, venta D. tabaco, venta D. artesanía, venta D. helados, venta D. frutas, etc.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya. 
Participan activamente en las reuniones semanales y tienen un trabajo solidario impecable.
texts.en:
The women’s group named “La Primavera” was formed the 29th day of January 2009, thanks to the Director General, Ms. Juliana B. D. S. who is an artisan. She approached the Fundación Paraguaya to inform herself about the program and the kind of work that the Women Entrepreneurs Group (el Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras) had available. Once she was informed about the program, she managed to gather together 21 women who are working very comfortably in their 3rd cycle, in a supportive group within the program. The loan will be used for different activities like: the sale of drinks, coal, merchandise for grocery stores-(rice, noodles, dairy products, baked goods, yerba (mate), etc.), clothing, honey, tobacco, handicrafts, ice cream, fruit, etc. They all work in these activities to earn money; they help each other to reach their common goals within the group and with the Fundación Paraguaya. They actively participate in the weekly meetings and they work with impeccable solidarity.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for the grocery store( rice, sugar, yerba, dairy products, baked goods, soft drinks, etc), to buy ingredients to make honey, to buy fabrics, sewing needles, to buy products for the beauty salon, to buy coal, ingredients to make snack foods, drinks, tobacco, etc

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel is a married with 3 children. She is 39 years old. She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to lift her business and family above poverty.

Mabel sells bricks to make a living. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits during this season. Her greatest joy is the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She hopes for a loan of NGN 170,000 to purchase more bricks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bricks to sell

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is married with 4 children. She is 55 years old. She lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. She is a focused, hard worker. She sells garri(cassava flakes) at retail prices to her customers.She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more cassava to fry more garri to sell. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers.she hopes to expand her business in the future. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava to fry more garri (cassava flakes) to sell

loans.name: S. Bernadette Léonie

texts.fr: A. S. Bernadette Léonie est née le 25 Décembre 1968 à Calavi dans le département de l'Atlantique au Bénin. Mariée à DELOUH Basile, un fabricant de tonneaux pour boissons, Bernadette Léonie est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Bernadette Léonie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants à Sèkou Centre à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique au Bénin. Il y a environs 25 ans que la famille vit dans ce quartier. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Bernadette Léonie a arrêté les classes au cours secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et venir en aide à son mari, Bernadette Léonie vend divers produits (conserves, sardine, pâtes alimentaires, savons, huile végétale, allumettes, bougies, piles, farine de manioc, etc.) à Sékou. Bernadette Léonie s'approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, et à Bohicon dans le département du Zou au Bénin. Il y a plus de 12 ans que Bernadette Léonie mène cette activité. Bernadette Léonie a obtenu une fois de crédit qui a été bien remboursé à ALIDé. Bernadette Léonie sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire la demande des clients.
texts.en:
A. S. Bernadette Léonie was born on December 25, 1968 in Calavi, in the Atlantique Department of Bénin. She is married to Basile Delouh, who makes barrels to hold drinks. Bernadette Léonie has 4 children, all in school. Bernadette Léonie lives with her family in Sèkou Centre, in Allada, in the Atlantique Department of Bénin. They have lived in the area for roughly 25 years. She and her husband provide for the family.
Bernadette Léonie went to school until secondary school. To make a living and help her husband, Bernadette Léonie sell various products (canned goods, sardines, pasta, soaps, vegetable oil, matches, candles, batteries, manioc flour, etc.) in Sékou. Bernadette Léonie stocks up in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin, and in Bohicon, in the Zou Department of Bénin. Bernadette Léonie has been in this business for over 12 years.
Bernadette has already received and repaid and Alidé loan. Bernadette Léonie is requesting a second loan from Alidé in order to stock her business and to better satisfy customer demands.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 3 tins of sardines, 1 box of pasta and 10 containers of vegetable oil

loans.name: Lakoele Ablavi

texts.en:
Mr. K. works selling a variety of products in Lomé, Togo. He is single and has no children. He began his business in 2000, and works in the busy industrial center of Lomé.

This will be his first loan with WAGES, which he will use to resupply his stock of cooking gas. He plans on buying 40 barrels of gas for resale, which he imports from France. This loan will help him continue to meet his customers’ demands for this practical product.

loans.use: To buy barrels of cooking gas

loans.name: Virgen Del Perpetuo Socorro Group

texts.es:
Comité Virgen del Perpetuo Socorro, así se denomina el grupo conformado en fecha 18 de noviembre del 2.009, integrado por 15 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando con el Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendoras, en el 1º ciclo. 



Este grupo se formó gracias a que la actual Directora de Finanzas la Sra. Marcia G. logró juntas a todas sus vecinas y amigas. 



El crédito va destinado para diferentes actividades tales como: venta de mercerías, venta de comestibles, venta de cosméticos, compra de mercaderías para la despensa (arroz, azúcar, fideos, lácteos, panificados, yerba, etc.), venta de carne, venta de bebidas, venta de remedios ,venta de frutas, cría de pollitos, cría de cabras, peluquería, confección de prendas de vestir, compra de elementos para masajes, etc. 



Todas ellas están muy contentas trabajando en forma muy conjunta y solidaria con la Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
The Virgen del Perpetuo Socorro Communal Bank was formed on the 18th of November, 2009. It is comprised of 15 women who are working with the Women Entrepreneurs Committee, and they are in their first cycle. This group was formed thanks to the current Director of Finances, Marcia G.. She was able to get all of her neighbors and friends together. The loan is for their different activities like selling notions, selling food, selling cosmetics, buying merchandise for the grocery store (rice, sugar, noodles, dairy products, pastries, and dried leaves for tea, etc.), selling meat, selling drinks, selling remedies, selling fruit, raising chickens, raising goats, hair styling, making clothing, and buying massage supplies, etc. All of them are very happy working this way in such a united and supportive manner with the Paraguaya Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise, raw materials, and animals for their businesses

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a very hard-working woman who lives in Ogbomoso town in Oyo state, Nigeria. She is married with 5 children, and she is 45 years old.

Elizabeth processes and sells garri in her town. She has been in this business for over 20 years and with Lapo Microfinance for the past 2 years. She puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. Elizabeth is soliciting for a loan of 70,000 to expand her business and meet he customers' needs. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava to produce garri to sell

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en:
Iyabo is a very hard-working woman. She lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria, with her family. She is married to a civil servant. Iyabo is 35 years old and has 3 children; the eldest is about 13 years old and they are all doing well.

Iyabo sells children's clothes, bags and shoes. She has been in this business for over 10 years and with LAPO Microfinance for 2 years. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. Iyabo is requesting a loan of 70,000 to purchase more clothes, bags and shoes to sell in order to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes, bags and children's wear to sell

loans.name: Khoudia

texts.fr:
Madame Khoudia D. est une femme âgée  d’une trentaine d’années. Elle habite dans la localité  de Camberene ou elle exerce l’activité  d’achats et de vente de tissus, de boubous et de chaussures de tous genres. Elle  a été passionnée  par cette activité depuis le bas âge et à ce jour elle capitalise une expérience  de 7 ans. Madame  D. sollicite un crédit de100 000 frs pour renforcer  son stock en boubous car on est en phase d’une période  favorable aux achats de boubous. Madame  D. est mariée  et mère  de 2 enfants. C’est a travers les bénéfices  que lui génère  son commerce qu’elle parvient a prendre en charge ses besoins personnels tels la participation aux tontines organisées dans les quartiers, l’achat d’habits neufs pour elle et ses enfants pendant les événements, fêtes  ou cérémonies.
Madame  D. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce à cette coopération, les parents  de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit à des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008 jusqu’au mois de juin  2009, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui ont  varie entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs
texts.en:
Mrs. Khoudia D. is in her thirties. She lives in the town of Camberene, where she buys and sells cloth, boubous and all kinds of shoes. She took an interest in this business from an early age and now has 7 years experience.
Mrs. D. is requesting a 100,000 franc loan to stock up on boubous while the prices are good.
Mrs. D. is married with 2 children. It is with her earnings that she makes a living, participates in the region’s tontines (rotating savings and credit associations), and buys new clothing for her and her children for events, festivals and ceremonies.
Mrs. D. is a beneficiary of the agreement between U-IMCEC and the Child and Family Development Program (PDEF in French) Seydina Issa Laye. The PDEF seeks to reduce poverty within the community and especially aims to protect children born into poor families. Thanks to this cooperation, parents of these children can receive loans with more flexible terms than ordinary loans. From the agreement’s inception in December 2008 through to June 2009, 120 parents have received funding ranging from 50,000 to 150,000 francs.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Virgen De Fátima Group

texts.es:
El Comité Virgen de Fátima, es un excelente  comité conformado en fecha 19 de enero del 2.009, en  la Ciudad de Capiatá. 

Este grupo se formó  gracias a que la Sra. Gladys P., actual Directora de Finanzas, quien anteriormente ya integraba un comité, logró juntar a 18 integrantes, entre ellas vecinas y amigas, quienes se encuentran trabajando ya en el 4º ciclo del Programa del Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. 

Las integrantes de este grupo destinan su crédito a diferentes actividades  tales como: compra de frutas y verduras, compra ingredientes para la preparación de alimentos, compra de mercerías, compra de mercaderías para la despensa (azúcar, arroz, yerba, panificados, lácteos, carnes, etc.), venta de gallinas caseras, venta de helados, elaboración de croché, compra de tela para la fabricación de ropas, compra de artículos de librería, compra de pescados, etc. 

Es un grupo muy activo, todas las integrantes demuestran compañerismo y solidaridad, asisten a las reuniones semanales y realizan actividades para recaudar fondos para el bien común del grupo. 

Es uno de los mejores grupos que se encuentra trabajando con la Fundación Paraguaya, ya que la mayoría de las integrantes del grupo siguen activas desde el primer préstamo y con eso demuestran solidaridad y compañerismo.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Fátima Communal Bank is an excellent bank that was formed on the 19th of January, 2009, in the city of Capiatá. This group was formed thanks to Galdys P., current Director of Finance, who was previously a member of a communal bank. She was able to get together 18 members. Her neighbors and friends are among the members. They are working in the fourth cycle with the Committee for Enterprising Women Program. The members of this group will use the loan for their different activities such as buying fruits and vegetables, buying ingredients to make food, buying notions, buying merchandise for the grocery store (sugar, rice, dried leaves for tea, pastries, dairy products, and meat, etc), selling home-grown chickens, selling ice cream, making crochet, buying fabrics to make clothes, buying articles for the bookstore, and buying fish, etc. This is a very active group. All of the members demonstrate camaraderie and solidarity. They attend weekly meetings, and they carry out activities to collect funds for the common good of the group. It is one of the best groups to be found working with the Paraguaya Foundation because most of the group members are continuing activities from the first loan. This way they demonstrate camaraderie and solidarity.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise, raw materials, and animals for their businesses

loans.name: Alexandrine

texts.fr: A. Alexandrine est née le 19 Octobre 1956 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Alexandrine vit depuis 11 ans à Allomey à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique au Bénin. Alexandrine est mariée à ANATO Etienne, un militaire retraité. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés. Alexandrine vit  avec seulement deux des enfants. Alexandrine n'a fait que l'école primaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux des enfants, Alexandrine vend depuis environs 11 ans de la nourriture ("atassi" : mélange de riz et de haricot ; et aussi de "l'akassa" : aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs) à Allada. Alexandrine s'approvisionne également à Allada. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de l'institution. Tous les trois crédits ont été bien remboursés. Alexandrine sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé, dans le but d'élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux faire face à la demande des clients.
texts.en:
A. Alexandrine was born on October 19, 1956 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Alexandrine has lived in Allomey, in Allada, in the Atlantique Department of Benin for 11 years. Alexandrine is married to Anato Etienne, a retired military serviceman. They have six children, all educated; two of them still live at home.
Alexandrine only has a primary school education. To provide for her needs and those of her chidlren, Alexandrine has sold food (atassi, a mix of rice and beans, and l’akassa, a local dish made with corn starch) in Allada for roughly 11 years. Alexandrine also gets her supplies in Allada.
She is a long-time Alidé client, having already received and repaid three loans. Alexandrine is requesting a fourth loan from Alidé in order to improve her business and to better respond to customer demands.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 1 bag of flour, 2 bags of rice, 1 container of peanut oil and seasonings

loans.name: Jocelyne

texts.fr: AGBOWAÏ Jocelyne est née le 20 Septembre 1973 à Kétou au Bénin. Jocelyne vit depuis une dizaine d'année à Dogoudo à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique au Bénin. Mariée à ALLAGBE Eustache, un gendarme, Jocelyne est mère de trois enfants. Tous les enfants vivent avec Jocelyne, et seulement certains sont scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Jocelyne n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Depuis environs 5 ans, Jocelyne vend des chaussures à Allada. Jocelyne vend également des cartes de recharges téléphoniques et des tissus. C'est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, que Jocelyne s'approvisionne. Jocelyne a déjà obtenu deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. En vue d'agrandir son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Jocelyne sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Agbowaï Jocelyne was born on September 20, 1973 in Kétou, in Benin. Jocelyn has lived for some 10 years in Dogoudo, in Allada, in the Atlantique Department of Benin. She is married to Allagbe Eustache, a policeman, and is the mother of three children. All of the children live with her and some of them attend school. She and her husband provide for the family.
Jocelyne only has a primary school education. For roughly 5 years, Jocelyne has sold shoes in Allada. Jocelyne also sells phone cards and cloth. Jocelyne stocks up in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.
Jocelyne has already received and repaid two Alidé loans. In order to expand her business and better satisfy her customers, Jocelyne is requesting a third loand from Alidé.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 10 dozen shoes

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou N. est une femme de 52 ans qui habite a Yoff a la cite Apecsy  2.Elle est membre de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis janvier 2007 et a déjà bénéficié  d’un prêt antérieur Elle est mariée  et mère  de 7 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 13 et 35 ans C’est  par amour de l’activité  qu’elle s’est adonnée a la vente de petit déjeuner  dans une école  privée  qui se situe non loin de chez elle .Le développement de son activité depuis 2003 lui  permet de prendre  en charge la scolarité  de ses enfants. Par conséquent  elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs dans le but de d’acheter à des prix plus compétitifs  les denrées  qui lui permettent de préparer  son petit déjeuner pour les stocker.                                                                                                                       
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les femmes  à exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié
texts.en: Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: augmentation fond

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
El señor Ignacio Ramón Núñez  es de Jejui  – Choré,  tiene casa propia,  es casado, 29 años de edad.

      Tiene un minibús en el cual trabaja con la Empresa San Juan de Norte, en cual traslada a pasajeros desde el trayecto Cruce Liberación a Santa Rosa del Aguaray, en su tiempo libre también se dedica a la venta de panificados dentro de la ciudad distribuyendo el producto por los almacenes de los barrios. 
        El cliente quiere comprar un camión mas grande,para poder trabajar mejor ya que cuenta con muchos clientes y el transporte ya resulta insuficiente para la y aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ignacio Ramón Núñez is from Jejui – Choré. He is 29, married, and has his own house. He has a minibus, which he uses to work for the San Juan de Norte Company. He transports passengers from the Cruce Liberación route to Sana Rosa del Aguaray. During his free time he sells pastries in the city, distributing the product to neighborhood stores. He wants to buy a bigger vehicle to be able to work better. He has a lot of customers, and his minibus is not big enough. This way he will increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new tires for his vehicle

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El Sr. Hugo V. de 24 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres, en la ciudad de Caaguazú. 

 

    Hugo empezó con este negocio aproximadamente en el año 2.007,  con el dinero que trajo del lejano país España, donde fue en busca de trabajo, dicho capital lo invirtió en compra de mercaderías (ropas y zapatos), para comenzar a trabajar como vendadero ambulante asi lo hizo recorriendo por varias zonas de nuestro país, debemos destacar que en la actualidad ya tiene su clientela formada. 


   El invertiría este crédito en comprar más mercaderías, para aprovechar este fin de año que es una buena época de ventas.
texts.en:
Hugo V. is 24, single, and lives with his parents in the city of Caaguazú. Hugo started his business in the year 2007 with the money that he brought from the far away country of Spain, where he went to look for work. He used the money to buy merchandise (clothes and shoes) to start working as a street vendor. He did that by traveling to various areas in our country. We need to point out that he currently has fixed customers. He will use the loan to buy more merchandise to take advantage of the end of the year, which is a good time for sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise (clothes and shoes)

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus is 35 years old and married with 2 children. He sells motor parts at retail prices to his customers in the market in Ibadan, Oyo State. He has been in this business for 7 years. He hopes to expand his business. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers.

Festus hopes for a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more motor parts to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Mirna Elizabeth T. Gauto  es de la ciudad de Choré, tiene casa propia, casada, tiene una  hija, 37 años de edad.  Su marido es el señor Sinforiano Vera de 34 años de edad.

       Es propietaria de una despensa y librería con 6 años de funcionamiento, tiene buena ubicación en frente del Colegio Nacional de dicha ciudad.
      Su marido es constructor de obras, también tiene animales vacunos en su propiedad.
      Con el crédito que recibe de la fundación cada día su negocio esta creciendo mas.
texts.en:
Mirna Elizabeth T. Gauto is from the city of Choré. She is 37, married, has a daughter, and has her own house. Her husband, Sindoriano Vera, is 34. She is the proprietor of a grocery store and book store. It has been in business for six years. It is a good location, which is in front of the National School in Choré. Her husband is a construction worker. She also has cows on her property. With the loan that she receives from the foundation her business grows everyday.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise like sugar, flour, rice, oil, and pastries

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a very hard-working woman who lives in Ogbomoso town in Oyo State, Nigeria. She is 62 years old and married with 3 children.

Victoria sells provisions. She has been in this business for over 4 years and in LAPO microfinance for over 2 years. She puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. Victoria is requesting a loan of 80,000 to buy more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana is married with 5 children. At the age of 61, she is very hard-working women. She lives in Ogbomoso town in Oyo State, Nigeria.

Christiana sells palm oil to meet her standard of living. She been in this business for over 12 years and in LAPO Microfinance for over 2 years. Christiana is soliciting for a loan of 80,000 to purchase more products to meet the high demand of her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Fumilola

texts.en: Fumilola is 32 years old and married with 2 children. She sells motor parts at retail prices to her customers in the market in Ibadan, Oyo State.  She has been in this business for 10 years. She hopes to expand her business. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes for a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more motor parts to sell.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan A. de 64 años de edad, esta casado hace 43 años con la Sra. Julia Cabrera de 59 años de edad. El matrimonio tiene siete hijos todos mayor de edad y que están casados y cada uno se maneja en forma independiente. 

Don Juan tiene su negocio de despensa y verduleria ubicado dentro del mercado municipal de Caaguazú, desde año 1997,empezó con un capital que pudo juntar gracias a una buena producción agricola que tuvo ya que el señor tambíen se dedica a la agricultura, realiza repartos por los negocios de los barrios y la señora atiende el negocio del mercado. 

El cliente solicita el préstamo para la compra de frutas y verduras en general,  maiz, arroz, fideos, aceite de este modo poder surtir su negocio y dar a sus clientes una mayor variedad y calidad de productos.
texts.en:
Juan A., 64 and his wife Julia Cabrera, 59, have been married for 43 years. Their seven children all are grown and married and live independently. Juan has a grocery and fresh fruit and vegetable business, located in the municipal market of Caaguazú. He started the business in 1997 with the capital he was able to acquire from a good harvest, as he is also a farmer. While he does deliveries to different neighborhoods, Julia tends to the market stall. Juan is seeking this loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables as well as corn, rice, beans, and oil. In this way, he will stock the business and offer his clients a greater variety and quality of products.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy onions, tomatoes, pumpkins, cabbage, garlic, peas, corn, rice, beans, and oil.

loans.name: Fagbemi

texts.en: Fagbemi is 36 years old and married with a child. He sells foodstuffs at retail prices to his customers in the market in Ibadan, Oyo State.  He has been in this business for a long time. He hopes to expand his business. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Geovanny Melquiades

texts.en:
Geovanny Melquiades Z. R. lives in the Paraiso district of Guayaquil. He lives in a cement home with water and light; however, it lacks paved roads and a sewer system. He has 3 children, who are aged 7, 8 and 12; all are in the public school system.

Mr. Z. used to work in a food market called Montebello. One day he decided to bring some vegetables home to sell. He sold the products rapidly, so he decided to create a mini market in his home, and little by little it has grown. Now he has expanded it into a bazaar. He works from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. with his wife. Their best-selling items are rice, shampoo and cola.

Mr. Z. is trying to augment the bazaar portion of his store, so he is requesting a loan to buy clothes, stuffed animals and makeup. He says these items are especially popular around the holidays. Transportation of products is a huge obstacle for him, so in the future he hopes to have a vehicle. Any assistance in helping Mr.Z.`s business grow is very much appreciated!

loans.use: To buy clothes, stuffed animals, and makeup

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El señor José González Casco  es de Jejui, es casado, tiene 47 años, con casa propia,  esta casado con la señora Francisca Báez Godoy de 45 años de edad.

         Tiene despensa con 7 años de funcionamiento que es atendida por su señora, el señor trabajo como vendedor ambulante, vende artículos farmacéuticos y de mercerías en general, tiene una motocicleta en el cual se desplaza, También se dedica a la agricultura ( maiz y sesamo ).
Este crédito fue solicitado para la compra de mercaderías para abastecer la suba de demanda de estas épocas de fiestas.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose G. Casco is from Jejui. He's married, 47 years old, and owns his own home. He is married to Francisca Baez Godoy who is 45 years old.

He has a store that has been operating for 7 years, which is run by his wife. He works as a street vendor, selling pharmceutical items and general merchandise. He has a motorcycle he gets around in. He also works in agriculture (corn and sesame). This loan was requested for the purchase of merchandise to meet the rise in demand during this holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of general merchandise such as sugar, flour, baked goods, ingredients.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail is excited to take her Kiva loan. She a hard-working woman who lives in Ogbomoso town in Oyo State, Nigeria. She is 40 years old and married with 4 children. Her first child is 16 years old and still in secondary school and helping her mother in her business.

Abigail sells kerosene in her town. She has been in this business for over 16 years and with LAPO microfinance for over 2 years. Abigail is requesting a loan of 50,000. She will use this loan to invest in her business of selling kerosene; she will buy the kerosene in bulk to get a better price. She hopes that this loan will help her build a business that will be profitable and provide benefits for her children. She says thanks to all KIVA lender for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drums of kerosene to sell

loans.name: Crescencio

texts.es:
El  Sr. Crescencio Gustavo M.  es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Monte Alto, tiene 28 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Graciela Beatriz Lopez Rojas con 28 años de edad, Actualmente tienen 2 hijos todos en  edad escolar.
 
       Se dedica en las compras y ventas de menudencias en el Mercado Municipal de Santani, con clientela formada, buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales , señor muy trabajador, excelente cliente con nosotros y con otras entidades financieras.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción ya que pretenden ampliar el salón de ventas y comprar mas mercadería para satisfacer a sus cliente.
texts.en:
Mr. Crescencio Gustavo is from the Barrio Monte Alto neighborhood of the city of San Estanislao. He is 28 years old and married to Graciela Beatriz, also 28 years old. They have two school-aged children. He buys and sells the offal (entrails and internal organs of butchered animals) at the marketplace in Santani. He has an established clientele, a good income, and comes with good business and personal references. He is hard working and has an excellent reputation with us and other financial entities. He is requesting this loan in order to buy building materials so that he can expand his sales area and invest in more merchandise to satisfy his customers needs.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Blas

texts.es:
Blás tiene 39 años de edad está casado con Gabriela Benítez, de 32 años, quien trabaja como empleada pública, aportando para los gastos del hogar.
Blás primeramente trabajó con su padre como chofer desde muy temprana edad, luego de varios años pudo adquirir  para su propio camión con el objetivo de independizarse y realizar su actividad de fletero por cuenta propia, su servicio es muy solicitado por el bajo costo y buena atención que le presenta a sus clientes.
Necesita del préstamo para la compra de cubiertas para poner en buenas condiciones la herramienta de trabajo ya que en esta época se requiere mucho de camiones fleteros para el traslado especialmente de frutas como banana y piña hasta el central de abasto Asuncion.
texts.en:
Blas is 39 years old. He’s married to Gabriela Benitez, who is 32 years old and works as a public employee, providing for household expenses. Blas has primarily worked with his father as a driver since he was very young. After several years, he was able to purchase his own truck with the goal of becoming independent and realizing his work as a truck driver on his own. His service is often requested because of the low cost and the good service which he gives his customers. He needs a loan to buy tires to put his work tool in good condition, as in this era a lot is required of freight trucks for transportation, especially of fruit such as bananas and pineapples to the supply center of Asuncion.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires

loans.name: Ladimiro

texts.es:
El Sr. Ladimiro C. de 54 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Nelly Lezcano de 46 años de edad.

 El matrimonio tiene tres hijos de 23, 21 y 9 años de edad; el mayor de ellos esta cursando el 4to. Año de la carrera de Nutrición, el segundo está en el 3er. año de Derecho y el menor de ellos es un niño con Sindrome de Down. 

Don Ladimiro se encuentra al frente de una Despensa y Merceria el cual se inició en el año de 1.995 con un capital, fruto de su anterior trabajo como carpintero. 

En dicho negocio recibe la ayuda de su esposa, quien tambien se dedica a la elaboración de comestibles como empanadas, tortas, milanesas y con eso está llevando adelante el costo que representa hacer estudiar a sus hijos. 

El cliente solicita el préstamo para la compra de zapatillas,  suecos, mochilas, escobas, palo para repasar,  arroz,  aceite en lata, fideo,  harina, jugos en polvo. 

De este modo para surtir su negocio y dar a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Mr. Ladimiro C., who is 54 years old, is married to Mrs. Nelly Lezcano, who is 46. Together, they have three children aged 23, 21, and 9. The eldest is in his fourth year of Nutrition studies, the second one is a third-year law student and the youngest is a boy with Down Syndrome. Mr. Ladimiro runs a general store and haberdashery which he started in 1995 with money from his previous job as a carpenter. In his business he gets help from his wife who also works preparing pastries, cakes, and other foods which help fund their children's education. He is requesting a loan to purchase sneakers, clogs, backpacks, brooms, mops, rice, oil, noodles, flour, and powder drinks. This will let him increase his merchandise and give his customers a greater array of products.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria tiene 71 años, vive en casa propia, es madre soltera de 8 hijos, quienes son todos mayores de edad y profesionales gracias a su arduo trabajo y esfuerzo, actualmente  le ayudan hoy en día en el ingreso familiar.
Candelaria emprendió su  actividad hace más de treinta años   por iniciativa propia, como   en el  barrio  no tenían  un  almacén  de donde comprar los  productos  básicos  para  la canasta familiar. 
Candelaria es una señora muy sacrificada pues ella sola les crió a sus hijos y les dio la oportunidad para estudiar y obtener una profesión.
Actualmente su despensa es una de las más surtidas y cuenta con muchos clientes, precisa del crédito para la compra de azúcar, fideos, harina, carne vacuna, aceite, etc., que lo va a conseguir a muy bajo costo.
texts.en:
Candelaria is 71 years old. She lives in her own home. She is a single mother of eight children, who are all now adults and professionals thanks to her hard work and effort. Today they help her with the family income. Candelaria undertook her activity more than thirty years ago with her own initiative, as in her neighborhood they didn’t have a store from which to buy basic food products. Candelaria is a woman who makes a lot of sacrifices, she raised her children by herself and she gave them the opportunity to study and obtain a profession. Currently her store is one of the most fully stocked and has many customers. She needs a loan for the purchase of sugar, noodles, flour, beef, oil, etc., which she is going to buy for a very low cost.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as: baked goods, basic food products, fruits, vegetables, cleaning products.

loans.name: Ulongoni Group

texts.en:
Jambo (hello) from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania!

This is MwanaH. S. and the Ulongoni loan group seated at the Makumbusho Branch Office of Tujijenge Tanzania, Ltd. MwanaH. is 33 years old and married with three children. Her children are 15, 13, and 5 years old.

MwanaH. is a hairdresser and her specialty is weaving and braiding hair. Many of her clients are local Tanzanian Rastafarians. She has been in the business for five years, and works from 8 a.m. till 6 p.m. daily. She makes a weekly profit of 35,000 Tanzanian shilling (about US$26).
 
MwanaH. has had one previous loan from Tujijenge, which she used to buy the cotton and thread that she braids into people's hair to make dreadlocks and extensions. She hopes to use this loan to buy more of the same supplies.

In the photo, MwanaH. is sitting in the front row wearing a bright yellow dress. She is seated with the other members of her loan group. They will all hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. The Ulongoni group thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To buy cotton and thread for Rasta hair braids

loans.name: Thierno Hamidou

texts.fr: Monsieur Thierno K. est un homme marie, âgé de 45 ans. Il  habite a Guediawaye   plus précisément dans la localité  de Daroukhane.Il  est père de 4 enfants dont l’âge varie entre un et12 ans. Il  est photographe de profession .En même  temps  il fait des reportages dans les cérémonies .Monsieur K. a une activité diversifiée  car il s’active aussi dans l’élevage  de moutons .Il  fait chaque année  une opération  de vente de moutons  a l’approche  des  fêtes  de Tabaski. Monsieur  K. a choisi l’activité  de photographe reporter par amour du métier. Avant il  le faisait gratuitement  mais par la suite il s’est rendu compte qu’il a acquis  beaucoup d’expérience  et qu’il pouvait gagner sa vie avec ce métier C’est une personne qui est très  attachée  a sa clientèle  et se réjouit  toujours car  son travail coïncide  avec les grands moments de bonheur de  sa clientèle..L’objet de son prêt est de  réaliser  des calendriers en cette période  de fin d’années  pour faire plaisir et mieux fidéliser  ses clients. Le reste de l’argent servira à renforcer  son fond de roulement. Son souhait est de trouver un collaborateur sur et ambitieux et ouvrir un grand studio-labo. Par  conséquent   il sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs dans l’espoir de maximiser ses gains et mieux faire face a ses charges quotidiennes croissantes
texts.en:
Mr. Thierno K. is a 45-year old married man. He lives in the Guediawaye department, in the town of Daroukhane. He is the father of four children between the ages of one and twelve. He is a professional photographer, and he also does reporting on special events. Mr. K.'s activities are diverse, as he is also busy raising sheep. Every year he holds a sheep sale for the approaching Tabaski festival (Eid al-Adha). Mr. K. chose to be a photographer/photojournalist because his passion for the work. Before he worked for free, but he soon realized that he had acquired a great deal of experience, and that he could make his living with this work. He's very attached to his customers and is always very happy that his work coincides with the important happy moments in their lives. The loan would be used to make calendars for the new year to please his customers and better develop their loyalty. The rest of the money would serve to build up his operating budget. His wish is to find a reliable and ambitious associate and open a large studio and lab. Thus he is seeking a loan of 400,000 francs in the hope of maximizing his profits and better meeting his increasing daily expenses.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Anne-Marie

texts.fr: Z. Anne-Marie est née le 06 Octobre 1970 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à BOVIS Modeste, un peintre, Anne-Marie est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble à Dogoudo à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique, depuis environs 6 ans. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Anne-Marie a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Il y a trois ans que Anne-Marie s'est mise à vendre du riz et du jus de bissap à Allada. Anne-Marie vend également des glacières. C'est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, que Anne-Marie fait ses achats. Anne-Marie a bénéficié antérieurement de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Anne-Marie désire augmenter le volume de son activité, et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle ; ce qui lui permettra d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire. C'est ce qui amène Anne-Marie à solliciter un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Anne-Marie Z. was born on October 6, 1970, in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Modeste Bovis, a painter, Anne-Marie is the mother of four children, all in school. For about six years the family has lived together in the Dogoudo area of the town of Allada, in the Atlantique department. The couple shares the family expenses. Anne-Marie stopped going to school at the secondary level. Three years ago Anne-Marie began selling rice and bissap juice (a hibiscus flower drink). She also sells coolers (ice chests). Anne-Marie gets her supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Anne-Marie has already received two loans through Alidé which have both been paid back. Anne-Marie would like to build up her business and better serve her customers, which would permit her to increase her income. This is what has led Anne-Marie to request a third loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 4 bags of rice, 12 coolers, bissup packets and leaves

loans.name: Naida

texts.es:
La Sra. Naida C. de 32 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Juan López, tienen 2 maravillosos hijos. 

Doña Naida comenzó con este negocio aproximadamente en el año 2007.  Ellos vendieron una propiedad para adquirir un capital y emprender su propia microempresa , como si fuera poco el señor es funcionario de una entidad muy importante hace ya más de 8 años, ellos ahorraban parte del sueldo del señor para poder habilitar una ferretería, asi fue, y en la actualidad tienen muchos clientes. 

En la ferreteria atiende la señora Naida y al mismo tiempo ella cuida su casa y de esta forma logran economizar sus ingresos sin pagar empleados. La ferreteria necesita de algunas mejoras y complatar las mercaderias que hacen falta para no defraudar a los clientes y por lo mismo solicitaron el credito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Naida C. is 32 years old and is married to Mr. Juan López; they have 2 wonderful children. Mrs. Nadia started this business approximately in 2007. They sold a real state property to obtain capital and start their own small business; not only that, but Mr. López is an employee of an important organization for more than 8 years and they were saving part of his salary to setup a hardware store; they did and they currently have many customers. Naida tends the hardware store while also taking care of her home; this allows her family to save money by not hiring employees. The hardware store needs some improvements, as well as more inventory so as not to disappoint the customers. Naida and her husband are requesting the loan for this purpose.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for hardware store

loans.name: Oyedele

texts.en:
Oyedele is 35 years old and is married without children. He sells clothes at retail prices to his customers.

This is the high season for business and Oyedele hopes to meet the demands of his customers. He hopes for a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more clothes to sell.

Oyedele hopes to own a boutique in the future. He loves this business because of the profits he makes. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a focused, hardworking woman and is dedicated to her business. She puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers.

Gladys is 40 years old and is married with four children. She lives in Ogbomoso town in Oyo State, Nigeria.

Gladys sells foodstuffs in market and she has been in this business for over twelve years and in LAPO micro-finance for over two years. She is soliciting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ronke

texts.en:
Ronke is 47 years old and is married with four children. The eldest is 28 years old and they are all living in Ogbomoso town in Oyo State, Nigeria.

Ronke is very hard working. She treats patients with her native medicines and has been in this business for over twenty-three years and with LAPO micro-finance for over two years. With this business, she is able to support her family's basic needs and other necessities.

With the loan amount of N50,000, Ronke plans to expand her native medicine business, which is now booming. With this kind of business she hopes to increase her earnings in the long run and be able to better provide for her children's education. She says a big thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more native medicines to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 27 years old, is married, and lives happily with her husband in Ogbomoso town in Oyo State, Nigeria. Her husband is a pastor.

Margaret sells medicines in her town and she has been in this business for over eight years and with LAPO micro-finance for two years. She puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers.

Margaret needs a loan of 50,000 NGN to increase her pharmacy. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Eufracio

texts.es:
El señor Eufrasio M. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Tacagua, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y sus dos hijos pues su esposa falleció hace dos años.
El señor Eufrasio trabaja como empleado de la administración publica y su esposa es costurera independiente para vecinos de su zona y adyacentes, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de los muros de las habitaciones de su vivienda, así como el colocado de artefactos para habilitar su baño.
Esta es la segunda vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Eufrasio M. lives in his own home in Tacagua, which is on the west side of La Paz city. He lives with his wife and two children, his first wife died 2 years ago. Eufrasio works as an employee in public administration and his wife is an independent seamstress for neighbors in their area and nearby areas; these incomes are what support their family. The loan is to refurbish the bedroom walls of his home as well as items to remodel the bathroom. This is the second time that he seeks a loan and the socioeconomic evaluation qualifies him favorably and he can access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbish bedroom walls and remodel bathroom

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.fr: A. Charlotte est née en 1963 à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique au Bénin. Mariée à ZOSSOUNGBO Théophile, un maçon, Charlotte est mère de huit enfants, dont seulement un est à sa charge. Seulement certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Charlotte vit depuis 5 ans au quartier Gbowèlè  à Allada. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. N'ayant jamais été à l'école, Charlotte s'est mise depuis près de 17 ans, à vendre d'igname frit, des beignets de haricot et de la banane frite à Allada. A côté de cela, Charlotte vend également de l'akassa (aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs). Charlotte s'approvisionne au Mono et à Allada au Bénin. Charlotte a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. Charlotte sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire davantage sa clientèle.
texts.en:
A. Charlotte was born in 1963 in Allada, in the Atlantique Department of Benin. She is married to Zossoungbo Théophile, a bricklayer, and has 8 children, only one of whom is still a dependent. Some of her children have been educated. For 5 years, Charlotte has lived in the Gbowèlè negibourhood of Allada. She and her husband provide for the family.
Having never attended school, Charlotte has worked for 17 years selling fried yams, bean fritters and fried bananas in Allada. Charlotte also sells l’akassa (a local dish made with corn starch). Charlotte gets her supplies in Mono and in Allada.
Charlotte has already received and repaid two Alidé loans. Charlotte is requesting a third loan from Alidé to stock up on supplies and to better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 2 bags of flour, 1 bag of beans and 1 container of vegetable oil

loans.name: Wale

texts.en:
Wale is 45 years old and is married with 3 children.

He sells electronics at retail prices to his customers. This is the high season for his business, and he hopes to meet the demands of his customers. He hopes for a loan of NGN 120,000 to purchase more electronics to sell.

He hopes to expand his business in the future. He loves this business because of the personal interaction that he has with his customers. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more eletronics to sell

loans.name: Espiritu Santo Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Yaguarón, Km. 56 a 8 Kms. de la Oficina de Paraguarí, se reunieron unas mujeres con ganas de conformar un comité para acceder al préstamo, de ahí que coordinamos la reunión para interiorizarse sobre el programa, quienes aceptaron pues era una oportunidad para aumentar su capital de trabajo y recibir capacitación para crecer como persona, ellas son muy trabajadoras quienes nunca antes han recibido ningún tipo de apoyo crediticia.
El comité lleva por nombre Espíritu Santo, quienes se encuentran en el segundo ciclo integrada por 17  sacrificadas y luchadoras mujeres, quienes se esfuerzan a diario para mejorar la calidad de vida de ellas y de sus respectivas familias.
 Todas las integrantes son señoras muy activas, quienes han invertido sus préstamos en sus respectivas actividades.
Unas de las actividades muy común entra las mujeres que trabajan es la actividad a que se dedica Doña Delci A. quien posee un puesto frente a su casa en ella se encuentran todo tipo de ropa para diferentes edades y para hombres y mujeres, también tiene como anexo a ropería venta de zapatos, calzados deportivo, todos sus productos son bastantes económicos y cuenta con un número importante de clientela.
1
Alicia P.
Almacén

Despensa
texts.en:
In the city of Yaguarón, Km. 56, 5 miles from the Department of Paraguarí, a group of women got together to form a committee to request for a loan. From that idea, a meeting was coordinated to learn more about the program. Right after that, they agreed to the conditions of the same as this meant a great opportunity to increase their work capital and receive training. They are hard working women and they've never received any financial aid. The committee is called Espíritu Santo (Holy Spirit). This group is composed by 17 women; they work every day to improve their quality of life as well as their families’. All the members are very energetic women, who have already invested the money in their specific activities. One of the most common activities in this group is Delci A.’s. She owns a stand in front of her house where she sells apparel clothing. She also sells dress shoes and sport shoes. All her products are sold at fair prices and she has a regular clientele. Alicia P. – Grocery store / Ma. Concepción C. – Milk retail / Amelia C. – School supplies retail / Liz S. – Employee / Delci A. – Apparel clothing retail / Vivian L. – underwear retail / Celina P. – habersashery / Antonia E. – drinks retail / Miguela P. – Employee / Máxima F. Apparel clothing retail / Juana S. – Door to door sales woman / Elisa L. – Street vendor / Anastacia S. – Food retail / Sebastiana R. – door to door sales woman / Elvira C. – Food retail / Liz L. – Party items/snack food / Mercedes F. – Grocery store

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in meat, flour, corn, potatoes, bread-based products, pasta, dairy products, candy, apparel items, drinks, underwear, fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
El señor Wilfredo P. vive en casa en anticretico, en la zona  de Pura Pura, área periférica de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y su hijo.
El señor Wilfredo y su esposa trabajan como empleados en una institución privada de esta ciudad, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la ampliación del anticretico, ya que solo cuentan con una habitación siendo un ambiente  muy estrecho para su familia.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Wilfredo P. lives in an anticrético house. [This is an agreement where the tenant pays rent up front, in full, at the beginning of the rental contract--but then recieves it back in full at the end of the rental period. It is essentially a loan from the tenant to the owner of the property but, in the end, the tenant lives "rent-free"]. He lives in the Pura Pura neighborhood, an area on the outskirts of the city of La Paz, with his wife and son. Wilfredo and his wife work for a private business in this city, and their income supports their family. The requested loan is for building an addition to thier anticrético house, because it only has one room and this is very tight living quarters for the family. This is the first time that he has requested a loan and the background analysis that has been done shows him to be qualified for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build an additional room onto his anticrético house

loans.name: Maritza Dolores

texts.es:
Maritza C. de 26 años de edad, vive en la zona de Fortín de Guayaquil en una casa de cemento solo cuenta con agua como servicio básico, su esposo trabaja como operador de maquinas, con el tiene 2 hijos uno de 4 años que no estudia y otro de 2 años.

Maritza empezó sacando copias y así poco a poco saco la papelería con la idea que le iba a ir muy bien por lo que hay una escuela por su sector, ahora Maritza trabaja desde las 09h00 hasta las 22h30 vende cuadernos, golosinas, copias etc. Una de las mayores dificultades es tener que cuidar a sus hijos y al mismo tiempo tener que atender la papelería.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, dulces, papelería, para poder agrandar el negocio, en el futuro quiere tener un Cyber y así que sus hijos después lo puedan administrar.
texts.en:
Maritza C. is 26 years old. She lives in Fortín de Guayaquil in a brick house. The only basic service in her house is water. Her husband works as a machine operator. They have 2 children a 4 year old and a 2 year old. Maritza began making photocopies and little by little she opened her own stationary store. She was confident she will make a good profit as there's a school near her area. Today, Maritza works from 9am to 10:30pm. She sells notebooks, candy, photocopies and others. One of the hardest things to do for her is to take care of her children and working at the store at the same time. With this loan, she would like to purchase, notebooks, candy and stationary items to expand her business. In the future, she would like to open a cyber coffee that her children could manage when they grow up.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase notebooks, candy and stationary items

loans.name: Amy Lucía

texts.en:
Amy Lucía sells tomatoes and peppers in the Mayoreo market in Managua and has been doing this for six years. She initially started her business with a small loan and is requesting this loan to increase her inventory. She will use the loan to buy more tomatoes and peppers.

Amy Lucía is 27 years old and is married with one school-aged child. Before opening her business she was in school. Amy has been working with CEPRODEL for three years now and she credits loans with helping her maintain her business.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes and peppers to sell

loans.name: Abosede

texts.en:
Abosede O. is 41 years old and is married with a child.

She sells hair extensions at retail prices to her customers. This is the high season for her business, and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers.

She hopes for a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She loves this business because of the personal interaction that she has with her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Ana Mary

texts.es:
La señora Ana Mary A. vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona  de Llojeta, de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Ana Mary trabaja como tejedora en una microempresa de nuestra ciudad, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de un muro perimetral de su vivienda asegurando así la seguridad de la misma.
Esta es la cuarta vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Ana Mary A. lives in her parent's house, in the Llojeta neighborhood, in the city of La Paz. Ana Mary works as a weaver in the a small business in in our city and her income helps support her family. The loan she has requested is for building a wall around her house to make it more secure. This is the fourth loan that she has requested and the background analysis that has been done shows that she qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall around her house for improved security

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos C. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Tres Marías, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y su hijo. 
El señor Carlos trabaja como empleado de la administración publica y su esposa es vende verduras en el mercado de su zona, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de los techos de su vivienda ya que por su antigüedad presenta deterioro que con las lluvias son peligrosas para su familia.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Carlos C. lives in his own house in the Tres Marías neighborhood on the western slope of the city of La Paz, with his wife and son. Carlos works as a civil service employee and his wife sells vegetables in the neighborhood market. Their income supports their family. The requested loan is for repairing the roof of his house. Because of its age, it is deteriorated and it is dangerous for his family when it rains. This is the first time that he has requested a loan and the background analysis that has been done shows that he is qualified to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the roof of his house

loans.name: Daynor

texts.es:
El señor Daynor Correón vive en casa en anticretico, en la zona  de San Antonio, ladera este de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Daynor trabaja como empleado de la administración publica.
El crédito solicitado es para la adquisición de una vivienda social que será pagada a plazos, pero que requiere el aporte de una cuota inicial para su adjudicación.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Daynor Correón lives in a home under the “anticretico” rule. (Anticretico is a unique, legal method of housing in which the owner of the building allows a person to live for a determined amount of time in exchange for a set amount of money, which will be returned at the end of the living period.) He lives in the San Antonio zone, east of the city of La Paz. Mr. Daynor is a public administration employee. The loan that he is soliciting is to help him obtain social housing that will be paid for in installments, but requires an initial down payment. This is the first time he has asked for a loan but the socioeconomical analysis that was performed qualifies him favorably and he can access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Down payment for the purchase of a home

loans.name: Julian

texts.en:
Julian A. is 35 years old and married with 3 children.

She sells shoes and bags at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She hopes for a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more shoes and bags to sell.  

She loves this business because of the personal interaction that she has with her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
El señor Valentín M. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Munaypata, área periférica de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos.
El señor Valentín y su esposa trabajan en construcciones de viviendas particulares como albañil y ayudante respectivamente, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de una losa (es una base de cemento y arena que una vez vaciada se convierte en un piso duro) para luego construir habitaciones en planta alta de su vivienda, ya que las habitaciones que tiene no brindan espacio suficiente para su familia.
Esta es la octava vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Valentín M. lives in his own home in the Munaypata zone, an outlying district of the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife and their four children. Mr. Valentín and his wife work in housing construction as a bricklayer and assistant, respectively. Their incomes support their family. The loan that he is soliciting is to build a “losa” (which is a cement and sand base that once set becomes a hard floor) in order to later build bedrooms on the top floor of their home. The bedrooms that they currently have do not provide sufficient space for their family. This is the eighth time they have requested a loan and the socioeconomical analysis qualifies them favorably and they are able to access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cost of construction of a cement top floor in order to add on bedrooms to their home

loans.name: María Jesús

texts.en:
María has been selling fruits and vegetables for over twelve years in the Mayoreo market in Managua. Her stall is open air with a dirt floor. She sells a wide variety of goods including passion fruit, papaya, melon, yucca, quequisque (taro), and limes. She is planning to use the loan to invest in her business by purchasing additional merchandise such as papaya, yucca and squash to sell. 

María is a widow. Though she has no children living at home, she currently takes care of four of her grandchildren. She has been working with CEPRODEL for about three years now. She credits the loans from CEPRODEL with allowing her to continue maintaining her business and moving forward. She said it also helps her to avoid working with a moneylender.

loans.use: To buy inventory like papayas, yucca, quequisque and squash

loans.name: Pamile

texts.en:
Pamile is a mechanical engineer. He has his shop in Ogbomoso town in Oyo State, Nigeria. He is 40 years old and married with 4 children. Pamile has been in this business for over 10 years and with LAPO microfinance for over 2 years. One of his greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction he is able to have with his customers.

Pamile is soliciting a loan of 150,000 to improve in his mechanical engineering field. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more instruments for working

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: S. Julienne est née en 1950 à Abomey Calavi, dans le département de l'Atlantique au Bénin. Il y a environs 20 ans que Julienne réside à Dogoudo à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique au Bénin. C'est une veuve, qui est mère de six enfants dont deux sont à sa charge. Tous les enfants de Julienne sont scolarisés. Julienne vit seule avec les deux enfants à sa charge, et supporte seule leurs charges. Julienne a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au cours secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Julienne vend des produits vivriers à Allada. C'est à Savè, dans les Collines au Bénin, que Julienne s'approvisionne. Julienne exerce cette activité depuis environs 38 ans. Julienne avait bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. Julienne sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue d'augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux satisfaire la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Julienne S. was born in 1950 in Abomey Calavi in the department of Atlantique in Benin. She has been living for about 20 years in the neighborhood of Dogoudo in Allada, located also in the department of Atlantique. She is a widow and the mother of six children. She provides for the needs of two of them. All her children attend or have attended school. Julienne lives alone with the two children for whom she cares, and is the sole provider for them. Julienne attended school until secondary level.

To support herself and her children, Julienne sells food products in Allada. She gets her supplies from Savè in the department of Collines. She has been in this business for 38 years. So far she was granted two loans from Alidé and repaid them on schedule. Julienne came now to Alidé and applied for a third loan, which she will use to increase her inventory and better meet the ever increasing demand from her customers.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 8 sacks of soya beans

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El Señor Roberto de 37  años de edad se encuentra aconcubinado con la Sra. Ramona de 20 años. 
 La pareja tiene una hija de 2 años de edad.

Don Roberto actualmente cuenta con su propio negocio donde se desempeña como técnico dental, tambien 2 dias a la semana sale por las zonas de Vaqueria y Carpa cué donde también presta servicio para sus clientelas. 

Además su Sra. posee una despensa, en dicho negocio le va  muy bien ya que cuenta con una clienta formada gracias a la buene atencion que les ofrece a sus clientelas. 

Como sueño personal desea ampliar más su negocio para llegar a abrir un salón mas agradable y de primera calidad para que la clientela se sientan comodos por el servicio que les ofrece. 

El cliente solicita el crédito para la compra de un congelador para su uso en su negocio.
texts.en:
Roberto is 37 years old. She lives her common-law wife Ramona, who’s 20. They have a 2 year old daughter. Roberto owns an office where he works as a dental technician. He also makes home visits twice a week in the areas of Vaqueria and Carpa cué. His wife owns a grocery store. She’s makes a good profit because she has a large clientele thanks to her high quality service. His personal dream is to expand her wife’s business and open a first quality store to provide a more comfortable service to her clients. The client is requesting for a loan to purchase a freezer to use in a store.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a freezer

loans.name: Odily Del Socorro

texts.en:
Odily del Socorro sells watches, underwear, and personal products in the Ivan Montenegro Market in Managua. She is asking for a loan to purchase watches to expand her inventory. She has been working in the market for about 11 years. Before she had her stall in the market, she sold her products “ambulante,” which means while walking around.

Odily del Socorro is married and has two children in her care. Both of her children are school aged. She has been working with CEPRODEL for about 4½ years. In this time, she said, loans have helped her increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy watches

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban tiene 43 años está acompañado con la señora Antonia López, tienen una hija de 12 años que acaba de culminar la primaria.
