loans.use: To buy merchandise: rice, beans, sugar, soap to wash clothing, eggs, oil and others.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es: Hilario tiene 53 años esta casado con Enedina de 47 años y juntos tienen 5 hijos, pero sólo viven con 2 de ellos, Joseline de 17 y Sharon de 6 años, en su casa propia fabricada de adobe (adoquines de barro), paja y tejas. Desde hace 26 años y con la ayuda de su esposa se dedican a la agricultura de papa, maíz, alverja, productos agrícolas de la sierra peruana, así como también cultiva verduras y flores en variedad. Es así que esta humilde pareja empieza su jornada laboral desde las 4 de la madrugada para regar sus cultivos, luego regresan a su domicilio a preparar el alimento de sus hijas para que vayan a estudiar, posteriormente regresan al trabajo hasta que caiga la noche. Según Hilario, nos comenta que muchas veces él y su esposa no regresan a casa y aprovechan la noche para continuar con el trabajo y pese a las variaciones climáticas hacen del trabajo mas sacrificado. Al final tiene su recompensa, ya que le resulta gratificante la cosecha, ya que obtiene buenas ganancias económicas que le ayudan a la manutención de su familia.  Para Hilario la agricultura significa toda su vida, ya que aprendió desde muy pequeño y le sirvió para sacar adelante a su familia, por tal motivo espera mas adelante sembrar en mayor cantidad, y paralelo a ello dedicarse a la crianza de ovinos, porcinos y tener 3 cabezas de ganado para luego comercializarlos a buen precio. Siendo un hombre que desea mejorar, solicita un crédito con MFP, esta es su octavo crédito y lo más importante para él es seguir trabajando con sus compañeros de su grupo comunal. Con el préstamo que solicita desea comprar varios porcinos para engordarlos y en el futuro tener una granja para así vender la carne de porcinos en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad ya que tiene gran demanda de los compradores.
texts.en:
Hilario is 53, and he is married to Enedina who is 47. They have five children, but only two of them live with them. Joselina is 17, and Sharon is 6. They live in their own house, which is made from adobe (clay cobblestones), straw, and tile. For 26 years, with help from his wife, he has been growing potatoes, corn, and peas. These are agricultural products from the Peruvian mountain range. He also grows vegetables and a variety of flowers. This humble couple starts their day’s work at four in the morning in order to water their crops. They then return home to prepare food for their daughters to go to school. They later return to work until nightfall. According to Hilario, there are many times that he and his wife do not return home, and they take advantage of the night to continue working. Due to the climate changes, they do the most self-sacrificing work. At the end, they have their recompense because the harvest is gratifying. They get good earnings, which helps support their family. To Hilario, agriculture represents his whole life. He learned to farm when he was very small, and it has served him to get his family ahead. That is why he hopes to later plant a larger quantity. At the same time, he raises sheep, pigs, and three heads of cattle to later sell at a good price. Being a man who wishes to improve, he is asking for a loan with MFP. This is his eighth loan. The most important thing to him is to keep working with his colleagues in his communal bank. He wishes to use the loan to buy various pigs to fatten. In the future he wants to have a farm in order to sell pork in the wholesale market in his city. There is a great buyers’ demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.es: Victoriana  tiene 31 años y vive con Miguel de 45 años, con quien desea tener un hijo pronto, por lo que buscan estabilizarse económicamente, habitan en una casa que es alquilada.Desde hace un año y medio se dedica a la cocina ; trabaja en un restaurante en una zona comercial y en ese lugar  aprendió  todos los secretos para atender a los mas exigentes comensales, considera que la venta de comida es bastante rentable; Victoriana no gana lo suficiente, pero si le alcanza para su manutención, además cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposo, quien se dedica a realizar servicio de transporte en un motocarro en la ciudad, se ha dado cuenta que el negocio de comida  es bastante rentable, por lo que desea aperturar un restaurante de comidas típicas de la selva del Perú, además de comprar un motocarro , y brindarlo en alquiler ; también tiene planeado comprar un inmueble en la ciudad, en una zona céntrica y construir su casa para instalar ahí en el negocio de venta de comida.Es el primer préstamo que  tiene con MFP y sabe que pagará puntualmente sus cuotas porque es muy responsable.El dinero del préstamo, lo invertirá en la compra de un motocarro  y brindarlo en alquiler para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Victoriana is 31 years old and lives with Miguel, who is 45, and with whom she would like to have a child soon. This is why they are seeking to become financially stable. They live in a rented house. For a year and a half now, she works cooking; she works at a restaurant in a commercial zone and in that place she learned all the secrets to tend to the most demanding customers. She considers selling food fairly profitable. Victoriana does not make enough, but she can support herself and in addition she can count on the financial support of her husband who offers the service of transportation in motocar in the city. She has realized that the food business is fairly profitable so she wants to open a restaurant of food traditional to the jungle of Peru, in addition to buying a motorcar and offer it for rent. She also has planned to buy a property in the city, down town, and build her house to set up her food selling business there. This is her first loan with MFP and she knows she will make the payments punctually because she is very responsible. She will invest the money from the loan in buying a motorcar to offer it for rent and obtain greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a motocar to expand her own business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying merchandise; rice, beans, sugar, soap, eggs, oil, and others

loans.name: Ana Miriam

texts.es: Ana Miriam L. D. M. D. 37 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Ilopango el cual esta ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Su grupo familiar esta conformado por su esposo, el cual es empleado en una fábrica, y sus dos hijos menores D. edad. Ella posee una venta D. ropa para niños y adultos, así mismo comercializa perfumes para hombre y mujer.  Ella comercializa sus productos D. forma ambulante, y así mismo venD. en su casa. Ana solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. ropa, así mismo poder comprar ropa D. mayor calidad, que sea variada para tratar D. llamar la atención D. más personas, y además comprar diferentes tallas y colores. El mayor deseo D. Ana es el D. poder obtener el dinero necesario para mejorar la estabilidad económica D. su familia, y D. esta manera poder brindarle todo lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana Miriam L. D. M. is 37 years old, she lives in the county of Ilopango which located in the department of San Salvador. Her family group is maD. up of her husband who is employed at a factory, and her two young children. She owns a store that offers clothing for children and adults as well as perfumes for men and women. She sells her products on the street and she also sells at her house. Ana requests a loan through which she will be able to buy greater quantities of clothing as well as better quality clothing and a greater variety of it so that she can catch the attention of more people. She also wants to buy different sizes and colors. Ana's greatest wish is to make the money necessary to improve her family's financial stability and in that way be able to offer her children everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothing and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Gilda

texts.es: Gilda S., reside en Ilopango, departamento de San salvador. Vive en casa propia, tiene dos hijos los cuales residen en Estados Unidos, razón por la cual ella vive sola. A sus 69 años de edad, Gilda es una persona muy trabajadora, la cual se esfuerza a diario vendiendo pupusas en su casa. Este negocio lo posee desde hace 5 años, y es el cual le permite obtener el dinero necesario para todos sus gastos personales. Gilda solícita un préstamo, ya que desea poder mejorar las ventas de su negocio y es solo de esta manera como ella puede obtener el capital necesario para comprar bebidas y toda la materia prima para la elaboración de las pupusas. Gilda desea poder vender más, ya que este negocio es la única fuente de ingresos seguros que tiene, debido a que sus hijo le mandan remesas las cuales no recibe siempre, es por ello que Gilda trabaja mucho para mantener su negocio de manera estable, ya que es este el cual le permite poder solventar todos los gastos de su casa.
texts.en:
Gilda Sanchez lives in Ilopango, San Salvador Department. She lives in her own house and has two children who live in the United States, which is why she lives alone. At 69 years of age, Gilda is a very hard working person who strives daily to sell pupusas in her house. She ha owned this business for 5 years and it is through it that she can obtain the money necessary for her personal expenses. Gilda requests a loan because she wants to improve her business' sales and this is the only way she can obtain the necessary capital to buy drinks and raw ingredients to prepare her pupusas. Gilda wants to sell more because this business is her only secure source of income because her sons send her money she doesn't always get. This is why Gilda works very hard to keep her business stable given that it is her business which allows her to support all of her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying raw materials to make pupusas, and buying drinks

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna E. Vda. D. V. D. 40 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Ilopango, en el departamento D. San Salvador, vive en casa propia junto a su compañero D. vida, dos hijos, uno D. los cual es mayor D. edad, el cual tiene un hijo D. un mes D. nacimiento, y junto a la esposa D. su hijo mayor. Reyna posee una venta D. frutas y verduras, las cuales las comercializa desD. su pick up en diferentes pueblos y ciudades, los cuales se ubican cerca del departamento D. San Salvador. Ella trabaja para poder pagar los gastos del hogar y así mismo para solventar las necesidades D. su hijo menor, el cual le ayuda en el negocio en vacaciones. Reyna solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. frutas y verduras, esto con el fin D. poder obtenerlas a precios menores, y así mismo tener más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes. Reyna desea poder mejorar sus ventas y verlas reflejadas en la estabilidad económica D. su hogar.
texts.en:
Reyna E., widow of V. is 40 years old. She lives in the county of Ilopango in the department of San Salvador. She lives in her own house together with her lifetime companion and two children, one of whom is adult and has a one-month-old baby, and her eldest son's wife. Reyna sells fruits and vegetables out of her pick up truck in different towns and cities which are located near the department of San Salvador. She works to be able to pay the household expenses and also to over the needs of her youngest child who helps her with her business during vacations. Reyna is requesting a loan through which she will be able to buy a greater quantity of fruits and vegetables with the goal of being able to offer them at lower prices to her customers. Reyna would like to improve her sales and to see that reflected in the financial stability of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita C. makes sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Angel C., a carpenter, they are blessed with nine children.  She earns money so their family can have a better life.  Rosita has two businesses: she has made curtains for 10 years and has operated a food cart as a vendor for more than three years.

Rosita is a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT).  She attends their weekly meetings and pays her dues consistently.  Because of her good repayment performance, she was able to borrow a sixth time from CCT.  The reason she was consistent in paying her dues was because she used almost all the money she borrowed to buy Filipino finger foods to resell.   Her business earns a profit of PHP 13,000 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan to expand her business by buying flour, fish balls and seasoning for her food cart business.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow and that she and her family will have good health always. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: Bjy food to resell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia C. is from the village of Tigdok Tdela, Misamis, Occidental. She is 49 years old.  Lilia is widowed and has three school-aged children.  To make a living, Lilia raises livestock.  Her main source of income comes from raising and selling pigs. Lilia has been in business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Lilia joined PMPC to access financial services and to help improve her living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future.  Lilia is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 15th from PMPC.  Lilia plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income. 
-------------------------------
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase livestock feed and supplies.

loans.name: Edgen

texts.en:
Edgen R. runs a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in her community. She is 31 years old, married and has one young child (pictured). They are from the town of Taguima, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Edgen has been in her business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2005, Edgen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Edgen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Edgen is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 7th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda C., 57, manages her own sewing shop. Married to Carito C., a security guard, they are blessed with four children. She earns money so their family can have a better life.  Her shop has been making and selling clothes for ten years.  She employs four people.

Rosalinda has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than three years now.  She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow nine times from CCT.  She earns a net income of PHP 11,000 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan to expand her business by buying fabric and other materials needed for make clothes.  She hopes that her business will continue to grow so she can help her four sewers support their own families. 
------------------------------
All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: Buy fabric for making clothes.

loans.name: Romelio

texts.es: Romelio A. de 44 años de edad, reside en San José Villanueva. Vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Romelio como todo hombre de hogar, trabaja arduamente por llevar el sustento diario a su casa y sostener a su familia, él posee un negocio en el cual compra y vende materiales de construcción, así mismo los reparte con los diferentes clientes, lo cual le permite obtener ganancias extras ya que cobra adicional el servicio a domicilio. Romelio solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más  materia de construcción, esto debido a que dentro de sus planes esta el extender su negocio, esto en vista que sus hijos pronto asistirán a la universidad y Rogelio desea poder darles los estudios superiores, todo con el fin de poder brindarles un mejor presente y así mismo un mejor futuro como personas profesionales, los cuales puedan tener una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Romelio A. is 44 years old and resides in San Jose Villanueva. He lives together with his wife and their three young children who are in school. Romelio, like any family man, works hard to maintain his home and support his family. He has a business in which he purchases and sells construction materials. Likewise, he delivers them to his clients, which enables him to obtain extra earnings, since he charges a fee for home delivery. Romelio is requesting a loan to be able to purchase more construction materials, due to his plans to expand his business. This is in preparation for his children attending college soon, and Rogelio desires to be able to provide them with their higher education, all with the objective of giving them a better life and likewise a better future as professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to sell

location.town: San José Villanueva, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Surenhorol

texts.en:
E. operates a business making wood products in his town. The business is very family oriented, as his wife sells the products while he makes them. He started this business in 2009 after managing a hair salon with his mother for 6 years. He is continuing with the hair salon as well as his furniture making business.

E. is 27 years old and lives with his wife and 7-year-old son in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent). His wife helps with the family business by selling secondhand goods and the wood products out of a shipping container in their town.

Their business has been successful and they have grown a stable operation. Using his savings, E. has been able to support his family. E. attributes his success to the quality of his products, which are much desired by his customers. He is planning to have his own factory in the future. He is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more wood and paint for the business.

loans.use: To purchase more wood and paint

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva M. is from the village of Centro Napu, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Eva is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Eva owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Eva has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Eva joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Eva is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Eva from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elmer Alirio

texts.es: Elmer Alirio M. R. de 31 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, en el departamento de Morazán. Él vive en casa rentada y es soltero. Posee un negocio en el cual vende llaves, chapas y alarmas. Cuenta con muy buena clientela ya que el se destaca por ser muy amable y responsable con sus clientes. Elmer solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar materia prima para la elaboración de llaves. Él es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo el cual desea seguir adelante con su negocio y en un futuro poder ampliarlo, ya que este es la única fuente de ingresos que posee, es por ello que desea poder invertir en el para poder crecer y de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan tener un mejor estilo de vida en la cual pueda tener la tranquilidad de contar con lo más básico y necesario.
texts.en:
Elmer Alirio M. R. is 31 years old. He lives in San Francisco Goteras, in the department of Morazán. He lives in a rented house and is single. He has a business selling keys, locks, and alarms. He has a lot of clients because he stands out for being very friendly and responsible toward his customers. Elmer is requesting a loan for purchasing raw materials for making keys. He is very dedicated to his work and he wants to continue with it and eventually expand it, since this is his only source of income. He wants to invest in the business so that it can grow and he can increase his income. This will allow him to have a better standard of living so he can have the peace of mind of having the basics and necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making keys

location.town: San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán

loans.name: Munhbayar

texts.en:
Munhbayar operates a retail meat business in his town. Munhbayar delivers meat to local cafes for use in their food preparation. He also has individual customers who buy his meat on a regular basis. He began his business in 2000 and, after several years of operation, he has managed to establish himself in the business community.

Munhbayar is 37 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent). His oldest daughter attends the local secondary school and his wife helps with the meat trading business.

Munhbayar started with working capital of 300,000 tugrug (~ $210 US). Because of his business success, he has managed to improve their quality of life. Now his working capital exceeds 2,800,000 tugrugs (~ $2,000 US). He says, "I want to expand my business in the future and have my own working space." Munhbayar is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase several cows which he will use for his meat business.

loans.use: To purchase several cows

loans.name: Munhjargal

texts.en:
Munhjargal operates a transportation service between the countryside and the capital of the province. He started this business in 2008 after working as an interior decorator of houses and buildings for several years. Munhjargal is 43 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a house in Chingeltei district, Ulaanbaatar city, which is the capital of Mongolia. His oldest child, age 16, goes to a local secondary school while the youngest has not yet reached school age.

After several successful years in business, Munhjargal has been able to afford to buy a larger, more reliable truck. Recently, he has also been able to build a home for his family with his transportation earnings. Munhjargal works very hard to provide for his family and to pay for his oldest son's education. He says, “My only wish is to support my children’s education and have them become good people.” Munhjargal is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase parts for his truck.

loans.use: To purchase parts for his truck

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en:
Narangerel is a 44-year-old single mother who lives alone in a province of Mongolia. All her children live on their own. She lives in a Mongolian traditional tent called a ger.

Narangerel has been able to support herself because of the success of her consumer goods and grocery trading business. She started her business in 2004 with working capital of 800,000 tugrug (~$560 US) which has increased to 2,000,000 tugrug (~$14,000 US) since. The increased profits are due to her good business skills and good customer service. She has cultivated very good relationships with both her customers and suppliers and believes that these relationships are the key to her success.

Narangerel would like to expand her product offerings and is therefore requesting a 1,800,000 tugrug loan in order to buy a greater variety of products to sell.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products

loans.name: 1.7 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Hoa P. Thị (37) runs a food stall selling pork products in her community. She is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Hoa is married and has two school-age children. Hoa has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000,000 dong (VND) a month.

In 2008, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Hoa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,963,500 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women which was used to purchase products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her third loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hoa plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Hoa is the leader of a three member group accessing a loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "1.7 Nam Ngạn".

About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. H. Thị Hà (36) is a 24-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector. 2. N. Thị Thanh (38) is a 58-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in Thanh Hoa province.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Hoa P. Thị (37) là 32 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa. Hoa là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 1.7 Nam Ngạn (1.7 Nam Ngạn).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ T.t heo trong cộng đồng địa phương. Hoa thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Hoa kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND. Vào 2008, Hoa đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Hoa đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1.963.500 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. H. Thị Hà (36) là 24 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. 2. N. Thị Thanh (38) là 58 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena L., 35, wants nothing more than for her children to have a bright future. She is married to Orlando L., a factory worker, and they are blessed with one child who is studying in grade school. Rowena makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store for three years.

Rowena joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) in 2008. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow eight times from CCT’s Cooperative. The reason why she was consistent in paying her dues was because she used all the money she borrowed as added capital for her store business. Her business now lets her earn a net profit of PHP 10,000 per month.

Now with your help, Rowena would like to apply for a PHP 18,000 loan. This amount will be used mostly as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying sacks of rice, charcoal, soft drinks and other household commodities for her store.

Rowena dreams that her variety store will continue to grow and become a grocery so that they will have enough savings for the college education of their children.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Sandra Janeth

texts.es: Sandra Janeth P. S., tiene 25 años de edad, y reside en el departamento de Morazán, vive junto a su extensa familia, la cual esta conformada por su madre, dos hermanos, una cuñada y su padrastro. Sandra es una persona soltera, la cual trabaja para poder sostener sus necesidades básicas y así mismo para brindar su ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Ella trabaja junto a su madre y su hermana elaborando platillos típicos salvadoreños, así mismo vende refrescos naturales de frutas. Cada día Sandra ayuda a su madre a elaborar la comida y las bebidas, las cuales son comercializadas enfrente de su casa de habitación, estas se venden por las tarde, y cuentan con bendición de poseer mucha clientela. Sandra solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar todos los ingrediente necesarios para la comida que elaboran. Ella es una persona muy positiva la cual desea poder seguir adelante con su negocio y de esta manera poder brindarle la ayuda necesaria a su familia tanto con su trabajo como con el dinero que obtiene en el negocio.
texts.en:
Sandra Janeth P. S. is 25 years old and she lives in the department of Morazán. She lives with her extended family, which is composed of her mother, two brothers, a sister-in-law, and her step-father. Sandra is a single woman, and she works to provide the basic necesities and to help with the household expenses. She works with her mother and her sister making typical Salvadoran food. She also sells natural fruit drinks. Each day Sandra helps her mother make the food and the drinks, which they sell in front of their house in the afternoons, and they are blesed to have many customers. Sandra is requesting a loan with which she can buy all of the ingredients necessary for the food they make. She is a very positive person and she hopes to continue with her business so that she can provide the help necessary to her family, through both her work and the money she earns with the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making food

loans.name: Soraida

texts.en:
Soraida B., 49, wants nothing more for her business except to acquire more customers. She is married to Fredie B., a vendor, and they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. Her business is selling homemade hamburgers and selling snacks.

Soraida has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for two years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow nine times from CCT’s Cooperative. The reason why she was consistent in paying her dues was because she used almost all the money she borrowed as capital money for her burger stand. Her business now lets her earn a net profit of PHP 3,620 per month.

Now with your help, Soraida would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying bread, and hamburger patties for her business. The profits that she will earn from her business will be saved so that she can use it for house repairs.

Soraida dreams that someday she can have a bigger burger stand and a restaurant.

loans.use: To buy bread and hamburger patties for her business

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida G., 44, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Rico G., a driver, and they are blessed with four children. She helps her husband earn money so that their family can have a better life. She has been making and selling rags and doormats for her business.

Aida has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT)* for more than two years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow seven times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses all the money she borrows to buy raw materials needed to make rags and doormats. Her business earns 3,600 Philippine pesos per month.

Now with your help, she is applying for a 17,000 PHP loan. This money will be mostly used as added capital to expand her business by buying strips of recycled clothes to be used for her rag-making business. She dreams that her business will continue to improve so that her livelihood will improve as well. She also prays that someday all her children will have a bright future.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy recycled clothes for her rag-making business

loans.name: Oktyabr

texts.en: Oktyabr is a 48-year-old single mother who lives with her two children in Chingeltei district, Ulaanbaatar city, which is the capital of Mongolia. She lives together with her family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. She has two gers. She lives with her youngest daughter in one of them and her oldest son lives with his family in the other one. Oktyabr operates a grocery trading business in her town. She sells a variety of products such as vegetables, fruits, canned products and so on. Oktyabr started her business in 1995 in a rented stall at a local market called "Bumbugur". It is one of the popular and crowded markets in Ulaanbaatar city. Since then, she has built a stable operation and hopes to expand in the near future by expanding her product line. Now her working capital exceeds 2,500,000 tugrugs (~1800 USD) with a monthly net profit of 500,000 tugrugs (~350 USD). She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan to purchase vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Altanhuyag

texts.en: Altanhuyag is 41 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. His three daughters and a son go to a local secondary school while his wife helps with the family business. Altanhuyag lives in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Altanhuyag operates a meat trading business in his town and provides a variety of meats for his customers. He started his meat trading business in 2005 with capital of 800,000 tugrugs (~560 USD), and has gained much business experience over the years. Today he has a very loyal customer base and his working capital exceeds 2,000,000 tugrugs (~1400 USD). In the future, Altanhuyag is planning to expand his business. He hopes to own his own workspace one day and buy a car for his family to use. He is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD) loan to purchase meat to sell.

loans.use: To purchase meat to sell

loans.name: Batchimeg

texts.en: Batchimeg is 28 years old and lives with her husband and 2-year-old son in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. She and her husband live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband works as a customer relations staff member at XacBank, a partner of MFI. Batchimeg operates a grocery trading business in their town. She began her business in 2008 and since then she has been able to expand her business to sell larger quantities of food items. Batchimeg wants to keep expanding the amount of products her stall sells so that the number of customers will increase in the future. She says, “My wish is to have my own grocery shop in the future.” Batchimeg is requesting a 2,300,000 tugrug loan to purchase a large amount of groceries to sell in the upcoming winter months.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Bayaraa

texts.en: Bayaraa is 50 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Dornogobi province, Mongolia. He and his wife live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His oldest son works and his youngest is in the university. Bayaraa operates a felt-making business in his town with the help of his wife. Bayaraa has worked as a driver for most of his life and started producing felt in 2009 as a way to increase his income. But before starting his felt-making business, he and his wife used to manage a consumer goods trading business which gave them much experience and knowledge about business operations. His recent success and earnings have enabled him to purchase his own tools and equipment. Bayaraa and his wife have found much success producing felt and have many customers that demand their high quality product. For the future, he dreams of one day opening a felt production factory. Bayaraa is requesting a 650,000-tugrug loan to purchase wool to make felt products.

loans.use: To purchase wool to make felt products

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina O., 57, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Leonicio O., she and her husband manage their own variety store. 

Josefina has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow four times in CCT’s Cooperative.  The reason she was consistent in paying her dues was that she used almost all the money she borrowed as capital for her business.  Because of this, she now earns a net income PHP 3,400 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be mostly used to buy more stock for her store, like assorted snacks, sachets, shampoos, laundry powder, candies and chocolates.

She dreams that one day she will have her own grocery store and that their lives will be more comfortable. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy stock for her store like assorted snacks, sachets, shampoos, laundry powder, candies and chocolates

loans.name: Daribazar

texts.en:
Daribazar operates a clothing business from a rented shipping container in the local market. He began his business in 2007 after running a meat trading business for two years. Eventually he plans to purchase the rented container so that he can have his own work space to sell his clothing and hopefully grow his profits.

Daribazar is 41 years old and lives with his wife and 17-year-old daughter in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. The family lives together in a ger (a traditional nomadic Mongolian tent). His daughter attends the local secondary school while his wife helps with the family business.

With his hard work and good business sense, Daribazar has been able to improve his family’s quality of life. He is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase a large stock of winter clothes for his retail business.

loans.use: To purchase a large stock of winter clothes

loans.name: Jargal

texts.en:
Jargal operates a grocery in her town. She started her business in 2000 with a little booth in town. Since then, she has built a stable operation and hopes to expand her product lines in the near future. 

Jargal is 47 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Uvs province, Mongolia. She lives together with her family in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent). Her oldest son currently works for a private company as a fireman and her younger two sons attend a local secondary school. Her husband manages a transportation service to help improve their quality of life. 

Jargal's working capital has now reached 1,200,000 tugrugs (~$840 US). Her dream is to open her own grocery shop one day. She is requesting a 300,000 tugrugs loan to purchase vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en:
Narangerel H. has a small business in computer games. She is a 50-year-old single mother of two children. She currently lives with her two children in Tuv province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her daughter is 25 years old and works as a teller in a local bank. Her son is 20 years old and helps with his mother's business.

Narangerel runs a small PC game center where she has three PC computers. Local kids play various PC games by the hour. She has been running the game business since 2008 with the help of her son. She is expanding her business by adding two more computers as the demand for the PC games stays high. She says that although it is a business for her, it is doing really well and the local kids love playing computer games. She says that whoever works hard and looks for good business ideas can do well in the local business environment. She works hard with her son to make this business as successful as possible.

Narangerel requests a loan to purchase two more computers for her newly emerging business. In the photo, Narangerel is standing on the right side.

loans.use: To purchase two more computers

loans.name: Mendbayar

texts.en:
Mendbayar operates a mobile grocery trading business in her province with the help of her husband. She purchases groceries from the Narantuul and Bars markets, the two largest markets in Ulaanbaatar, and sells them to herders in the countryside for a profit.

Mendbayar is 35 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. Her two children, ages 11 and 7, are in a local secondary school. Mendbayar and her husband are a very hardworking couple who have managed to build their own customers and suppliers. She is planning to continue and expand her business in the future. Her dream is to open her own grocery shop one day. Mendbayar is requesting a 600,000 tugrug loan to purchase New Year cakes to sell to countryside residents.

loans.use: To purchase New Year cakes

loans.name: Vitelio

texts.es: Vitelio L. A. de 34 años de edad, reside en el municipio Guatajiagua, ubicado en el departamento de Morazán. Vive junto a su esposa, la cual se dedica al trabajo del hogar y sus dos hijos los cuales estudian y también ayudan con el negocio de su padre. Vitelio se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, y luego los comercializa. Debido a que cuenta con años de experiencia, tiene muchos clientes los cuales lo prefieren, ya que vende muy buena calidad de animales. Es así como a través de este trabajo el logra llevar el sustento diario a su hogar, es por ello que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el dinero necesario para poder comprar más vacas y comprar el alimento necesario para estas. Vitelio desea poder seguir adelante con su negocio ya que toda su familia se ha dedicado a este durante años, así mismo es bastante rentable para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Vitelio L. A. is 34 years old, lives in the municipality of Guatajiagua, located in the department of Morazán. He lives with his wife; she tends to the household and their two children, who go to school and also help with their father’s business. Vitelio raises cattle, and then he sells them. Since he has many years of experience, he has many clients that prefer him because he sells high quality animals. Through his work, he is able to provide for the everyday expenses of his family; for this reason, he is requesting a loan to get the necessary money to buy more cows and buy feed for his cattle. Vitelio wishes to press forward with his business since his whole family has been devoted to it for many years and it is profitable for him and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cattle and feed for the cattle.

loans.name: Mr. Vith Paen Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan, which consists of fourteen people, is located in Chumrov village in Takeo province. All the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mr. Vith P. is the village bank president. He has been selected president by the members. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. His wife, Mrs. Uk Phally, is a silk weaver. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so her husband decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk for his wife's business. Mr. Vith P. is a father of four children. Three of the children are silk weavers and the youngest one attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy more silk for his wife's business.

loans.name: Purvee

texts.en: Purvee is 50 years old and lives with her husband and 21-year-old daughter in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. She lives with her family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her daughter is a university student and her husband helps with the family business. Purvee currently operates a meat trading business in her town. She purchases meat and other animal products in bulk from herders in the countryside and transports it to the center of the province where she sells it. Purvee started her meat trading business in 2001 by selling out of a rented stall at the market in her town. During 1990-2000, she herded livestock in the countryside and gained great knowledge in selecting the best meat from the livestock. Using her knowledge, experience and good supplier relationships, she has built a strong customer base. She is planning to open a food cafe in the future. Purvee is requesting a 2,000,000-tugrug loan to purchase more meat and meat products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more meat and meat products

loans.name: Meshgan Khomary Group

texts.en: This is the Meshgan Khomary group. This group is made up of three members. Mirwais is the group leader of Meshgan Khomary Group. Mirwais is the first member of Meshgan Khomary Group. He is married. He runs a cosmetics shop. With this loan, he wants to buy more goods for his shop. Khomary is the second member of Meshgan Khomary Group. She is a tailor. She wants to complete her stock. The third member of the group is Meshgan who has a carpet weaving business. She wants to buy materials for her carpet weaving. These three members have requested a group loan of 47,600 Afghani to expand their businesses and complete the requirements. They would like to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more goods for his shop

loans.name: Surenhorloo

texts.en: Surenhorloo is 32 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. His wife is a hairdresser for a private company. He lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, and operates a taxi service in his town. He began his business in 2007 after working and living in Korea for two years. Since then, his working capital has grown and he plans to open a hair salon for his wife. Within a short period of operating his business, he has gained a good professional reputation among the people of his town as a safe, reliable driver. Surenhorloo would eventually like to buy a larger, more comfortable car so that he can transport more people across longer distances, which would increase his profits. He is requesting a 1,500,000-tugrug loan to purchase replacement parts for his taxi so that he can keep getting his customers where they need to go and furniture for his home.

loans.use: To purchase replacement parts for his taxi

loans.name: Tserenminjin

texts.en: Tserenminjin is 40 years old and lives with her husband and five children in Uvs province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest daughter woks, two sons are in the university and the youngest son is in kindergarten. Her husband is a security guard at a private company. Tserenminjin owns and operates a successful household goods retail business in her town. At first, she used to purchase her products from the biggest markets in Ulaanbaatar city. Eventually she was able to import her products from China. She started her business in 2005. She attributes its success to her excellent accounting skills and her hard work. She hopes to move her business into her own store one day, so that she can expand the number of products she sells. Tserenminjin is requesting a 500,000-tugrug loan to purchase more household goods so that she can attract new customers.

loans.use: To purchase more household goods

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en:
Odgerel U. is 25 years old and lives with his wife and 2-year-old son in Tuv province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His wife looks after her 2-year-old son at home and helps in her husband's business whenever she can. She is now eight months pregnant and is expecting her second child soon.  Odgerel has a small business with his mother-in-law. He rents a 1.5-meter-wide stall at the local black market and sells various women and men's clothes imported from China. His mother-in-law works as a saleswoman at the stall and handles all the sales of clothes while Odgerel travels to China to import the clothes. He has been doing this clothes retail business with his mother-in-law since 2005 and he says that his mother-in-law is a good business partner. Odgerel and his mother-in-law dream of having their own store where could sell their clothes in a more convenient way. 
He requests a loan to purchase more clothes from China.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes from China

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha M. M. has a business located at Easleigh estate in Nairobi and it's known by the name "Kavumbu Fashions and Boutique". She is 47 years old, married and has four children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are still in school.

Martha is a dressmaker and she is using her loan to buy more material to grow her business. In the future, she hopes to expand her business to serve more customers and educate her children to the university level. She is generous, active and visionary.

loans.use: To buy materials for dressmaking

loans.name: Ines Del Rosario

texts.es:
Ines del Rosario P. D. F. D. 51 años D. edad, resiD. en San Bartolo, departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores D. edad. 
Ella trabaja comercializando ropa D. manera ambulante por las calles D. San Salvador. Así mimo posee un pequeño puesto D. venta D. ropa, en la ciudad D. San Miguel, el cual es administrado por su hermana. Ines solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda adquirir el dinero necesario para aumentar su inventario, ya que en el mes D. diciembre ella pueD. encontrar la mercadería más barata y D. esta manera poder empezar el siguiente año con diversidad D. prendas D. vestir. Ines desea aumentar sus ventas, ya que está próxima la temporada D. inicio D. clases y desea contar con el dinero necesario para poder comprar los útiles escolares a sus hijos, y D. esta manera solventar una necesidad más D. sus pequeños, los cuales son su prioridad absoluta.
texts.en:
Ines del Rosario P. D. F. is 51 years old and she lives in San Bartolo, department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband and her two young children. She works selling clothes as a street vendor in the streets of San Salvador. She also owns a small stand selling clothes in the city of San Miguel; the stand is tended by her sister. Ines is requesting a loan to get the necessary money to increase her inventory since in December she can buy cheaper merchandise and she can begin the next year with a wiD. assortment of clothing items. Ines wishes to increase her sales since the school year will begin soon; she wants to have the necessary money to buy school supplies for her children and thus fulfill one more need for her young ones, since they are her absolute priority.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes to increase inventory.

location.town: San Bartolo, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tools for his metal shop

loans.name: Tsedendash

texts.en:
Tsedendash B. drives a minibus for tourists visiting his town and other customers that request bus services. Since he is one of the very few bus owners in town, he is usually busy with local requests for his bus services. With his profit, he supports his younger brother, paying his tuition for university in Ulaanbaatar (the capital city of Mongolia) and his living expenses too. He hopes to fix up his old house and get ready for his marriage planned very soon.

Tsedendash is 24 years old and lives with his wife in Tuv province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His mother is retired and now helps with her son's business. Tsedendash requests a loan to purchase paint and necessary accessories to fix up his minibus.

loans.use: To purchase paint and necessary accessories to fix up his bus

loans.name: Urangerel

texts.en: Urangerel B. is 35 years old and lives with her husband and three teenage children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her three sons are 10, 14 and 15 years old. All the boys go to a local secondary school. Urangerel sells basic food products in a small stall that she rents at the Burd shopping market, one of the large outdoor markets in Ulaanbaatar. Her husband also helps in her business whenever she needs a hand. Besides helping her, her husband works as a taxi driver. Urangerel sells various bakery products including cakes, cookies, etc.  She hopes to expand her business by adding more variety of baked goods in her list of products. She requests a loan to purchase more bakery products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more bakery products

loans.name: Gulchahon

texts.ru: Гулчахон Хасанова проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 27 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж находится в России на заработках. Сама Гулчахон более 8 лет занимается пашивом одежды. Еще она более 5 лет занимается земледелием, выращивает пшеницу. Кредит просит для посева урожая.
texts.en:
Gulchahon H. lives in the Tursun-zoda region. She's twenty-seven years old, married and has three children. Her husband works in Russia. Gulchahon has tailored clothes for more than eight years. She has also grown wheat for five years. She's asking for a loan in order to sow a crop.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sow a crop

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Хасанова Зулфия проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 24 года. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Муж занимается ремонтом квартир. Сама Зулфия более 4 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Она в основном выращивает пшеницу. Кредит просит для посева нового урожая.
texts.en:
Zulfiya H. lives in the Tursun-zoda district. She is 24 years old, married and has 2 children. Her husband is involved in apartment remodeling. Zulfiya has been involved in agriculture for over 4 years. She primarily grows wheat. She is requesting a loan for the planting of new crop.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: New crop planting

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pitta

texts.en:
Pitta C. is currently in the business of selling cooked food in a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to stock crates of beer and sodas to sell.

Pitta is 25 years old and widowed. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a big hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock crates of beer and sodas to sell

loans.name: Ozoda

texts.ru: Даршова Озода проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 35 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж находится в России на заработках. Сама Озода более 3 лет занимается торговлей рядом с домом. Торгует она в основном детской одеждой. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Ozoda D. lives in the Tursun-zoda district. She is 35 years old, married and has 3 children. Her husband works in Russia. Ozoda has been involved in retail sales near her home for over 3 years. She primarily sells children's clothing. She is requesting a loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Morena Guadalupe

texts.es: Morena Guadalupe E. F., vive junto a sus padres, dos sobrinos y un hijo de nueve años de edad, el cual se dedica a estudiar. Reside en el municipio de Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Ella posee una tienda llamada “el rinconcito”, negocio el cual le permite darle todo lo necesario a su hijo y así mismo brindarle ayuda a sus padres. Morena solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más productos para su tienda, así mismo para surtirla con papelería, ya que se acerca la temporada de inicio de clases y ella desea poder aprovecharla al máximo, de manera de aumentar sus ventas, lo cual le permita invertir aún más en su negocio. Morena desea poder mejorar su negocio y aprovechar muy bien la excelente ubicación que posee, ya que ella espera brindarles toda la ayuda necesaria a sus padres los cuales dependen de ella y así mismo darle todo lo necesario a su pequeño hijo, ya que Morena es madre soltera y es la única que vela por el bienestar de él, quien es el motor que la incentiva a esforzarse más cada día.
texts.en:
Morena Guadalupe E. F. lives with her parents, two nephews, and a nine-year-old son who is in school. She lives in the town of Soaypango, in the San Salvador department. She owns a store called “El Rinconcito” (The Little Corner) which allows her to give her son everything he needs while also supporting her parents. Morena is requesting a loan with which to purchase more products for her store, to stock paper products since it is nearing the time when classes start and she wishes to maximize on this fact to increase her sales. This will allow her to invest even more in her business.

Morena wishes to be able to improve her business and take advantage of the excellent location that she has. She hopes to be able to support all of her parents’ needs because they depend on her. She wishes to give her young son everything he needs because Morena is a single mom and the only one with his best interests in mind. Her son is the motor which motivates her to work harder every day.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Paper Products

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia D. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and groundnut paste. She is requesting a loan to buy more bags of charcoal to sell.  

Lucia is 30 years old and married to an engineer. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Haitoi

texts.ru: Хаитой Улучаева проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 42 года. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Дети работают в России. Хаитой по специальности "повар". Она у себя дома имеет столовую, где работает поварихой. Кредит просит для закупа сырья и увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Haitoi U. lives in the Tursun-zoda district. She is 42 years old, married and has 4 children. Her children work in Russia. Haitoi is a cook by trade. She has a cafeteria at home where she works as a cook. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase supplies and increase turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies

loans.name: Shodi

texts.ru: Шоди Хамидов проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 23 года. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Шоди имеет высшее образование экономиста. Он имеет собственный магазин, в котором занимается торговлей. Он в основном торгует продуктами питания. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Shodi H. lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 23 years old, married and has 2 children. Shodi has higher education in economics. He owns a store where he is involved in retail sales. Shodi primarily sells food products. He is requesting a loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane N. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and local alcohol at home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Jane is 22 years old and is married to a policeman.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma P. is from the town of Cristo Rey, Capas, Tarlac. She is 32 years old. Irma is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Irma owns & operates a business preparing and selling barbecue pork and chicken. Irma has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Irma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Irma is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Irma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn P. is from the village of Taboo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Rosalyn is married and has five grown children. To make a living, Rosalyn sells ocean-caught fish in the local community. Rosalyn has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month through her business.

In 2008, Rosalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Rosalyn is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Rosalyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en: Altantsetseg is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her elder daughter, Zolzaya, who is 8 years old, currently attends a local secondary school while her younger child, Zolbayar, who is 6 years old, is in kindergarten. Altantsetseg operates a dairy trading business with the help of her husband in her town. She started her business in 2007 with working capital of 100,000 tugrugs (~70 USD) and has built a stable operation over the years. Today, she is well established in the local business community and attributes her success to her strong customer base, communication skills and good accounting practices. Altantsetseg also has many reliable suppliers, many of which sell exclusively to her. Today, her working capital exceeds 400,000 tugrugs (~280 USD). For the future, Altantsetseg hopes to own her own workspace, which will allow her to serve more customers. She is requesting a 400,000 tugrug loan to purchase more dairy products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products

loans.name: Butolo

texts.en:
Butolo A. is currently in the business of selling potatoes and cassava in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase fresh and dry fish to sell.  Butolo is 35 years old and is married to a soldier. She has one child who does not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase fresh and dry fish to sell.

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en: Nergui is 36 years old and lives with his spouse and two children in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His two daughters, aged 14 and 8, attend a local secondary school. Nergui currently operates a photo frame making business with the help of his wife in his town. Hee designs and produces many different styles and sizes of frames that he sells throughout his community. Nergui started his business with capital of 500,000 tugrugs (~350 USD) and has found success in his trade. Today, his business is well established in the local area, and his working capital exceeds 3,000,000 tugrugs (~2,100 USD). For the future, Nergui says, "My main business goal is to continue to produce quality products for my customers." He is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more wood to make frames.

loans.use: To purchase more wood to make frames

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca T. is from the city of Castillo Concepcion Tarlac. She is 59 years old. Francisca is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Francisca owns & operates a general store. Francisca has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Francisca joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisca is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Francisca from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
