loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday E. is currently in the business of selling beans and potatoes in a market. She is requesting a loan to stock bags of rice, posho 	(a hot, sticky dough made from maize flour) and more beans to sell.  

Sunday is 25 years old and married to an accountant. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock bags of rice, posho and more beans to sell

loans.name: Baigalmaa

texts.en: Baigalmaa is 30 years old and lives with her husband and 1-year-old infant in Arkhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Baigalmaa operates a retail Russian candy business in her town. She began her business in 2008 with working capital of 500,000 tugrugs (~350 USD). After several years of operation, she has managed to establish herself in the business community. Now her working capital exceeds 2,000,000 tugrugs (~1,400 USD). Baigalmaa delivers Russian candies to local supermarkets and shops, which sell the candies. She also has individual customers who buy her candies on a regular basis. Because of her business success, she has managed to finance her family's daily needs. Baigalmaa is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase candies for her business.

loans.use: To purchase candies

loans.name: Bulgantamir

texts.en: Bulgantamir is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Arkhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His oldest daughter attends a local secondary school, while his youngest has not reached school age yet. His wife is a cook who works in a little food cafe. Bulgantamir operates a livestock and meat trading business at a small market in the town. He purchases a large amount of livestock during the summer and fall and herds them until winter and spring, when it is in high demand. Bulgantamir started his business in 2005, with a working capital of 2,000,000 tugrugs (~1400 USD). Today, his business is a very stable operation with a working capital reaching 6,000,000 tugrugs (~4200 USD), and he hopes to expand in the future. His dream is to, one day, open a meat trading center to sell a variety of meat to the people of the town. Bulgantamir continues to support his family with his business and hopes to pass it down to his children one day. He is requesting an 800,000 tugrug (~560 USD) loan to purchase livestock for his business, and to help his family to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase animals to raise and sell.

loans.name: Seyda Gul

texts.en:
This is Seyda Gul, son of Rahmat Gul. He lives in Shewa district. He is 33 years old,  married, and has four children: three sons and one daughter.
He has been busy in agriculture for 4 years. Before immigrating to Pakistan, his business was in progress and he had a happy family. After regressing from Pakistan, he has lots of economic problems and also his business income is not satisfactory to achieve the requirements of his family. 

Therefore, he has requested an individual loan of 50,000(AF) to buy farming supplies and to progress his business and also to expand his business capacity and to solve his problems.
He would like to thank both AFS and Kiva lenders that support the people around the world through their effective process.

loans.use: He wants to complete his stock.

loans.name: Aserua

texts.en:
Aserua R. is currently in the business of selling fresh vegetables in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

Aserua is 35 years old and married to a policeman. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. 

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Katey

texts.en:
Katey is one of FATEN’s first clients. She took several loans from FATEN within its group guarantee program, and the last three loans as individual loans. She started with a 150 USD loan and gradually increased her loan size, but the loan was always very small so that it met her ability for repayment and her business size.

Katey is married with three children. She and her husband have owned and managed an olive-wood workshop for twenty years. They buy the olive wood and make crosses, statues, Christ caves and many other Christian religious handcrafts. They sell them to souvenir shops in Bethlehem as well as to wholesalers who export them to the USA and Europe.

 In the Palestinian territories there is no national currency and there are three main currencies used: US dollars, Israeli Shekels and the Jordanian Dinar. Katey has requested a loan of 405 Jordanian Dinars (1 USD=0.71 JOD).

Katey appears in the photo at her workshop. Last August, Katey’s photo taken at her workshop was used for a FATEN billboard media campaign throughout the West Bank. She was very proud that she was selected by FATEN to represent FATEN's clients.

loans.use: To purchase more olive wood

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca T. is from the city of Castillo Concepcion Tarlac. She is 54 years old. Francisca is married and has three grown children. To make a living, Francisca owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling rice in the local community. Francisca is just starting this business.

In 2009, Francisca joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisca is requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Francisca from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering Central and Northern Luzon. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Apowo

texts.en:
Apowo S. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more powdered milk, tea leaves and coffee to make tea to sell.  Apowo is 23 years old. She is married and her husband is a soldier.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a hardware shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es: Aurelia G. G. de 40 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Colón en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a sus dos hijas, las cuales se dedican a estudiar. Aurelia  posee una venta de tortillas, negocio el cual en El Salvador es muy rentable, debido a que estas forman parte de la dieta diaria de las personas. Es por esto que ella obtiene ganancias cada día, las cuales le permiten invertir en el mismo negocio, y así mismo solventar todos los gastos del hogar. Aurelia solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de maíz de manera que cuente con más materia prima para la elaboración de las tortillas, así mismo comprar tambos de gas propano adicionales. Aurelia es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable que ha sabido darles todo lo necesario a sus hijas ella sola, ya que ha sido la única que ha trabajado para ellas, es por esto que desea poder mejorar las ventas de su negocio, para que nunca haga falta nada en su hogar.
texts.en:
Aurelia G. Garcia is 40 years old. She lives in the municipality of Colón, in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her two daughters, who are both studying. Aurelia sell tortillas, which is a very good business in El Salvador since tortillas are a part of people's diet. This is how she earns an income everyday, which she invests in the business. It also allows her to pay the household expenses. Aurelia is requesting a loan with which she can buy a larger quantity of corn so that she can have more of this ingredient for making tortillas and also so she can buy additional tanks of propane gas. Aurelia is a very hardworking woman who has had to provide for her daughters by herself. She wants to improve sales in her business so that her household will never lack for anything.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making tortillas

loans.name: May Anneliez

texts.en:
May Anneliez D. is from the village of Dolores, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. May Anneliez is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, May Anneliez owns and operates a clothing business that provides general clothing services to local community members. May Anneliez has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month through the business.

In 2007, May Anneliez joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. May Anneliez has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. May Anneliez is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. This will be the ninth loan taken out by May Anneliez from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen Q. D. V. D. 43 años D. edad, vive en casa propia junto a su compañero D. vida el cual posee un molino, y así mismo vive junto a sus tres hijos menores D. edad. ResiD. en el municipio D. Colón en el departamento D. La Libertad. Ella posee una venta D. tortillas a las afueras D. su hogar, las cuales las comercializa a diario, y sus hijos le ayudan a repartirlas D. casa en casa. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. maíz para la elaboración D. las tortillas, esto lo hace con el fin D. poder mejorar sus ganancias, ya que lo que su esposo gana no es suficiente para cubrir todos los gastos, es por esto que María desea poder aumentar sus ventas y D. esta manera contar con el dinero necesario para poder inscribir a sus hijos a la escuela y así mismo comprarles todos los útiles escolares. Esto D. manera que pueda ayudarle a su esposo con algunos gastos los cuales son muy necesarios para el bienestar D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
María del Carmen Q. D. V. is 43 years old and lives in her own house with her husband, who owns a mill, and her three young children. She lives in the municipality of Colon, in the department of La Libertad. She owns a business selling tortillas on a daily basis outsiD. her home and her children help her distribute them from door to door.

She is requesting a loan with which to purchase a larger quantity of corn to prepare the tortillas, with the goal of improving her profits because her husband’s earnings are not sufficient to cover all of their expenses. For this reason Maria wishes to increase her sales and obtain the money necessary to enroll her children in school and buy them all of their school supplies. In this way she can help her husband with some expenses that are necessary for her children's well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Corn

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a young Palestinian man. He is still single and is living with his family that consists of seven members. His father is a teacher at a public school and Mohammad’s income is used only to support himself.

Mohammad gained the skill of being a barber through taking training in one of the vocational training centers. He opened his shop three years ago at Maythaloon village next to Jenin city. Although there are two other barbershops in the village, his work is going very well.

Mohammad requested 2,000 USD from FATEN to buy new equipment for his salon, like scissors, combs, hairdryers, hair and beard treatment creams, shampoos, etc.

In the photo, Mohammad appears at his salon cutting the hair of one of his customers.

loans.use: To buy new equipment for his salon

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en: Dolgorsuren is a 32-year-old single mother who lives with her four children in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. Her elder two daughters are in university and her younger two sons are in a local secondary school. She and her family live in Mongolian traditional tent called a "ger." Dolgorsuren operates a consumer goods trading business at the local market in her town. She sells a variety of household and consumer goods out of a rented stall.  In 2002, Dolgorsuren started her business by selling small household items such as socks, scotch and brushes with capital of 100,000 tugrugs (~70 USD). She has found success with her business and has stable earnings. Now her working capital exceeds 400,000 tugrugs (~280 USD). Her profits have enabled her to provide financial stability for her family. For the future, Dolgorsuren says, "I want to expand my business and hope to one day own my own shop." She is requesting a 500,000 tugrug loan to purchase new products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase small items

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji A. is currently in the business of selling pots in a market and is requesting a loan to purchase more materials to use to make more pots to sell.  Keji is 40 years old. She is married and her husband is a peasant. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to use and make more pots to sell.

loans.name: María Ofelia

texts.es: María Ofelia Álvarez S. de 35 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Colón en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su madre de edad muy avanzada. María posee una venta de pupusas, la cuales las comercializa a diario, obteniendo mayores ganancias los fines de semana, su mamá le ayuda a la preparación de la masa y todos los ingredientes para hacer las pupusas. María desea poder brindarle todo lo mejor a su madre de la misma manera en que ella lo hizo por María algún día, es por esta razón por la cual solicita un préstamo, ya que desea poder comprar maíz, chicharrón, queso y frijoles en mayores cantidades, con el fin de poder ofrecer mayor cantidad de productos y así mismo mejorar las ganancias. María es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, la cual espera poder brindarle una mejor vida a su madre.
texts.en:
María Ofelia Álvarez S. is 35 years old and lives in the municipality of Colon, in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her elderly mother. Maria owns a business selling “pupusas” (thick tortillas stuffed with cheese, beans, pork, etc.) on a daily basis, earning the most on weekends. Her mother helps her prepare the dough and all the ingredients to make the pupusas.

One day, Maria wishes to provide all the best for her mother just like her mother did for her, so for this reason she is requesting a loan to purchase corn, pork, cheese, and beans in large quantities. Her goal is to offer larger quantities of products and improve her earnings. Maria is a responsible and hard-working person who wishes to give her mother a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: María Transito

texts.es: María Transito M. M. de 50 años de edad, reside en Ilopango, departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su compañero de vida. Ella posee un chalet llamado “María”, en el cual vende desayunos, almuerzos, bebidas, golosinas, entre otros productos más. María cuenta con muy buena ubicación para su negocio por el hecho de que se encuentra en el punto de buses de la ruta 29, lugar en el cual vende mucho gracias a los que trabajan en el transporte publico. Es por esto que María desea poder surtir su negocio, sobre todo con comida y bebidas, ya que es esto lo que más se vende. Es por ello que solicita un préstamo el cual le permita comprar todo lo necesario para poder aumentar sus ventas y su clientela. María trabaja a diario para poder seguir adelante con su hogar en conjunto a su esposo y así contar con todo lo necesario para tener una vida digna.
texts.en:
María Transito M. M. is 50 years old and lives in Ilopango, in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband. She owns a cottage called “Maria” in which she sells breakfast, lunch, drinks, and sweets, among other products. Maria has a very good location for her business because it is in the Route 29 bus station, a place where she sells a lot thanks to the public transportation workers. For this reason, Maria wishes to stock her business with food and drink because these products are what sell most.

She is requesting a loan which will permit her to purchase all the necessary things to increase her sales and clientele. Maria works every day to be able to get ahead in life with her husband, and be able to have everything necessary to live a decent life.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perishable products

loans.name: Enhtsetseg

texts.en: Enhtsetseg is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Enhtsetseg has a daughter and a son, ages 21 and 18, who attend a university and a local secondary school. Enhtsetseg owns a grocery retail business that she runs with the help of her husband in her town. She started her business in 1997. In the years her business has been in operation, it has become one of the most stable grocery operations in the area and Enhtsetseg hopes to keep growing and expanding her business in the future. In 2009, she bought a 0.3-hectare field in order to plant vegetables to harvest and sell. She is requesting an 800,000-tugrug loan in order to purchase more vegetables so that she can increase her sales this winter.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables

loans.name: Mojjo

texts.en:
Mojjo H. is currently in the business of selling various items in a shop. The items he sells are: rice, sugar, salt, books, beans etc. and he is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice and posho to sell. Mojjo is 26 years old. She is married and her husband is a soldier. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of rice and posho to sell.

loans.name: Alejandra Marina

texts.es: Alejandra Marina B. D. A. D. 44 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Colón, en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos. Ella posee una venta D. tamales, en la cual se encarga D. hacerlos y luego comercializarlos en su casa o con la ayuda D. sus hijos los cuales los reparten en las diferentes casas en las cuales le han hecho un pedido previo a Alejandra. Debido a que ella es una mujer muy tranquila, trabajadora y responsable, cuenta con muchos clientes los cuales la prefieren por ser una señora muy aseada para hacer los tamales. Alejandra solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar maíz, pollo y verduras, los cuales son los ingredientes más básicos para la elaboración D. los tamales, ya que ella desea poder contar con mayor cantidad D. materia prima, debido a que en muchas ocasiones recibe pedido grandes los cuales no pueD. aceptar ya que carece D. material para cubrir la cantidad necesaria del pedido.
texts.en:
Alejandra Marina B. D. Aleman is 44 years old. She lives in the town of Colon, in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband and three children. She has a business selling tamales. In it she makes and sells them in her house, or with the help of her children, to different houses where they deliver orders previously maD. to Alejandra. Since she is a very calm, hardworking and responsible woman, she has many customers who prefer her because she is very hygenic while making the tamales. Alejandra is asking for a loan with which she can buy corn, chicken and vegetables, the most basic ingredients for making tamales. She wants to have a larger quantity of raw materials since often she receives large orders she can't accept without the materials to cover the quantity necessary for the order.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of raw materials to make tamales.

loans.name: Gansuh

texts.en: Gansuh D. lives with his wife and two daughters in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His two daughters, aged 17 and 19, live and study in university in Ulaanbaatar city, the capital of Mongolia. He operates a photo studio called "Mongol Photo." In his studio, customers have the chance to dress up in Mongolian traditional clothes while having their photos taken. He started his business in 2008 with a loan of 3,700,000 tugrugs (~2,595 USD) from XacBank, a Field Partner of Kiva, and has worked hard to build a stable operation. Gansuh has used his earnings to support his family and afford his two daughters' education. He is requesting a 4,000,000-tugrug loan to purchase Mongolian traditional clothes and some equipment for his business.

loans.use: To purchase Mongolian traditional clothes and some equipment

loans.name: Lilian Isabel

texts.es: Lilian Isabel P. D. A. D. 50 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo y su hija, la cual se dedica a estudiar, en el municipio D. Colón en el departamento D. La Libertad. Lilian posee una venta D. tortillas la cual esta ubicada en su propio lugar D. habitación. Es por medio D. este negocio como Lilian le brinda el apoyo necesario a su esposo para poder cubrir todos los gastos del hogar y así mismo pagar los estudios D. su hija. Lilian solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar maíz para la elaboración D. las tortillas, así mismo comprar frijoles, queso y chicharrón, esto ultimo con el fin D. poder aumentar sus ventas e iniciar con el negocio D. las pupusas, D. manera que pueda obtener ganancias extras.
texts.en:
Lilian Isabel P. D. A., 50, lives with her husband and their daughter, a student, in the town of Colón, La Libertad department. Lilian has a business selling tortillas that she operates from her home. In this way, she offers her husband necessary support in meeting the household expenses and the school expenses for their daughter. Lilian is seeking a loan to buy corn for the making of tortillas. She will also buy beans, cheese, and chicharrón [pork rinds] with the goal of expanding her business into the making of pupusas [stuffed tortillas]. In this way, she can increase earnings.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en: Kiden R. is currently in the business of selling fresh vegetables and is requesting a loan to buy more fresh vegetables, fruits and dried fish to sell. Kiden is 30 years old and is divorced. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a boutique. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more fresh vegetables, fruits, and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en: Gantumur is 70 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in Ulaanbaatar city, the capital of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His elder son, who is 7 years old, attends a local secondary school while his younger son, who is 4 years old, goes to kindergarten. His wife is unemployed and stays at home watching after their younger son, Gan-Ochir. Gantumur operates a gold and silver product making business in his town. He makes a variety of jewelery that satisfies his customers' needs. He started his business in 2000. He has built a stable operation over the years and the successful operation has allowed him to provide for his family. In the future, to further support his family, he hopes to grow his business further by increasing the quantity and quality of products he produces. He also wishes to build a house, which will make his living situation more comfortable. He is requesting a 1,000,000-tugrug loan to purchase more gold and silver for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more gold and silver

loans.name: Konge

texts.en: Konge M. is currently in the business of selling fresh vegetables in a market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of beans, corn meal and rice to sell. Konge is 28 years old and is married to a soldier. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a retail shop. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy bags of beans, corn meal and rice to sell

loans.name: Santa

texts.en: Santa L. is currently in the business of selling beans and peas in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase bags of rice and corn meal to sell. Santa is 25 years old and is married to a soldier. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a hotel. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase bags of rice and corn meal to sell

loans.name: Abdel Hakim

texts.en:
Abdel Hakim is a Palestinian man who is married with five children: three boys aged 19, 14 and 10, and two girls aged 8 and 6 years old. He lives with his family in a nearby village of Jenin.

Abdel Hakim is a taxi driver, operating between Jenin city and Jericho for people who want to travel to Jordan, since Jericho city is where the border crossings are located. His work is the primary source of income for his family but in addition to that he owns agricultural land where he plants olive and almond trees; his wife takes care of the land and its cultivation.

Abel Hakim has requested 1,500 USD from FATEN to pay his son’s university fees. He hopes that his son will have a university degree and get a better education than he did, himself.

loans.use: To pay his son's university tuition fees

loans.name: Munhtsetseg

texts.en: Munhtsetseg is 33 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Darhan-Uul province, Mongolia. She and her family live in their own house. Their oldest daughter is attending high school while the younger two children are in kindergarten. Her husband operates a taxi service in order to support his family. Munhtsetseg manages a grocery trading business near her home. Her business is growing faster with no rival grocery trading business near by. She started this business in 2008 after working as a dressmaker for several years. Since then, she quickly gained a reputation as a great customer service provider. Munhtsetseg wants to grow her business so that she may own her own grocery trading center and so that she can send her children to foreign universities. She is requesting a 1,000,000-tugrug loan so that she can purchase a greater amount and variety of groceries for her business and furniture for her home.

loans.use: To purchase a greater amount and variety of groceries

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty K. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcoholic beverages at home and is requesting a loan to stock more materials to use. Betty is 29 years old and is married to a driver. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more materials to use for brewing local alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Odontuya

texts.en: Odontuya is a 52-year-old single mother who lives with her four children in Khovd province, Mongolia. Her youngest daughter, who is 19 years old, attends a university and her three sons help with the family business, which is the selling of baked goods. She and her family live in a Mongolian traditional tent called a "ger." Odontuya operates a business selling baked goods in her town. She sells a variety of breads and baked goods at the local market. Odontuya started her bakery business in 1996, and has built a stable operation over the years. Her business earnings have created financial stability for her family and have enabled her to buy land and to afford her children's education. Odontuya is a very hardworking businesswoman and is known for her good character. She says, "My one goal is to increase my earnings so that I can provide a good life for my children." She is requesting a 700,000-tugrug loan to purchase flour and other needed products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase flour needed to make baked goods to sell

loans.name: Tsevel

texts.en: Tsevel L. is 66 years old and lives with her husband and 19-year-old daughter in Zuunmod town in Tuv province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her daughter, Bayantuul, has already graduated from her university and is operating her own business. Tsevel is a retired lady who operates a grocery retail business out of a small booth at a local market in her town. She began her business in 1998 after retiring from her previous work. She works hard to provide for her family and wants to be able to continue to conduct her business in the future. Tsevel is requesting a 2,000,000-tugrug loan to purchase different kinds of products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase different kinds of food products

loans.name: Mrs. Thol Khaim Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fourteen people who live in Chumrov village in Takeo province have taken out this village bank loan together. They will all use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Thol K. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare field on which she cultivates rice for a living. Aside from this, she is a silk weaver in the local village. Since she has a lot of customers, she needs to buy more silk for her business. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She is a widow with a child who is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more silk for her business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda H. is from the village of Acad, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 47 years old. Erlinda is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste and boost food in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Erlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Erlinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina B. is from the village of Tuburan Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Crispina is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Crispina owns and operates a business venture in the arts sector, running a weaving business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling hand-woven products to tourists and the local community. Crispina has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 700 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Crispina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crispina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Crispina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used for additional capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Crispina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional capital

loans.name: Ms. Hy Chev Group

texts.en: Ms. Hy C. is single and she is the leader of a four-member group loan. All the members live in Prey Chheu village in Takeo province. Ms. Hy C. owns a grocery store in the local market. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods to resell.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie G. is from the village of Tuburan Aloran Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Elsie is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Elsie owns & operates a business making and selling food products in the local community. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Elsie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used for additional capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Elsie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional capital

loans.name: Jamilyn

texts.en:
Jamilyn C. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 21 years old. Jamilyn is single. To make a living, Jamilyn owns & operates a restaurant serving a variety of meals to customers in the local community. Jamilyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jamilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jamilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Jamilyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jamilyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food & drinks for her restaurant

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Mrs. Uok Un Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fourteen people who live in Sman Muni village in Takeo province are members of this village bank. All the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Uok U. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a 0.35-hectare field on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Aside from this, she is a silk middleman who buys silk to resell. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk to resell. Her husband, Mr. Peong Pisey, is a farmer who cultivates rice to earn a living. Mrs. Uok U. is a mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the younger one is too young to work or study because this child is four years old.

loans.use: To buy more silk to resell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita A. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 59 years old. Anita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Anita owns & operates a business making & selling specialty food products in the local community. Anita has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Anita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Anita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Anita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Creselene

texts.en:
Creselene D. is from the village of Mansabay Alto Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Creselene is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Creselene owns & operates a business growing and selling dried coconut "copra" in the local community. Creselene has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Creselene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Creselene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Creselene is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Creselene from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase coconut fertilizer

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma P. is from the village of Puntod Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Gemma is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma sells fish in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Gemma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Gemma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to provide the basic needs of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es: Ana Mirian A. D. C. D. 45 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Colón en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo y su hija D. cuatro años D. edad. Ana posee una venta D. productos perecederos, la cual la posee desD. hace cinco años, y es la cual le ha permitido tener una vida estable, ya que pueD. ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Ana solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su tienda con productos como embutidos, comida enlatada y otros productos más los cuales son D. primera necesidad. Ella desea aumentar sus venta ya que el próximo año su pequeña hija inicia sus estudias y como toda madre responsable, Ana desea poder comprarle todo lo necesario a su niña para que asista a clases.
texts.en:
Ana Mirian A. D. C., 45, lives with her husband and their 4-year-old daughter in the city of Colón, department of La Libertad. Ana has a store selling perishable goods that she has operated for five years. This business has enabled her to have a stable life, as she can help her husband with the household expenses. Ana is seeking a loan to stock her store with products such as processed meats, canned goods, and other basic food products. She wants to expand her business because her daughter begins school next year and, like any responsible mother, she wants to buy everything her daughter will need to attend classes.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic food products for store

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es: Ana Silvia T. D. M. D. 37 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos menores D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar, Ana posee una floristería, la cual esta ubicada en su hogar, ahí las personas hacen los pedido y llegan a recogerlos. Ana elabora  arreglos con flores y globos para decorar los salones e iglesias en diferentes ocasiones especiales, como bautizos y bodas. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. globos, flores y todo tipo D. materia prima para la elaboración D. los arreglos D. decoración D. fiestas y el hogar, así mismo desea poder saldar una deuda que posee. Ana desea poder mejorar su negocio y que más personas puedan conocerla, es por ello que desea poder invertir en el y D. esta manera poder mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ana Silvia is 37 years old and resides in the Department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband and 3 minor children who are students. Ana has a flower shop which is located in her home. Here people come to place orders and to collect them. She creates gifts for all occasions, including baptisms and weddings. She is soliciting a loan to buy more balloons, flowers, and all types of primary materials to make gifts. She also wishes to pay off a debt she has. Ana wants to improve her business so that more people will get to know her. It is for that reason that she wants to invest in her shop and in this manner, to be able to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY BALLOONS, FLOWERS, AND SUPPLIES FOR HER FLOWER SHOP

loans.name: Saimurod

texts.ru: Акбаров Саймурод проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 28 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Саймурод имеет среднее образование. Он по специальности "шофер". Саймурод имеет грузовую машину, на которой занимается перевозками. Кредит просит для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en:
Saimurod A. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 28 years old, married and has 2 children. Saimurod has secondary education. He is a driver by trade. Saimurod has a freight truck, which he uses for transporting goods. He is requesting a loan for truck repair.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Truck repair

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia M. is from the village of Olingan. She is 58 years old. Clemencia is married and has 3 grown-up children. To make a living, Clemencia runs a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community, and she is also engaged in rice retailing. Clemencia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Clemencia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clemencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. Clemencia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business which is the rice retailing. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Clemencia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Bozorgul

texts.ru: Бозоргул Бобоназарова проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 56 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. бозоргул имеет торговую точку на рынке, где занимается торговлей более 14 лет. В основном она торгует продуктами питания. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Bozorgul B. lives in the city of Kulob. She is 56 years old, married and has 4 children. Bozorgul has a retail outlet at a market, where she has been involved in sales for over 14 years. She primarily sells food products. She is requesting a loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Khoshbo Group

texts.en:
This is Khoshbo group which is made up of two female members. Sheba is the group leader. She is 37, and married with four children. She is a tailor and sews different kinds of clothes, especially children’s clothes which she decorates with nice designs. Most of her neighbors like her way of work and bring their clothes to her to sew and all her family members benefit from the income she generates. She wants to take a loan to buy the things she needs for her business.

The other member of this group is Bebe G. who wants to take a loan for her husband who has got a retail shop. With the loan he would like to purchase the essential materials he needs for his shop and would like to progress as well.

They have requested a group loan of 28000 Afghani. 

Both women would like to thank all the lenders, and especially Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her business.

loans.name: Keran

texts.en:
Keran N. is forty-four years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is a driver and their children are still in school. Her business is located at Eastleigh estate in Nairobi where she engages in making and selling ladies' suits, skirts, dresses and uniforms for schoolchildren.
Keran serves the local people. Her major challenge is lack of enough funds and strong competition, which is why she has borrowed Kes. 50,000 to buy more materials. In future, she hopes to expand her business and give her children a good education. She is hardworking, friendly and respectful.

loans.use: To buy materials for making ladies' dresses.

loans.name: Aridna

texts.en:
Aridna R. is from the village of Larayan. She is 45 years old. Aridna is widowed and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Aridna runs a food stall selling a variety of food products including viands in the local community. Aridna has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,900 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Aridna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aridna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. Aridna is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Aridna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and especially to pay for the education expenditures of her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital.

loans.name: Normita

texts.en:
Normita J., 49, is making sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. Married to Jimmy J., a jeepney operator, they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been selling different forms of snacks for two years.

Normita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than four years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow ten times in CCT’s Cooperative.  The reason why she was consistent in paying her dues was because she used all the money she borrowed to buy for various cooking ingredients. Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 14,400 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be mostly used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying ingredients like sugar, sticky rice and milk for making assorted rice cakes.

She dreams that her business will grow so that she can sell her products in different markets as a wholesale vendor.   


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making various types of food snacks.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca S. is from the village of Dawo. She is 48 years old. Rebecca is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Rebecca owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Rebecca joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & for working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Rebecca from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & for working capital

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife O., 22, likes to cook different food. Married to Arvin Padayao, a sales clerk, she makes herself busy by managing her own mini food stand and helping her husband earn money.  She has been selling different kinds of homemade food for four years.

Marife has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than three years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently.

Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow eight times from CCT’s Cooperative.  The reason why she was consistent in paying her dues was because she used almost all the money she borrowed as added capital for her food business.  Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 18,000 per month.  

Now, with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 12,000 loan. This amount will be mostly used as a source of added capital for expanding her business by buying different food ingredients and seasoning for the food that she sells in her food stand.

She dreams that one day her mini food stand will become a restaurant for their family business. 


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy different food ingredients and seasoning for the food she sells

loans.name: Noneluna

texts.en: Noneluna L. is from the village of Sulangon. She is 37 years old. Noneluna is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Noneluna owns & operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Noneluna has been engaged in her business for over 9 years with approximate average monthly earnings of 3,000 PHP from these activities. In 2009, Noneluna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noneluna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Noneluna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Noneluna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially the education of her children. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani S. is a 25-year-old young man and has been the owner of a general goods store in Anzeh, Jineen, for the last four years. This is in addition to his job in the security branch of the Palestinian National Authority.

Since Hani has a good number of customers and has the needed experience, he is applying for a loan from FATEN in order to upgrade his store and provide his customers with new types of goods.

This loan will help Hani to have better living conditions as well as a better income which will help him to get married and start his own family, as he is planning to do.

Hani appears in the photo at his store.

loans.use: To buy more goods for his store

loans.name: Chamila

texts.ru: Куганова Чамила проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 45 лет. Вдова, имеет 2 детей. Чамила имеет среднее образование. Она более 10 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. В ее ассортимент входит одежда. Кредит просит для закупа нового ассортимента и увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Chamila K. lives in the city of Kulob. She is 45 years old, a widow and has 2 children. Chamila has a secondary education. She has been involved in retail sales at a market for over 10 years. Her merchandise assortment includes clothing. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase new variety of merchandise and increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Samardin

texts.ru: Самардин Сабуров проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 30 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Сабуров более 10 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Кредит просит для закупа крупно рогатого скота. У него имеются постоянные клиенты, мясники.
texts.en:
Samardin S. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 30 years old, married and has 2 children. S. has been involved in animal husbandry for over 10 years. He raises and sells livestock. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase cattle. He has consistent customers, butchers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Launching small poultry business

loans.name: Ndiome

texts.en: Mr. Ndiome T. buys and sells goats in Bambey, a rural community situated half way between Dakar and the sacred town of Touba.  He began this activity five years ago to supplement his income from farming.  With the loan of 200,000 FCFA he would like to diversify a bit and buy a steer to raise.  This is Mr. T.'s first loan from UIMCEC.

loans.use: Buying a steer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy plastic chairs

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Mrs. Cristita A., 54 years of age, is a cultivator of papaya in the barangay of Garang, Tangub City. She is married to Teogenes, a businessman. The family is blessed with 3 children now in their adult age. They were able to support them from the income of their agricultural activity. Today, she is earning an average net income of not less than 3,000 PHP a month. 

She joined PAGLAUM MPC 2 years ago because she is very much interested with PMPC's various products and services. This time she is applying for a loan amount of 10,000 PHP to finance the purchase of fertilizers for the cultivation and production of papaya. The future income from this loan will be used for their daily basic needs and for repayments of her loan to our cooperative.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizers for the cultivation and production of papaya

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Mrs. Felicitas M. is 51 years of age, married and a resident of Sta. Cruz, Tangub City. She is blessed with 7 children and most of them are adults.  Only one is a minor dependent to her and one is married. Her husband is a farmer and laborer and earns less than 5,000 PHP a month. With this condition it is difficult for the couple to support their large family. She decided to engage in the business of selling “dayok” , a salted fish appetizer. The earnings she has made has helped them meet the family's needs. 

She joined PAGLAUM MPC early this year because she is very much interested with their their services. As a newly recognized member, she has earned the privilege of making a loan amount of 4,000 PHP. She will ad this to her working capital for her existing business. Her future plan is to expand her market by selling products to nearby towns.

loans.use: Additional capital for her "Dayok" vending business

location.town: Sta. Cruz, Tangub, City, Misamis Occidental, Minda

loans.name: Attallah

texts.en:
Attallah is a 43-year-old married man with three children. He is a courageous man who fights to provide for the needs of his family. He works as a construction worker, specialized in floor tiles.

Today, he is requesting a loan of US$ 3000 in order to buy a floor tile polisher .

loans.use: To buy a floor tile polisher

loans.name: Khoudia Fall

texts.en:
Ms. Khoudia Fall S. is a certified horticultural technician, but has been managing her brother's carpentry business for four years.  The workshop is located in the Medina Fall neighborhood of Thies, a city about 70 km from the capital, Dakar.  The workshop employs a carpenter, a machinist to operate the heavier saws and five apprentices.  They make both ready-to-use furniture for clients, but also do work for other carpenters in the neighborhood who do not have electric saws.  Ms. S. explains it takes about two weeks to complete a bedroom set (bed, night tables and armoire).  Problems with electricity blackouts are a daily headache, but still business is decent.

With the loan of 200,000 FCFA Ms. S. will purchase materials (wood, paneling, glue, etc.) to have on hand for their work.  This is Ms. S.'s first credit, though she has been a member of the bank since 2005.

loans.use: Purchasing wood, paneling and glue

loans.name: Thafer

texts.en:
Thafer is 21 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in the city of Gaza, Palestine. 

Thafer dedicates himself to repairing, buying and selling various models and brands of cell phones. 
His business is currently doing well. To meet increased demand, he is asking for a loan of 3000 USD 
in order to buy more phones and accessories .

loans.use: Buy more phones and accessories

loans.name: Abdou Karim

texts.en:
Mr. Abdou Karim M. has a small carpentry workshop in the Medina Fall neighborhood of Thies, a city about 70km from Dakar.  Mr. M. has been a member of UIMCEC since 2000 and this will be his fourth loan.  Mr. M. and his six apprentices do almost all of their work by hand, carving intricate designs and sandpapering the wood for a smooth finish.  After not doing very well in school, Mr. M. said he chose this profession thanks to an uncle who was also a carpenter.  A bedroom set (bed, armoir and nightable) can take up to six weeks to finish.  

With the credit, Mr. M. will replenish his stock of wood for his work.  He will also help his brother relaunch his small business.  Mr. M. is married and the father of two young children.

loans.use: Purchasing wood

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad was born in 1989 and grew up in Palestine. He has been in the business of animal sales for the past 2 years. He is expanding this business because it is very profitable. 

Ahmad would like to receive a loan from Ryada to purchase several more sheep to resell.

loans.use: Purchase several more sheep to resell

loans.name: Mazen

texts.en: Mazen is a single young man, 27 years of age. He owns a grocery store in the city of Gaza. He would like to use this loan to expand the capacity of his commerce by acquiring supplies of new products for his store. Given this chance, he will earn more funds and save more. He says thank you!

loans.use: To stock his store

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa has owned a barber shop since 2007. He is a 27-year-old man who lives in Ramallah, Palestine with his parents. Alaa knows how to treat his clients and does good work.

Alaa requested a loan from Ryada in order to change the décor of his salon and purchase accessories. In the future, he plans on improving his business by purchasing more sophisticated tools. He would appreciate your assistance very much.

loans.use: To change the décor of his salon and purchase accessories

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a single young man, 26 years old. He lives with his parents and his 5 siblings whom he loves dearly He has the responsibility of taking care of them and wants to increase his income in order to give his family a better life. 

Khaled operates a grocery store in his neighborhood. He started his operation one year ago. He sells products like rice, canned foods, drinks, candies, etc. With the loan, Khaled wants to buy more products to increase his stock of goods.

loans.use: To increase his supplies of groceries

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy J. is from the village of Mobod. She is 36 years old. Cristy is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Cristy owns & operates a "sari-sari" store business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. In 2001, Cristy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristy has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Cristy is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 13th loan taken out by Cristy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house & store. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rhiza

texts.en:
A newly recognized member of the PDP-LP, a microfinance program of PMPC is Mrs. Rhiza P.. She is 35 years of age, married and a resident of Sta. Cruz, Tangub City. Her husband is a farmer and a laborer. At this time the couple still do not have any child. As a micro-entrepreneur, she is engaged in selling “dayok”, a salted fish appetizer. She earns an average net income of 2,000 PHP. 

She joined PAGLAUM MPC just this year as she is very much interested with the Coop's products and services. As a newly recognized member, she has requested a loan amount of 3,000 PHP to add the working capital of her existing business. She hopes that someday they will have a child to complete their family.

loans.use: Additional capital for her "Dayok" selling business

location.town: Sta. Cruz, Tangub, City, Misamis Occidental, Minda

loans.name: Jenny-Vi

texts.en: Jenny-Vi A. is from the village of Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is 29 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Jenny-Vi, owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for three years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2007, Jenny-Vi joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Jenny-Vi is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her third from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie E. is from the village of Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is 57 years old, married, and has one school-aged and two adult children.

Vergie owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for almost five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Vergie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Mrs. Leonida B. is from the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old, is married, and is blessed with three adult children. Together with her husband (shown in the photo), Leonida owns and operates a business selling spices in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns 2,500 PHP net monthly. In 2009, Leonida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Leonida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda A. achieved her dream of graduating her two children from college. It was through the financial and emotional support of her husband who is a laborer as well as her own hard work and determination that this dream came true. However, Rosalinda’s battle against poverty doesn’t stop there. Her greatest dream of changing the family lifestyle has not yet been reached. Her two elder children have their own family and have been giving financial support to Rosalinda irregularly.
