That is why Rosalinda has to have her own source of income and earn her own way to send her youngest 19-year-old son to college.  

Recently Rosalinda became a member of, the KIVA field partner in the Philippines. She requested a loan which she will use to finance her dress making business. She has had this business for a long time but she could not increase the size of the business because of too many financial obligations. Her income in addition to her husband’s is insufficient to cover up all of their family expenses. 

Rosalinda’s business costumers are people around their village. They like Rosalinda’s work because of its good quality. With a larger business capital, Rosalinda plans to put up a bigger dress shop separated from their house and employ more dress makers.

Rosalinda is happy about joining ASHI because of the loans that she can request and the new friends she has found.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for her dress making business.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly A. is from the village of Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is 50 years old, is married, and has eight adult children. Merly owns and operates a business selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for almost two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Merly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Merly is now requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en: Meriam B. is from the village of Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is 37 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Meriam owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for almost five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Meriam joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. Meriam is now requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her sixth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity W. T. is thirty-nine years old, is married, and has three children. Her husband is a taxi driver and their children are in school.

Charity’s business is located at Eastleigh in Nairobi where she engages in selling tailoring accessories to the local tailors. Previously she was selling materials for making ladies’ dresses and had a dream to supply tailoring accessories in future.

Charity’s major challenge is her products not being able to move as fast as she would like because of the escalating prices. As such she is using her loan to expand her business to reach more tailors to increase her income. She also hopes to give her children an education to university level. She is hardworking and calm.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring accessories

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
La señorita Mónica Díaz  vive en la Av. Saavedra de la zona Miraflores en la ciudad de La Paz.
 
Mónica vive junto a sus padres y trabaja en el Banco BISA como cajera.

Con este crédito solicitado pretende hacer efectivo el pago de la mensualidad de la universidad en la que ella estudia.

Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro; con este crédito, Mónica tendrá la oportunidad de continuar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Miss Mónica Díaz lives on Saavedra Avenue in the Miraflores zone of the city of La Paz. Mónica lives with her parents and works at the BISA Bank as a teller. She will use the proceeds of this loan to pay the monthly tuition at the university where she is a student. This is her first loan request with Impro; with this loan Mónica will be able to continue her studies at the university.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Payment of tuition at the university in order to continue her studies.

loans.name: Telma

texts.es:
La señora Telma H. vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona  de Ciudad Satélite, de la ciudad de El Alto, con su esposo y sus dos hijitos de edad escolar.
La señora Telma trabaja como mesera en un restaurante de la ciudad de La Paz, y su esposo trabaja como chofer del transporte publico, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la adquisición de un anticrítico (es una forma legal de alquilar un bien inmueble por un monto total determinado por el plazo de uno a dos años, al cabo de los cuales el dueño del inmueble devuelve el dinero al inquilino), pues en casa de sus padres no cuentan con el espacio suficiente para su familia.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Telma H. lives at home with her parents, in a satellite town of El Alto city, with her husband and their two small school age children. Telma works as a waitress in a restaurant in the city of La Paz and her husband works as a public transport driver. They use this income to support their family. The requested loan is for the purchase of an antichretic contract (it is a legal method of renting a good property for a fixed sum for a period of one or two years, after which the owner of the property returns the money to the tenant), as they do not have sufficient space for their family in her parents' house. This is the first time she has asked for a loan and the socioeconomic analysis undertaken is favorable meaning she can be given a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Payment of antichretic contract to be able to gain independence and live with her family.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La señora Maruja vive en alquiler en la Av. Ramos Gavilán de la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la venta de dulces y refrescos en la Terminal de la ciudad en un puesto de venta de su propiedad. El crédito que solicita es para aumento de capital y poder comprar más dulces y refrescos para ofrecer a sus clientes..

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito a través de Impro, y por la actividad que desempeña y el carácter social puede acceder a un crédito
texts.en:
Maruja lives in a rented home on Ramos Gavilán Ave. in the Achachicala area of La Paz. She sells candy and refreshments in the city’s terminal from a stand she owns. The loan she seeks is to increase her capital and be able to buy more candy and refreshments to offer her customers. This is the first time she seeks a loan throughImpro, and through her work and character she can access a line of credit.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy candy and refreshments to sell to her customers

loans.name: La Victoria (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Victoria se encuentra ubicado al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca en  la parroquia del mismo nombre en honor a la batalla ocurrida en las faldas del Portete el 27 de Febrero de 1829, su fiestas son a mediados de Octubre en honor a la Virgen del Monte, la mayor parte de su población se dedica a la  producción  de leche,  su gente es muy amable y generosa y están dispuestas a luchar en la vida para tener una mejor calidad de vida y entregar lo mejor a su familia.

Gloria Pérez es socia de éste banco hace cinco años, su cuñada que ahora vive en España la incentivó a formar parte del mismo, ella tiene 49 años y vive en la comunidad  la Victoria del Portete con su esposo que trabaja como carpintero y sus cinco hijos 25, 23, 21, 17, 16 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en la Universidad Estatal y los dos últimos en el colegio Febres Cordero, gracias al trabajo en pareja lograron construir su casa pequeña pero propia.

Gloria se dedica  al  bordado  de polleras arte que le enseño su hermana, lleva treinta años realizando esta  actividad para lo cual  busca a sus posibles clientes en varios lugares de la ciudad y también con conocidos o referidos que le dan sus clientes, pero también se dedica a la cría de pollos   actividad  que ha realizado toda su vida, sus aves las comercializa en su comunidad   o cuando recibe pedidos. Con el préstamo realizado  a invertir en la compra de tela para seguir con sus bordados.

Su meta es arreglar su casa poco a poco.

La señora María Rosalía Pérez tiene 51 años de edad,  es otra socia activa de éste banco hace ya  cinco años siendo una compañera quien la invito a  formar  parte del grupo, ella vive  en la parroquia del mismo nombre de su banco comunal con sus dos hijos de 29 y 22 años, el mayor ya es Ing. Mecánico y el segundo estudia en el  SECAP (Secretaria de Capacitación Profesional), su esposo falleció hace un mes y  nos comenta que no le afectó mucho su muerte porque ya vivían separados,   en su unión matrimonial lograron construir su casa propia de adobe.

María  trabaja en  servicio  domestico todos los días pero  también se dedica  a la cría de animales como pollos y cuyes que  los vende en su comunidad ya que en las ferias no pagan el  precio justo, con el préstamo realizado va a  comprar  pollos, maíz, vacunas y abono orgánico para sus potreros.

Su sueño es  poder mejorar su casa poco a poco  para tener una mejor  calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The La Victoria communal bank is located in the South of the city of Cuenca, in the area named in honor of the battle that occurred at the foot of Portete on February 27th, 1829. The festival is in mid-October in honor of the Virgen del Monte. The majority of the population works in milk production. They are friendly and generous people, disposed to fighting to find a better quality of life and give the best to their families.

Gloria Pérez has been a member of the bank for five years. Her sister-in-law, who now lives in Spain, invited her to join. She is 49 years old and lives in the Victoria del Portete neighborhood with her husband, who works as a carpenter, and their five children who are 25, 23, 21, 17, and 16 years old. Her first three children are studying in the State University and the younger two are in Febres Cordero high school. Thanks to their joined efforts, they were able to construct a home that is small but theirs.

Gloria works sewing colorful skirts, as her brother taught her. She has worked in this for thirty years and finds her customers in various parts of the city, often through acquaintances or recommendations from her customers. Also, she works raising chickens, which she has done her whole life. Her birds are sold in the city or by order. With this loan, she will invest in the purchase of fabrics to continue with her sewing. Her goal is improve her home, little by little.

Maria Roselia Pérez is 51 years old. She is another active member of the bank and has been for five years since a companion invited her to be in the group. She lives in the neighborhood of the same name as the communal bank with her two sons, 29 and 22 years old. The elder is a mechanic, and the younger studies in SECAP (professional school). Her husband died a year ago, and they tell us that it doesn’t affect them too much, because they were not living together. During their matrimony, they were able to construct their own adobe home.

Maria works in domestic services every day, but also works raising animals such as chickens and guinea pigs that she sells in the community since the markets don’t pay a fair price. With this loan, she will purchase chickens, corn, vaccines and organic soil for her fields. Her dream is to improve her home little by little to have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, chickens, corn, vaccines and organic soil

loans.name: Mariana Elizabeth

texts.es:
El banco comunal Atenas se formó con  mujeres que  tienen un gran vinculo de amistad y formaron un buen equipo de  trabajo,  las socias viven en diferentes  partes de la urbe cuencana, está cuidad está  ubicada en la zona austral y es la capital de la provincia del Azuay, esta  localidad es muy reconocida por sus escritores y artistas, su belleza arquitectónica, los cuatro ríos que bañan la ciudad,  las hábiles manos de sus artesanos, su suculenta gastronomía y su gente cálida atraen al turista nacional y extranjero.

Mariana Álvarez vive en el barrio las Orquídeas en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 27 años de edad  se encuentra casada y en su unión ha procreado dos  hijos que se encuentran de 6 y 1 año de edad, su hijo mayor está en segundo año de  educación básica en la escuela Isabel Moscoso Dávila, su esposo es chofer de  profesión  y labora en un taxi, no tiene casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Mariana trabaja como secretaria en la empresa de taxis Cristal actividad que realiza hace 7 años, no tiene horario fijo ya que sus turnos son rotativos,  sus hijos quedan al cuidado de su mamá o de su esposo mientras ella trabaja.

Nuestra socia trabaja con la Fundación hace seis años invitada por su madre a formar parte del banco comunal  y desde entonces  ha realizado préstamos para ayudarse con los gastos de la casa, además nos comenta que se retiró un ciclo pero  reingresó nuevamente y con el credito solicitado  va a comprar adornos navideños como bombillos, luces, estrellas, nacimientos para vender en esta temporada y comenzar con un nuevo negocio.

Su sueño es poder ahorrar para comprar un terreno y luego construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Atenas Communal Bank was established by women who have a great bond of friendship, and they created a great working team. The members live in different parts of the city of Cuenca. This city is located in the southern region, and it is the capital of Azuay Province. It is renowned for its writers, artists, its beautiful architecture, the four rivers that bathe the city, the skillful hands of its artisans, and its succulent food. The warmth of its people attracts national and foreign tourists. Mariana Álvarez lives in the Orquídeas neighborhood in the city of Cuenca. She is 27, married, and has two children. One is six, and the other is one. Her oldest child is in the second grade of elementary school at the Isabel Moscoso Dávila School. Her husband is a driver, and he works in a taxi. They do not have their own home, and they live in a rented home. Mariana works as a secretary for the Cristal Taxi Company. She has done this for seven years. She does not have a fixed schedule because her shifts rotate. Her mother or her husband takes care of the children while Mariana works. She has worked with the Foundation for six years. Her mother invited her to join the communal bank. From then on she has had loans to help her with the household expenses. Also, she comments that she retired for one cycle, but she joined again. She will use the loan she is asking for to buy Christmas decorations like lights, stars, and mangers to sell in this season and to start a new business. Her dream is to be able to save to buy a piece of land and then build her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy lights, stars, mangers, and other Christmas decoraction

loans.name: Alpaquitas Del Sur Group

texts.es:
“Alpaquitas del sur” un grupo particular conformado por 9 mujeres y 1 varón que pertenece al Centro Focal Exaltación, así, Ruth V. es la Presidenta, como Tesorera está Yuly G. y como Secretaria de Actas  Maria S., las tres organizan a su base y llevan adelante su reunión con el objetivo de elaborar su reglamento interno.
Todas tienen diferentes negocios de producción, servicio y comercialización y necesitan el crédito para invertir en sus negocios y generar ingresos para darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
“Alpaquitas del sur” (Little alpacas from the south) is a group consisting of 9 women and 1 man, belonging to the Centro Focal Exaltación. Ruth V. is the President, Treasurer is Yuly G., Maria S. is Secretary. The three organize their group and carry out the meetings with the objective of creating their internal organization. They all have different businesses related to manufacturing, service, and retail; they need a loan to invest in their businesses and generate income to provide a better quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for their respective businesses

loans.name: Doris Beatriz

texts.es:
El banco comunal Atenas se formó con  mujeres que  tienen un gran vinculo de amistad y formaron un buen equipo de  trabajo,  las socias viven en diferentes  partes de la urbe cuencana, está cuidad está  ubicada en la zona austral y es la capital de la provincia del Azuay, esta  localidad es muy reconocida por sus escritores y artistas, su belleza arquitectónica, los cuatro ríos que bañan la ciudad,  las hábiles manos de sus artesanos, su suculenta gastronomía y su gente cálida atraen al turista nacional y extranjero.


Doris V. tiene 37 años,   vive  con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos de   16, 10, 8, 7 años de edad en la urbe cuencana,  su esposo trabaja como contratista de construcción,  su hija mayor estudia en el colegio Ciudad de Cuenca, su hija de 10 en la escuela Dolores J. Torres y sus dos últimos hijos en la escuela Gabriela Mistral, aún  no tienen casa propia por lo que viven  en casa de su suegra.

Doris trabaja como empleada hace cinco años,  su horario es de 8 a.m. hasta las 1 p.m. y el resto día  se dedica a la venta de productos Avon, Yanbal hace un año, las pocas ganancias que obtiene aporta a su hogar para cubrir algunas necesidades urgentes.

Nuestra socia lleva trece años integrando su banco comunal incentivada por su cuñada a ser parte del mismo,  se retiró un tiempo y regresó  nuevamente como socia activa de su banco hace cuatro años, los préstamos recibidos los ha invertido en necesidades de su casa ahora con  el crédito solicitado  va a  comprar perfumes, cremas, labiales, tratamientos, bisutería y más cosméticos de las líneas Avon y Yanbal para la temporada navideña para ofrecer a sus clientes e incrementar su negocio.

Su  sueño es llegar a tener  su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Atenas Communal Bank was established by women who have a great bond of friendship, and they created a great working team. The members live in different parts of the city of Cuenca. This city is located in the southern region, and it is the capital of Azuay Province. It is renowned for its writers, artists, its beautiful architecture, the four rivers that bathe the city, the skillful hands of its artisans, and its succulent food. The warmth of its people attracts national and foreign tourists. Doris V. is 37, and she lives with her husband and their four children. They are 16, 10, 8, and 7. They live in the city of Cuenca. Her husband works as a construction contractor. Her oldest daughter goes to the City of Cuenca School. Her ten year old daughter goes to the Dolores J. Torres School. The two other children go to the Gabriela Mistral School. They do not yet have their own house, so they live in her mother-in-law’s house. Doris has worked as an employee for five years. Her schedule is from 8 a.m. until 1 p.m. The rest of the day she sells Avon and Yanbal products. She has been doing this for one year. The small earnings that she gets contribute to her household to cover some urgent necessities. She has been a member of the communal bank for three years. She was motivated to join by her sister-in-law. She retired for a time, but she came back as an active member four years ago. She has invested the loans she has received in the necessities of her household. She will use the loan she is now asking for to buy perfume, creams, lipsticks, treatments, jewelry, and more Avon and Yanbal cosmetics for the Christmas season. She will offer the products to her customers and expand her business. Her dream is to come to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfume, creams, lipsticks, treatments and other cosmetics

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena tiene 42 años, ella tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a esta humilde actividad. Ella tenía muchas dificultades y decidió sacar a sus hijos y su familia adelante, y decide realizar la compra de ropa usada, debido a que sus ingresos no eran suficientes para sustentar a su hogar, por lo que salía a recorrer las calles ofreciendo la ropa, lamentablemente algunas veces no lograba vender mucho, pero no se dio por vencida y además de salir a vender por las calles también ofrecía sus productos a sus vecinos. Y es por este motivo que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa de cama, ropa para niños, para damas por lo que le permitirán diversificar mas las ofertas de sus productos y así generar un poco de ingresos ya que se acerca la temporada navideña. Maria tiene el deseo de establecer una tienda de ropa en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is 42 and has three children. They all work in an independent manner. She sells used clothes. She has been doing this humble work for over three years. She has had many difficulties. She decided to get her children and her family ahead. She decided to buy used clothes because she did not have enough income to support her household. That is why she left to travel the streets offering her clothes. Unfortunately, sometimes she was not able to sell much. But, she did not give up. Besides leaving to sell on the streets, she also offered her products to her neighbors. That is why she is asking for this loan for working capital to buy bed linens, children’s clothes, and women’s clothes. This will allow her to diversify more the products that she sells. That way she will generate a little more income because Christmas season is approaching. Maria wishes to establish a clothing store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Digna Margarita

texts.es:
El banco comunal Atenas se formó con  mujeres que  tienen un gran vinculo de amistad y formaron  un buen equipo de  trabajo,  las socias viven en diferentes  partes de la urbe cuencana, está cuidad está  ubicada en la zona austral y es la capital de la provincia del Azuay, esta  localidad es muy reconocida por sus escritores y artistas, su belleza arquitectónica, los cuatro ríos que bañan la ciudad,  las hábiles manos de sus artesanos, su suculenta gastronomía y su gente cálida atraen al turista nacional y extranjero.

Digna  B. vive en  la parroquia  Carmen de Sidcay,  tiene 48 años de edad y se encuentra divorciada  de su primer compromiso del que concibió tres hijos que ahora tienen 29,28 y 24 años  todos ellos ya casados,  desde hace 23 años tiene un nuevo compromiso y con él procrearon seis hijos que se encuentran de  20, 18, 17, 15, 13 y 8 años de edad, su hijo mayor es casado y vive independientemente, mientras que su hijo de 18 años trabajaba en un taller de fibra de vidrio realizando payasos para colocar la basura y estudia en el colegio San Francisco,  sus hijas de 17 y 13  estudian en el colegio Israel, su hijo de 15 en el colegio Manuel J. C. y su ultimo hijo en la escuela Federico Malo, no tienen casa propia viven y cuidan  el taller de su cuñado que no les cobra arriendo.

Digna es socia activa de éste banco desde hace tres ciclos incentivada por una amiga que también socia del msimo, nos comenta que antes trabajaba lavando ropa ajena, limpiando casas pero se enfermó y tuvo que dejar esta actividad,  desde hace cinco meses trabaja elaborando guaipe (trapos para limpiar),  los préstamos obtenidos los ha invertido en su negocio y con el crédito solicitado va a comprar  tela para la fabricación de guaipe, para los estudios de sus hijos y para llevar los productos necesarios a su hogar.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener su casa propia así sea pequeña.
texts.en:
lThe community bank Atenas was founded by women who share great friendship ties and establish a good work team. The partners live in different parts of the urban basin. This city is located in the southern zone and is the capital of the province of Azuay, well-known by writers and artists- Its architectural beauty, the four rivers surrounding the city, the skilled hands of the artesans, its succulent gastronomy, and its warm people attract national and international tourists.

Digna B. lives in the parish, Carmen de Sidcay, she is 48 years old, divorced with three children, 29, 28, and 24 years old, all married. For the past 23 years she has had another commitment and has six children, 20, 18, 17, 15, 13, and 8 years old. Her oldest son is married and lives independently. Her 18 year-old son works at a fiberglass factory making clowns for trash and studies at the San Francisco school. Her daughters, 17 and 13 years old, study at the Israel school, her son of 15 at the Manuel J. C. school and her youngest son at the Federico Malo school. They do not own their house and they take care of her brother-in-law's workshop who does not charge rent.

Digna has been an active partner of this bank for three cycles, motivated by a friend who is also a partner. She tells us that previously she worked doing laundry and cleaning houses but she fell ill and had to stop. For the past five months she has been working making "guaipe" (dust clothes). The previous loans have been invested in her business and with the loan requested she will buy fabric for "guaipe", pay tuition for her children and purchase the necessary products for her home. It is her dream to own a house even small.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cloth for "guaipe", pay tuition for her children, and buy products needed for her home.

loans.name: Maya Group

texts.es:
El banco D. emprendimiento maya se compone por una mesa directiva: la Presidenta es la señora Susan karina, que se dedica a la venta D. muebles, que vive en casa D. alquiler  junto a sus 2 hijos en la zona D. cadeca; la Secretaria  es la señora Lizbeth, que se dedica a la venta D. muebles que vive en casa D. alquiler en la zona D. kami junto a sus 3 hijos; la tesorera es la señora Jacoba, que se dedica a la  venta D. muebles que vive en casa alquilada junto a su hija la zona D. cadeca.

El grupo es nuevo, ya  que por primera vez se esta trabajando con las esposas D. los reos D. la carcel D. san pablo (quillacollo, estan presos por distintos delitos pero tienen ganas D. trabajar y superarse, por esta razon estan agradecidos con la institucion por que no les niega la oportunidad D. reabilitarse ya que estos señores señores se dedican a la produccion D. muebles son personas que se ayudan mutuamente y sus esposas son las que comercializan los muebles.
texts.en:
The governing board of the Maya Communal Bank is headed by Susan Karina, the President. She sells furniture. She lives in a rented house with her two children in the Cadeca zone. The Secretary is Lizbeth. Lizbeth sells furniture. She lives with her three children in a rented house in the Kami zone. The Treasurer is Jacoba. She sells furniture and lives with her daughter in a rented house in the Cadeca zone. The group is new. For the first time they are working with the wives of the criminals in the San Pablo jail in Quillacollo. They are in prison for different crimes, but they have the desire to work and improve themselves. For that reason, they are grateful to the institution for not denying them to opportunity to rehabilitate themselves. These men produce the furniture. They are people who help each other, and their wives sell the furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy work material

loans.name: Patak Pollerita Group

texts.es: “Patak Pollerira”, significa cien polleras (falda) es  un grupo  que recientemente se conformó para acceder al préstamo y los demás servicios que oferta Pro Mujer, se reúnen en el Centro Focal Exaltación, liderizadas por su mesa directiva así, Shirley B. es la Presidenta, como Tesorera está Maria A. y como Secretaria de Actas  Eva R.. Todas tienen diferentes negocios de producción, servicio y comercialización y necesitan el crédito para invertir en sus negocios y generar ingresos para darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
“Patak Pollerira”, which means one hundred “polleras” (traditional skirts) is a group recently formed in order to access a loan and other services offered by Pro Mujer. They meet in the Centro Focal Exaltación, guided by their executive board. Shirley B. is the President, Maria A. is Treasurer, Eva R. is Secretary. All have different business in manufacturing, service and retail and they need a loan to invest in their businesses and generate income in order to provide a better quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and materials

loans.name: Mario Anastacio

texts.es: El señor Mario Anastacio tiene 53 años de edad, es casado y tiene 5 hijos, cuatro de los cuales ya son mayores de edad y un menor. El señor se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte de carga pesada, con viajes a Costa Rica y Centroamérica. El señor dio inicio a este negocio hace 33 años, primeramente realizaba transportes con una camioneta, luego compro un camión, y después, con el tiempo y con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro pudo hacerse de un furgón, que es el que actualmente posee. El señor está solicitando este crédito ya que piensa comprar dos llantas con sus neumáticos nº 120020, ya que el furgón las tiene estas llantas en muy mal estado. El mayor desafió que siempre ha tenido él como empresario ha sido la pérdida de su hija, la cual falleció hace ya varios años, sin embargo esto los ayudo a unificarse mas como familia. De allí nace que su mayor sueño siempre ha sido establecer una empresa familiar de transporte y que sus hijos puedan trabajar con el.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario Anastacio is 53 years old, married, with 5 children. Four are of legal age and one is a minor. For a living he transports heavy loads to Costa Rica and Central America. He started his business 33 years ago, previously he transported with a pickup truck and later he bought a truck and with time and much effort he saved money and bought a boxcar which he presently uses. He is requesting a loan as he wants to buy two tires No. 120020 as the tires of the boxcar are in bad condition. The biggest challenge he has faced as a businessman, was the loss of his daughter who passed away several years ago. Nevertheless this has helped to unify his family. Therefore his dream is to establish a family transportation enterprise and that his children work with him.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia H. A. is forty-four years, single and has seven children between the ages of twenty years and 18 months. Previously she was selling cabbages and later changed to selling clothes and perfumes.  She is using her loan to buy trousers, perfumes, bed covers and jackets.

Despite harrasment from the local authority, Safia is determined to grow her business and own a boutique in the future. She also hopes to build her own house someday. She is hardworking, dedicated and friendly.

loans.use: To buy trousers, perfumes, bedcovers and jackets.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana de 24 años es una joven muy alegre y sincera, vive en la casa de su madrina y lo que más desea es forjarse un buen futuro.Empieza a trabajar visitando a sus clientes en sus mismas casas, así realiza la venta de sus productos de belleza, es una vendedora muy persistente y convincente, motivo por el cual termina con la ventas de sus cosméticos rápidamente. En su barrio es muy conocida y saben que los productos que vende son de muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejarles a sus clientas sobre lo que mejor le quedará a su rostro, lleva 2 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cobrar, por la venta de sus productos, ya que no siempre sus clientes tienen dinero  para pagarle, pero ella siempre se las arregla para que le paguen el dinero  completo de  todas sus ventas. Para el futuro  espera aperturar  su tienda de cosméticos, donde pueda vender con  comodidad y sin la necesidad de ir casa por casa.Este es su  primer préstamo con  MFP, quiere hacer crecer su negocio, es por eso que desea pagar a tiempo todas sus cuotas para poder acceder a otros préstamos, además sabe que cuenta con el apoyo de su banco comunal.Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará mayor cantidad de cosméticos, para aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Diana is a happy and sincere 24 year-old lady. She lives in the godmother's house and it is her dream to create a good future. She started to work visiting her customers at home selling beauty products. She is a very persistent and convincing saleslady, reason why she finishes her cosmetics sales rapidly. She is well-known in her neighborhood and people know that her products are excellent. What she likes the most about her work is to give advice to her customers about what fits their faces the best. She has been doing this for the past 2 years and the most difficult part for her is collecting as her clients not always have the money to pay, but she always manages so she receives all the money for her sales. For the future she wishes to open a cosmetics store where she can sell comfortably and without having to go from door to door. This is her first loan with MFP, she wants to make her business grow therefore she plans to repay punctually in order to have access to other loans. She knows that she can count on the support of her community bank. With the eight hundred soles requested, she will buy more cosmetics to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: El Señor Javier vive con su esposa que tambien se dedica al comercio de articulos del hogar y tienen una pequeña hija, el Sr. javier vende viveres por mayor y por menor, normalmente el compra mercaderia de las mayoristas que llegan de otras ciudades de nuestro pais, y reparte según los pedidos que el tiene, el señor tambien esta aprendiendo el arte de la orfebreria ya que el abuelo de su esposa reliza este trabajo y el desea  mas adelante poder tambien ofrecer sus productos al mercado con diseños propios, la venta de los viveres le generan un buen ingreso pero le ocaciona un desgaste fisico ya que este tipo de viveres le llega en quintales y normalmente el carga y descarga su mercaderia. El Sr. Javier es una persona responsable y esta  agradecido con la institucion por la oportunidad que se le brinda en la otorgacion del credito
texts.en:
Javier lives with his wife who also sells articles for the home, and they have a small daughter. Javier sells goods at wholesale and retail. Normally he buys merchandise from wholesalers that come of other cities to our country, and the delivers according to the order he has. He also is learning the art of gold/silver smithing as his wife’s grandfather does this work and he wishes to be able to offer his products with his own design in the market in the future. The sale of the household goods generates good income but he has a disadvantage in that these types of goods arrive to him every 15 days and then he carries and distributes the merchandise. Javier is a responsible person and is grateful to the institution for providing him this opportunity to have a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: José Alonso

texts.es: José Alonso A. P. de 63 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador, tiene cuatro hijos, tres de los cuales están casados. Vive junto a su esposa y su hijo menor de 15 años de edad. El señor José posee una barbería, la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitación. Debido a la amplia experiencia que él posee, cuenta con muchos clientes, ya que son más de 20 años de dedicarse al mismo oficio, las personas tienen mucha confianza en él. El señor José solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda tener la capacidad de mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, ya que desea poder pintar las P. y mejorara el techo del lugar. A pesar que la mayoría de sus hijos no dependen de él, José aun trabaja arduamente por llevar el sustento diario a su hogar y por brindarle estudios a su hijo menor tal como lo hizo con los mayores, a los cuales gracias a su esfuerzo les logro dar estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
José Alonso A. P., 63 years old, lives in the San Salvador district. He has four children, three of whom are married. He lives with his wife and their youngest child, who is 15. Señor José has a barber shop, which is located in his home. Thanks to his extensive experience, he can count on a large number of clients. Since he has worked at the same occupation for more than 20 years, people have great confidence in him. Señor José is seeking a loan that will enable him to improve the conditions of his business, since he would like to paint the walls and improve the roof of the barber shop. Although the majority of his children do not depend on him, José still works hard to provide sustenance to his household and to offer schooling to his youngest child, just as he did for his older children, to whom, thanks to his efforts, he was able to give a university education.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and improve barber shop

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela R. de 42 años de edad, reside en el municipio de El Transito, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután. Vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos. Graciela elabora tamales y otros tipos de platillos típicos, los cuales los comercializa en su casa, lugar en el cual los elabora, y que también vende de manera ambulante. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar granos básicos para la elaboración de los tamales y otras comidas. Ella desea mucho poder contar con el dinero necesario para comprar la materia prima para su venta, ya que esto la beneficiará en gran manera ya que podrá ofrecer más productos y de esta manera obtener más ganancias las cuales sean de gran ayuda a su esposo.
texts.en:
Graciela R. is 42 years old and lives in the township of El Transito, located in the Usulután district. She lives with her husband and their children. Graciela makes tamales and other kinds of typical foods, which she sells in her home, where she makes them. She also sells them as a street vendor. She is seeking a loan that she will use to buy basic ingredients to make the tamales and other foods. She would very much like to be able to count on the money needed to buy the ingredients for her sales. This will help her in a very big way, since she will be able to offer more products and in this way obtain more earnings, which would be a great help to her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic ingredients

location.town: El Transito, departamento de San Miguel

loans.name: Alma Yamileth

texts.es: Alma Yamileth T. C. de 20 años de edad, reside en el municipio de El Transito, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután. Vive en la casa de sus padres, junto a ellos y su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de 4 años de edad. Ella posee un comedor en el cual elabora desayunos y almuerzos. Debido a que dicho negocio esta ubicado adentro del mercado de El Transito, posee muy buenas ventas ya que este es un lugar el cual es muy visitado por las personas. Alma solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar verduras y granos básicos, las cuales le permitan elaborar mayor variedad de alimentos, así mismo comprar bebidas y golosinas.
texts.en:
Alma Yamileth T. C. is 20 years old and lives in El Transito township in the Usulután district. She lives in the house of her parents, together with them and her life partner and their little 4-year-old child. Alma has a market stand where she prepares breakfasts and lunches. Thanks to the location of this business inside the market of El Transito, she has very good sales, since this is a place that is visited by many people. Alma is applying for a loan with which she will be able to buy vegetables and basic ingredients, which will allow her to prepare a greater variety of foods, and also to buy drinks and candies.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables and basic ingredients

location.town: El Transito, departamento de San Miguel

loans.name: Yanapasiñani Group

texts.es:
Venta D. dulces, venta D. material escolar, venta D. juguetes, venta D. cosméticos, venta D. verduras y venta D. comida son los negocios que tienen las integrantes D. L. Asociación Comunal YanapaS., que significa nos ayudaremos, ellas se reúnen en el Centro Focal Los Andes.
Cesar Y. D. 26 años se dedica a vender dulces en L. calle Argentina, Beatriz S. D. 37 años también venD. dulces en L. zona D. Río Seco, hace 10 años.
Todas necesitan el préstamo, una vez más, para seguir invirtiendo en sus negocios y crecer día a día.
texts.en:
Sales of candies, school supplies, toys, cosmetics, vegetables, and food are the businesses operated by the members of the YanapaS. Communal Association. Their name means, “We will help ourselves.” They meet at the Los Andes regional center of Pro Mujer. Cesar Y., 26, sells candies on Argentina Street. Beatriz S., 37, also sells candies, in the Río Seco area, and has done so for ten years. They all need this loan to, once again, invest in their businesses and grow day by day.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Norma Antonieta

texts.es: Norma Antonieta B. D. A. D. 46 años D. edad, resiD. en Santa María en el departamento D. Usulután, resiD. junto a sus tres hijos, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Norma es una mujer que goza D. muy buenas referencias por parte D. sus vecinos, ya que siempre ha sido muy respetuosa y trabajadora, ya que ella sola ha criado a sus tres hijos y les ha brindado todo lo necesario. Ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos D. primera necesidad, negocio el cual le ha permitido seguir adelante junto a su familia. Norma solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir en su negocio, ya que los gastos del hogar a penas le permiten para que mantenga su tienda es por ellos que espera poder surtirla gracias al préstamo solicitado y D. esta manera poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Norma Antonieta B. D. A. is 46 years old. She lives in Santa María in the Usultán department with her three children, who are students. Norma has earned the respect of her neighbors through hard work and treating others with respect. She has raised her three children on her own and provided for their every need. She owns a store where she sells staple products and this business has allowed her to care for her family. Norma is requesting a loan to invest in her business. As it is, her household costs are barely covered by her store income. With this loan she plans to purchase more stock for her store and thus increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Sabina Martha

texts.es: La Señora Sabina,tiene como negocio la confeccion de ropa para niños en telas suaves como por ejemplo la tela polar, vive en la zona de pura pura, tiene una hija, el esposo es quien realiza la confeccion de las prendas y tambien llegan a contratar algún operario en epocas donde hay bastante demanda, luego de confeccionar las prendas la señora va a venderlas por mayor y menor a uno de los mercados mas concurridos de nuestra ciudad ubicado en la avenida buenos aires donde pofrece las prendas desde las 5:30  hasta las 10:00 de la mañana, su prendas son de buena calidad, el negocio se proyecta bien a futuro, la señora cada cierto tiempo va renovando sus maquinas lo que hace que sus prendas tengan un buen acabado.
texts.en:
Señora Sabina has a business making clothing for children out of soft fabrics such as fleece. She lives in the Pura Pura area and has one daughter. Her husband is the one who makes the clothing, and they also hire a machine operator during times when there is a lot of demand. After the clothing is made, Sabina goes out to sell them on both a wholesale and retail basis at one of the busiest markets in our city. It is located on Buenos Aires Avenue, and she sells the clothing from 5:30-10:00 a.m. The clothing is of good quality, and the business is doing well. Every once in awhile, Sabina updates her machines so her clothing will have a good finish.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric and machinery

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena de 34 años, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su hija Nicol de 3 años, a quien desea dar una buena calidad de vida.El negocio de venta de ropa de Elena esta ubicado en un  mercado importante de la ciudad donde vive, vende jeans para todas las edades y es una de las vendedoras más solicitadas de dicho mercado, ya que los novedosos modelos que tiene en almacén  y los precios  accesibles que brinda a sus clientes, la han hecho de muy buena cantidad de clientela .Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre los modelos que mejor les quedarán, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que llevar sus jeans hasta otra ciudad, ya que también vende ahí. Para el futuro, espera que su negocio crezca y pueda aperturar una tienda de ropa, donde pueda atender a sus clientes con más comodidad.Es el primer préstamo de Elena con  MFP, espera ser muy puntual en sus pagos, y en su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de socias, ya que es muy alegre.Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más jeans para tener mayor cantidad de  mercadería para vender.
texts.en:
Elena is 34 years old and lives in a rented house with her three year old daughter Nicol, for whom she wants to provide a good quality of life. She sells clothing at a major market in the city where she lives. Elena offers jeans for all ages and is one of the most sought-after vendors in the market. Since she keeps the latest models in stock and offers them at affordable prices, Elena has been able to build up a large clientele. What she enjoys most about her job is giving advice to her customers as to what styles would look good on them. She has been in this business for five years and believes the hardest part is having to carry her merchandise with her to another city where she sells.

In the future, Elena hopes that her business will grow and that she will be able to open her own clothing store where she can serve her customers more comfortably. This is her first loan with MFP and she expects to make her payments on time. Elena is admired by the other members of her Communal Bank because of her cheerfulness. With her loan of 800 soles, she plans to buy more jeans so that she will have a greater amount inventory available to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase jeans to sell

loans.name: Samuel Ricardo

texts.es: El Señor Samuel, vive en la zona de alto tejar, es divorsiado y tiene 2 hijas que son ya independientes, el señor ofrece a la venta peliculas en formato dvd, generalmente el va de empresa en empresa ofreciendo a los ejecutivos las primisias en peliculas y lo hace ambulando, lo bueno es que tiene una buena cantidad de clientes los cuales constantemente van comprando sus videos, el trabajo que el realiza es cansador ya que tiene que caminar varias calles de nuestra ciudad, el Sr. Samuel ya lleva varios años con el negocio, el señor es muy activo ya que en sus tiempos libres, tambien ofrece una variedad de productos a las personas que estan caminando productos tales como boligrafos, llaveros, y algunos de temporada como por ejemplo juegos artificiales y algunas novedades que pueda ofrecer.
texts.en:
El Señor Samuel lives in the Alto Tejar district. He is divorced and has two daughters that are now independent. He goes from business to business and offers first-run movies in DVD format to executives. What is good is that he has a large number of steady customers who buy his DVDs. His work is tiring because he has to walk through many streets in our city. He has pursued this line of work for several years. Very active in his free time, he also sells a variety of products to people walking by such as pens, key rings, some seasonal products like fireworks, and novelties that are available.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Ausner Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Ausner Pérez desde hace cinco años se dedica a la actividad de venta de ropa comercializada ambulantemente en las calles del departamento de Masaya siendo este negocio el que le permite obtener los ingresos para llevar el sustento a su familia a la que tanto ama.

A diario ofrece la ropa a sus clientes y hay días los cuales vende todo pero también hay días que no logra vender mucho y actualmente está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la ropa, sabanas y blusas para abastecerse de ello y así continuar ofreciendo dicha ropa en su localidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Ausner Pérez has been selling clothing for five years as a street vendor in Masaya; this is the business that enables him to obtain the income to support his family that he loves so much. Daily he offers clothing to his customer and there are days where he sells everything but also there are days were he isn’t able to sell much. Today he is seeking a loan to invest in buying clothing, sheets, and blouses to support himself and offer those items in his area.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: La Nueva Luz Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. J., TIENE 41 AÑOS, ES CASADA, TIENE 3 HIJOS. ELLA ES INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO "LA NUEVA LUZ",DONDE SE DESEMPEÑA COMO SECRETARIA DE LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA. ESTE GRUPO ESTA FORMADO POR SIETE INTEGRANTES RESIDENTES DE LA ZONA DE SANTA ROSA EN EL DISTRITO DE COMAS.
LA SRA J. SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCIÓN DE PRENDAS INTIMAS, SU NEGOCIO TIENE COMO NOMBRE "CONFECCIONES ZEFLOR" EL CUAL FUNCIONA EN SU DOMICILIO.
NOS COMENTA QUE ELLA INICIÓ SU NEGOCIO, DEBIDO A LA NECESIDAD DE APOYAR ECONÓMICAMENTE EN LOS GASTOS FAMILIARES SOBRETODO CUANDO SU ESPOSO SE QUEDABA TEMPORALMENTE SIN TRABAJO.
AL INICIO EMPEZÓ TRABAJANDO EN UNA EMPRESA. LA EXPERIENCIA RECIBIDA DE SU MADRE Y LO APRENDIDO EN LA EMPRESA EN LA QUE TRABAJABA,ELLA DECIDIÓ INDEPENDIZARSE.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN MATERIALES PARA INCREMENTAR LA MERCADERÍA DE SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
J. is 41, married, and has three children. She is a member of La Nueva Luz group. She is secretary of the governing board. This group is comprised of seven members who are residents of the Santa Rosa Zone in the Comas district. J. makes intimate wear. Her business is called Confecciones Zeflor, and it is in her house. She tells us that she started the business because of the necessity to help with the family expenses, especially when her husband was temporarily out of work. She started working in a company. With the experience she received from her mother, and with what she learned in the company, she decided to become independent. The loan she is asking for is to buy materials to increase the merchandise in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Milton Ernesto

texts.es: El Sr. Milton,  vive en la zona de Munayata de nuestra ciudad tiene el negocio ubicado en la misma zona. El negocio lo atiende junto a la esposa, tiene una pequeña hija, vive en casa de su abuela y solicito el credito para comprar una maquina espiedera, por que vio que su negocio esta creciendo el desea ofrecer a su clientela otra variedad de pollo, el señor tambien tiene una actividad de pintor, el generalmente trabaja bajo contrato y no asi con trabajos eventuales, a pesar de ser aún muy joven el Sr. Milton muestra ser una persona muy responsable.
texts.en:
Milton lives in the Munayata area of our city and he has a business located there also. His wife helps him with the business, he has a small daughter, and lives in his grandmother’s home. He is seeking the loan to buy a rotisserie because he has noted that his business is growing and he wishes to offer his customers another type of chicken. He also has a business as a painter, he generally works under contract and not with steady jobs. Although very young Milton has shown to be a very responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a rotisserie

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es: Ingrid de 25 años es una joven muy trabajadora que  vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.El cafetín que Ingrid administra esta ubicado en un centro hospitalario de la ciudad, ella ganó la licitación hace 4 años, en los cuales ha trabajado fuerte  para sacarlo adelante. Ahora su cafetín esta muy bien equipado y atiende desde muy temprano a los doctores, enfermeras y personas que desean servirse algo sabroso y saludable. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes, considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día atendiendo su negocio, ya que muchas veces se queda hasta muy tarde por la gran cantidad de clientes que tiene. Para el futuro, espera mejorar las instalaciones de su negocio y así brindar un mejor servicio.Este es su primer préstamo con  MFP y promete  ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, además  en su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada, debido a la responsabilidad que demuestra.Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará los ingredientes que necesita para elaborar los platillos que vende en su cafetín y mejorar de esta manera su producción.
texts.en:
Ingrid is 25 years old. She is a hardworking young woman who lives at home with her parents. What she desires most is to improve her quality of life. Ingrid manages a café located at the city hospital. She won the bid to establish her business there four years ago and has worked hard to make it a success. Her café is well-equipped and opens early so that she can begin serving doctors, nurses, and others who are looking for something tasty and healthy to eat. What she enjoys most about her job is attending to her customers. Ingrid finds the most difficult part of her job is spending all day at her business, since she is often open late so that she can serve several of the remaining customers that she has.

In the future, she hopes to improve her business facilities so that she can provide better service. Ingrid is receiving her first loan from MFP and promises to make her payments on time. She is a highly respected member of her Communal Bank because of the responsibility she has demonstrated. With her loan of 1000 soles, Ingrid plans to buy the ingredients that she needs for making the dishes she sells at her café. This will also improve her production.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Carmen Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Carmen C. tiene su propio negocio de venta de pollo en el departamento de Masaya donde ofrece a diario el producto a sus clientes que le compran. Ella antes de iniciar en este negocio lavaba y planchaba ropa pero al ver que no obtenía ganancias decidió iniciar en este negocio.

La razón por la que solicita el crédito es para invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción para reparar su techo donde atiende a los clientes ya que está comprometida con brindar un servicio de alta calidad y el techo está dañado por lo que iniciará en la reparación de este y así mejorará sus condiciones.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen C. owns her own shop in the Masaya District, where she sells chicken. She used to have a laundry business, but it wasn't profitable, so she decided to try something new. Carmen will use this loan to buy building materials; her shop's roof needs repairs. She's committed to providing her customers with good service. If her shop has a better roof, that will help her business and her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying building materials

loans.name: Cenelia María

texts.es:
La venta de bolsas plásticas es el negocio al que muy esforzadamente se dedica la señora Cenelia G. en el departamento de Masaya ofreciendo bolsas plásticas de todo tamaño y todo color al público en general.

Ella atraviesa la necesidad de abastecer sus estantes con las bolsas y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las bolsas y así continuar obteniendo utilidades para el mantenimiento de su hogar compuesto por ella y sus dos hijos a los que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Selling plastics bags is the activity to which, with much effort, Mrs. Cenelia G. dedicates herself. She sells all sizes of plastics bags, in all colors, to the general public in the Masaya state. She is facing the need to fill the shelves with the bags, and to do so she went to Ceprodel to request a loan. She wants to buy the bags so that she can continue to obtain profits to mantain her house where she lives with her children, who she loves so much.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy plastic bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes tiene varios financiamientos con Fundación León 2000, ya que no es la primera experiencia que tiene. Ella se dedica a una pulpería, por lo que esta actividad es el único medio de ingreso que ella tiene para seguirle proporcionando a su familia lo necesario para sobrevivir. Por lo que tiene más de 21 años de dedicarse a este negocio que es su prioridad. Ella inicio este negocio con la ayuda de su familia ya desde hace mucho tiempo atrás se dedicaban a este tipo de actividad económica. Ella sueña con mejorar cada día su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de refrescos, gaseosas, repostería, jugos, pan, galleta y golosinas.
texts.en:
Mercedes has received various types of financing through Fundación León 2000, so this is not her first experience with a loan. She manages a grocery store, which is her only source of income that provides what her family needs to survive. Mercedes has been in this business for 21 years and it has always been a priority for her. With the help her family, she was able to start this business because they were in a similar trade. She dreams of improving her business every day and generating more income. The loan she is requesting will be used as working capital to purchase soft drinks, pastries, juices, bread, cookies, and candy.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Guadalupe Mariela

texts.es:
En el departamento de Masaya, la señora Guadalupe S. se ha dedicado con gran ahinco a su actividad de venta de artesanías siendo comercializadas en su propia casa de habitación donde muchos clientes le visitan a diario para llevar las bellas artesanías.

Este negocio es muy importante para ella porque de aquí obtiene las ganancias para mantener su hogar que tanto necesita de su apoyo. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de dichas artesanías con el propósito de continuar con su venta y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella misma y de su familia.
texts.en:
In the state of Masaya, Mrs. Guadalupe S. has been extremely dedicated to her activity of selling crafts, which she sells from her own house. Many customers visit her daily in order to buy the beautiful handcrafts. This business is very important to her because it is where she takes income from to maintain her house, which demands so much her help. The loan she is requesting is to buy such crafts, with the intention to continue her selling business and so to improve her and her family’s life conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy crafts

loans.name: José Esteban

texts.es:
José T. es un señor muy trabajador y que siempre está con una sonrisa no importando las circunstancias que atraviesa. Es padre de una niña a la que le debe de brindar las condiciones necesarias para que ella se desarrolle.

Actualmente ha iniciado a construir su casa de habitación para que viva en conjunto con su familia y para ello está solicitando un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción ya que quiere proporcionarle a su pequeña hija una vivienda ideal para vivir.
texts.en:
José T. is a hardworking man who is always smiling, no matter what circumstances he faces. He is the father of a girl, and must provide the conditions necessary for her development. Recently he started to build a home for the family to live in, and for this reason he requests a loan in order to buy construction materials, because he wants provide his little girl with an ideal home in which to live.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan de 36 años es un hombre muy trabajador, vive en una casa alquilada y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida.Para Juan los días de trabajo comienzan muy temprano por la mañana, cuando junto a su motocarro sale en busca de pasajeros para transportarlos , es muy atento con sus pasajeros y siempre esta pendiente de ellos, ya que desea darles muy buen servicio, para cuando lo vean de nuevo tomen otra vez su motocarro. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es manejar por la calles de Juliaca, ya que se distrae mucho, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar hasta altas horas de la noche.En el futuro espera poder juntar el dinero necesario para comprar un nuevo motocarro.Este es el primer préstamo de Juan con  MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no desea causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querido.Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas llantas para su motocarro, ya que las que tiene actualmente están gastadas por el arduo trabajo.
texts.en:
Juan is 36 years old and is a very hard-working man. He lives in a rented house, and what he most wants is to get ahead in life. For Juan, the work days begin very early in the morning, when he goes out with his motorcycle taxi looking for passengers to transport. He is very attentive to his passengers and is always waiting for them. He wants to give them very good service so that when they see him another time they will take his taxi again. His favorite part of his work is driving through the streets of Juliaca, which he enjoys very much. He has been doing this work for four years, and for him, the most difficult part is having to work until the late hours of the night. In the future, he hopes to be able to get enough money together to buy a new motorcycle taxi. This is Juan's first loan with MFP, and he feels the responsibility to repay it on time, since he does not want to cause problems for the members of his community bank, where he is well-liked. With the 800 PEN that he is requesting, he will buy new tires for his car, since the ones he has now are worn out through hard work.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his vehicle

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 52 años de edad, es casada con 5 hijos, y todos trabajan de manera independiente. La señora se dedica a la venta de mercadería general, principalmente ropa, juguetes, perfumes y zapatos usados. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, en ese tiempo empezó con un capital pequeño y fue ahorrando poco a poco hasta lograr tener suficiente clientela. El crédito será invertido en la compra de perfumes, sabanas, ropa y mosquiteros para la época que se acerca, ya que desea aprovechas los precios bajos de estas fechas. Ya que es una mujer muy emprendedora y luchadora. Su meta es llegar a tener una tienda variada que pueda ser atendida por los miembros de su familia.
texts.en:
Gladys is 52 years old and is married with 5 children; all work independently. She sells general merchandise, principally clothing, toys, perfumes, and used shoes. She has been in this business for more than five years. She began with a small amount of capital and saved little by little until she achieved a sufficient clientele. The loan will be invested in the purchase of perfumes, sheets, clothing and mosquito nets for the coming season, since she wants to take advantage of the current low prices. She is a very enterprising and hard working. Her goal is to have a variety store which can be attended to by the members of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
En el departamento de Masaya, el caballero José M. es padre de familia con dos hijos a su cargo los que debe de mantener y brindarles las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen y estudien. Ha sido un padre muy responsable porque le ha brindado a sus hijos buenas condiciones de vida a pesar de las dificultades que ha atravesado.

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito con el propósito de invertirlo en la compra de los artículos o productos domésticos para el hogar y la familia. Es por esta razón que no dudó en ir a Ceprodel para realizar este crédito porque sabe que le será otorgado y así beneficiará a su familia e hijos que tanto ama.
texts.en:
In the Masaya district, the gentleman José M. is the father of a family, responsible for two children whom he needs to support and offer the necessary conditions so that they can develop and study. He has been a very responsible father, because he has offered his sons good living conditions in spite of the difficulties that he has gone through. He is now asking for a loan with the aim of investing it in the purchase of various articles or domestic products for his home and family. For this reason, he did not hesitate to go to CEPRODEL to obtain this loan because he knows that it will be granted and thus will benefit his family and children whom he loves so much.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy household products

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana de 30 años es una madre muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en la casa que le heredaron sus padres junto a sus 3 hijos Filomena de 10, Yeferson de 5 y Yerson de 2 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.Todas las mañanas Juana sale con su triciclo a vender el rico jugo de quinua que prepara (Jugo caliente hecho a base de quinua licuada, maicena y manzana), la bebida caliente que prepara es muy solicitada por sus clientes, ya que las bajas temperaturas de  las mañanas incitan a las personas a tomar algo caliente, para calentar su cuerpo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que puede tomar los vasos de jugo que desea cuando tiene hambre, lleva 6 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que despertarse temprano y salir a las frías calles a vender, anhela tener en el futuro una tienda donde pueda vender con más tranquilidad y atender mejor a sus clientes.Este es el primer préstamo de Juana con  MFP y se siente muy confiada de poder pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causar problemas en su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida, ya que es una de las socias mas alegres.Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ingredientes para preparar el delicioso jugo de quinua que vende, y así lograr obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
30 year-old Juana is a very loving and hardworking mother. She lives in the house that she inherited from her parents with her three children: 10 year-old Filomena, 5 year-old Yeferson, and 2 year-old Yerson, who are the motivation for all her efforts. Every morning Juana leaves with her cart to sell the delicious quinoa juice which she prepares (hot juice, made of a base of liquified quinoa, cornstarch, and apples). The hot drink that she prepares is often requested by her customers, as the low morning temperatures encourage people to drink something hot to warm their bodies. The thing she likes the most about her work is that she can drink all the juice she wants when she is hungry. She’s been in this line of work for 6 years and she considers the most difficult thing to be to have to wake herself up early and go out in the cold streets to sell. In the future, she longs to have a store where she can sell with more tranquility and better serve her customers. This is the first loan that Juana is requesting from MFP and she feels very confident that she will be able to make her payments on time, as she does not want to cause problems in her community bank, where she is very well liked, as she is one of the happiest members. With the requested $350 (1000 PEN), she will buy more ingredients to prepare the delicious quinoa juice which she sells, and this way obtain higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her business and implement it

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana Francisca M. se ha destacado por ser una dama muy trabajadora que se ha dedicado al oficio de la costura siendo muy dedicada a esta labor ya que de aquí obtiene el dinero para mantener su hogar y los gastos de su casa.

Actualmente ella posee una máquina de pedal, una máquina eléctrica, una mesa y un turbante y espera ir creciendo cada vez más en este oficio. Actualmente ella ha solicitado un crédito con el propósito de utilizarlo en la compra de tela variada para así llevar a cabo su oficio y seguir realizando todo tipo de ropa para comercializarla y satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juana Francisca M. is recognized as a very hard-working woman. She makes a living from dressmaking and is very dedicated to her work, since that is how she earns money for maintaining her home and managing the household expenses. Juana currently owns a pedal-powered sewing machine, an electric sewing machine, and a sewing table, and hopes that her business will grow even more. She is now asking for a loan so that she can purchase assorted fabrics. This will enable her to complete her work and continue making all types of clothing to sell, and to satisfy the demands of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fabric

loans.name: Claudia Mercedes

texts.es: Claudia tiene 40 años de edad, por lo que es una mujer muy responsable con su negocio, este no es el primer financiamiento que solicito en Fundación León 2000 esta no es la primera vez, por lo que siempre se preocupo por pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general ella tiene variedad de clientes, y también tiene clientes que son amigos de ella de esta manera ha logrado contribuir en lo necesario para salir adelante con su negocio. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de perfumes, ropa interior, cremas, colonias, sabanas, reloj entre otras cosas. Claudia sueña con que su hijo sea una persona de bien y finalice sus estudios.
texts.en:
Claudia is 40 years old. Because she is a woman who is responsible with her business, this is not the first time she has sought funding from Fundación León 2000. This is not the first time because she always keeps in mind to make her payments on time and in a good manner. She is currently selling general merchandise. She has a variety of clients, and she also has clients who are friends of hers. In this way, she has achieved what she needs to move forward with her business. She is requesting this loan for capital for her work to buy perfumes, underwear, creams, cologne, linens, and clocks among other things. Claudia dreams that her son will be a good person and finish his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for work

loans.name: María Nelly

texts.es:
En la pulpería de la señora María Nelly S. se vende comestibles tales como meneítos, galletas, tortillitas en bolsa, golosinas, entre otros productos. También vende detergente, jabón y papel higiénico. Ella se ha preocupado por mejorar cada vez más las condiciones de su negocio y hoy en día está solicitando un crédito porque le urge adquirir los productos para llenar sus estantes y así continuar ofreciéndolos en su establecimiento.

Es por esta razón que ella espera confiadamente en que su crédito será otorgado y así saldrá adelante en su actividad y se proyectará como potencial comerciante.
texts.en:
María Nelly S. has a mini-market where she sells things like “meneítos” (puffed cheese snack), crackers, bags of tortillas, and sweets among other products. She also sells detergent, soap, and toilet paper. She has struggled to improve the conditions of her business more each time. She is now asking for a loan because she urgently needs to get the products to fill her shelves. That way she can continue to offer them in her establishment. That is the reason that she confidently hopes to be given the loan. That way she will get ahead in her activity, and she plans on being a successful businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for her mini mart

loans.name: Martha Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Martha A. se ha destacado por ser una persona que se preocupa por el bienestar de su hijo y también por mantener a su mamá ya que está a su cargo y la cuida y protege. Ella trabaja diario y ha tomado la decisión de invertir en el mejoramiento de su vivienda porque esta ha estado en condiciones malas. Por esta razón es que solicita un crédito con el propósito de invertirlo en la compra de los materiales de construcción y así dar lugar a la reconstrucción de su casa de habitación ubicada en el departamento de Masaya donde ella vive y trabaja.
texts.en:
Martha A. stands out as a person who is very concerned about her son's well-being and also that of her mother, who is in her care and whom she looks after and protects. She works every day, and she has made the decision to invest in improving her home, which has been in poor condition. For this reason, she is requesting a loan with the aim of purchasing construction materials to renovate her house, located in the Department of Masaya, where she lives and works.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing building materials

loans.name: Martina Manuela

texts.es:
La señora Martina P. se ha destacado por vender ropa en el departamento de Masaya ofreciéndola en su propia casa tanto a damas, caballeros y niños. Ella anhela mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda para colocar sus vitrinas y así exhibir la ropa y para esto ella ha iniciado a reconstruir su casa de habitación para mejorar las condiciones de tal manera que sus clientes puedan tener un espacio amplio donde ver la ropa y así poder ofrecerla brindando un buen lugar.

Para ello solicita un crédito porque quiere comprar los materiales de construcción y así iniciar la ampliación del local para lograr la satisfacción de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Martina P. sells clothes out of her own home in the Masaya department to women, men and children. She longs to improve the conditions of her house in order to put in her display cabinets and display the clothes. To do this she has started to rebuild her house to improve the conditions in such a way that her customers can have a spacious area where they can see the clothes, and so being able to provide a good spot for them. Therefore she is asking for a loan because she wants to buy building materials and start the extension of the premises to keep her customers happy.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of building materials to extend her premises

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 40 years old, is married, and is the mother of two children of whom one is schooling and one is learning a trade.

Josephine has been a baker for seven years now, in spite of the challenges she faces. She uses flour to bake bread, cake, meat pies, etc., and retails them to her customers. She supplies them by herself in the market center to her customers and people also take bulk delivery from her.

Josephine’s only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials as prices are going up. She requests a loan to upgrade her business. With the loan she believes she can provide for her family and most especially for her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana de 42 años es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es tener un buen futuro.Juana se dedica es la venta de productos de belleza, aprovecha que realiza el trabajo de limpieza en un centro hospitalario, convence a los trabajadores, para que le compren los cosméticos que vende. Ella es una vendedora muy  persuasiva es por eso que ya tiene sus clientes establecidos, los cuales siempre compran sus productos .Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender y observar como su mercadería poco a poco se termina, lleva 5 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar los productos hasta su centro de trabajo, ya que las cajas son muy pesadas.
