Para el futuro, espera tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus productos de belleza con mayor tranquilidad.Es el primer préstamo de Juana con  MFP y quiere pagarlo a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otro préstamo posteriormente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy activa, que siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de las demás.Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevos productos de belleza, para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad, y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
42 year-old Juana is a very hard working woman. She lives in her parent’s house, and what she desires the most is to have a a good future. Juana sells beauty products. She takes advantage of the fact that she works as a cleaning lady in in a hospital, and she convinces the workers to buy the cosmetics she sells. She is a very persuasive seller, and because of this, she has established customers who always buy her products. The thing she likes the most about her work is to sell and watch how her merchandise disappears little by little. She has been in this line of work for five years and she considers the most difficult thing to be carrying the products to her work, as the boxes are very heavy. In the future, she hopes to have a store where she can sell her beauty products with more tranquility. This is Juana’a first loan with MFP and she wants to pay it on time, as she desires to access another loan from them in the future. In her community bank, she is a very active member as she is always concerned with the well being of the others. With the requested $300 (800 PEN), she will buy new beauty products to offer her clients a greater variety and obtain greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy merchandise to boost her business

loans.name: Maria Bertha

texts.es: Maria tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera con 2 hijos menores de edad. La señora Maria tiene un negocio de compra y venta de ropa, tanto los cuales vende de manera ambulante, principalmente por encargo a personas conocidas. Este negocio empezó hace 7 años que inicio con muy poco capital  de trabajo, como una búsqueda de fuente de ingresos alternativos ya que acababa de tener a su primer hijo y necesitaba brindarle una buena manutención. Ella empezó vendiendo cosméticos, después fue que empezó a invertir en ropa y en adornos pero le gusto mas la venta de ropa.  El crédito será invertido en la compra de vestuario, ya que se acerca la época navideña y la señora desea invertir y comprar ahora que están un poco bajos los precios. Su meta es llegar a tener un una tienda de artículos variados que pueda estar ubicada en el mercado, que brinde las facilidades económicas a ella y a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is 40 years old and a single mother with two young children. She runs a business buying and selling clothing door-to-door, mainly to order, to people she knows. She started this business seven years ago with only a very small working capital. At that time she was searching for an alternative source of income, as having just had her first child, she needed to take care of the child's needs. She started out selling cosmetics, and later on started to invest in clothing and ornaments, but she enjoys selling clothing most of all. Maria will use the loan to buy clothes, as the holiday season is approaching and she would like to make her purchases now that the prices are a little lower. Her goal is to have her own store, selling various items, perhaps in the market. This will provide financial support for her and her two children

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 39 years old and is married with three children who are currently in school.

John has been a professional carpenter for the past eighteen years now. Carpentry has been his major occupation and the main source of livelihood for his family. He owns a carpentry shop where he manufactures all kinds of furniture work.

John says that for lack of adequate working capital, he is not able to pre-finance most of the orders from his customers. This he said slows down his work because he necessarily has to wait for funds from his customers before any work could begin which delays most often.

John requests the loan to enable him procure useful working tools and materials like polish, glue, sandpaper, wood, etc., to improve his efficiency. He believes this will improve his income status to ensure a good living for his family. He would grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To procure useful working tools and materials like polish, glue, sandpaper, etc.

loans.name: Olubunmi

texts.en:
Olubunmi is 39 years old and is married with two children. For the past ten years she has sold groceries and this has been her major source of income.

Olubunmi wants to expand the size of her business in order to get maximum profit and also to meet her family’s needs. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. It will also support her in helping her family to meet her children’s academic needs. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Titi

texts.en: Titi has been rearing bird, selling chickens and eggs for the past six years.  Her business is growing. She sells eggs to help support her family's expenses.  She is blessed with four children.  Titi hopes for a loan of NGN180000 to purchase more birds to rear and sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: Purchase birds to rear and sell.

loans.name: Narcisa Del Socorro

texts.es: Narcisa se dedica al destace y venta de cerdo, ella tiene 44 años de edad, por lo que siempre le ha gustado su actividad. Hay que mencionar que esta Señora ya había tenido la oportunidad que se le facilitara un financiamiento con el fin de mejorar su negocio. Ella inicio por su familia ya que anteriormente eran ellos quienes se hacían cargo y más tarde ella se quedo con este negocio, por lo que es muy reconocida en toda su comarca por vender y destazar cerdos, lo que le ha proporcionado muy buenos logros hasta los momentos. Aun necesita ayuda pues actualmente solicita un nuevo financiamiento para la compra de 3 cerdos y destazarlos ya que se acerca la temporada navideña y tiene suficientes encargos. El sueño de Narcisa es seguir trabajando para que su hijos estudie.
texts.en:
Narcisa butchers and sells pork. She is 44 years old and she has always liked her work. She has had another loan opportunity to improve her business. She started working with her family, who used to run the business, but she is now in charge. She is very well known for her pork products and she has had many accomplishments. She needs this loan to buy three hogs, which she will butcher. Now that the holiday season is near and she has had enough requests. Narcisa’s dream is to keep working so that her son can go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hogs

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: Martina de 36 años es una mujer muy sincera y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a sus 2 hijos Antony de 11 y Candy de 2 años, a quienes desea dar unos buenos estudios.El negocio al que Martina se dedica es la venta de ropa de forma ambulatoria, todos los días recorre las instituciones públicas y privadas de su ciudad, en busca de clientes que deseen comprar algo de lo que vende. La ropa la trae de otra ciudad, es por eso que los modelos que vende son muy novedosos y llamativos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre las prendas que están de moda, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar todo el día en busca de clientes. Para el futuro, espera tener el dinero suficiente para aperturar  una tienda, donde pueda vender con mayor tranquilidad y comodidadEste es el primer préstamo de Martina con MFP, y  esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para pagar a tiempo sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es muy querida, ya que siempre le pone mucha  alegría a las reuniones.Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa en la ciudad de Lima, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Martina, 36, is a very sincere and hardworking woman. She lives in a rented house along with her two children: Antony, who is 11, and Candy, who is 2 years old. She wants to give them a good education. Martina has an itinerant business selling clothing; each day she goes through public and private institutions in her city looking for customers who want to buy something that she sells. She brings the clothing from another city, and for this reason the fashions that she sells are very new and eye-catching. What she likes most about her job is advising her customers about the clothing styles that are in fashion. She has been carrying out this activity for 3 years, and she considers that the most difficult part is to have to walk all day in search of customers. In the future, she hopes to have sufficient money to open up a store where she can sell at her leisure with greater comfort. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is ready to work very hard in order to make her payments. In her communal bank she is very well liked, since she always brings a lot of happiness to the meetings. With the 1,800 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) requested she will buy more clothing in the city of Lima, in order to be able to offer her customers a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothing) in the city

loans.name: Gamarra Ramirez's Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. M., TIENE 50 AÑOS DE EDAD, TIENE DOS HIJOS QUE SON SU APOYO Y SU ALICIENTE PARA SALIR ADELANTE, ELLA ES INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO "MUJERES SOLIDARIAS", ELEGIDA RECIENTEMENTE POR SUS 9 COMPAÑERAS COMO PRESIDENTA DE LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA. ELLAS RESIDEN EN EL DISTRITO DE CARABAYLLO.
LA SRA. M., SE DEDICA HACE CINCO MESES A LA ORGANIZACIÓN DE EVENTOS, ACTIVIDAD QUE DESARROLLA EN UN PEQUEÑO LOCAL ALQUILADO. ELLA INICIÓ GRACIAS AL APOYO QUE RECIBIÓ DE EDAPROSPO, EMPEZANDO CON LA ELABORACION DE  MANUALIDADES,LUEGO INICIÓ CON PIÑATERÍA Y POCO A POCO INCURSIONÓ EN LA ORGANIZACIÓN DE EVENTOS,POR AHORA TODO LO QUE OFRECE EN CUANTO A EQUIPOS Y MOBILIARIO ES ALQUILADO.
LE GUSTARÍA CRECER EN EL NEGOCIO Y LLEGAR HA TENER UNA EMPRESA RECONOCIDA EN LA LINEA DE ORGANIZACIÓN DE EVENTOS. 
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO UTILIZARÁ PARA INVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO Y COMPRARÁ SILLAS Y MESAS.
texts.en:
Señora María is 50-years-old and has 2 children who are her support and her incentive to get ahead. She is a member of the group, "Mujeres Solidarias," and she was recently elected as president of the board by the 9 other members. They live in the district of Carabayllo. Señora María has made a living by planning events for 5 months. She does this is a small rented location. She started her business thanks to the support she received from Edaprospo. She started by making crafts and later started a piñata store. Little by little, she started planning events. As of now, everything she offers in terms of equipment and furniture is rented. She would like to grow her business and reach the point where she has a well-known company in the line of event planning. She will use the requested loan to invest in her business and to purchase tables and chairs.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the amount of furniture she has for her business.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
The clothing and jewelry business has been a profitable trade for Flora. With this business, she is able to help her husband with the family upkeep. 

Flora is 45 years old and has four children. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She lives in Lagos. 

She is requesting a loan of 140,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more clothes and jewelry to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Constance

texts.en: Constance is 39 years old. She is married and has three children. All her children are in school, making Constance so happy. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk, biscuits, etc. in her neighborhood. She has been selling grocery items for 10 years to take care of the family. She has no regrets for what she does,  but her challenge is having funds to buy more raw materials. She takes delivery of stock from Kumasi central market and retails to her customers. Therefore, she requests a loan to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits, etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her children in school.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store.

loans.name: Jofre David

texts.es:
Jofre C., vive en una zona periurbana ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, tiene una casa de cemento con agua y luz como servicios básicos, su esposa tiene 25 años y le ayuda en el negocio de comidas rápidas, tiene 1 hija de 1 año y 5 meses.

Jofre comenzó trabajando en un restaurante pero al ver que mejor era reunir dinero y sacar su propio negocio, se independizo y puso un puesto de comidas rápidas, ahora Jofre trabaja desde las 05h00 vendiendo pollo frito con papas, chancho con papas en conjunto con su esposa.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar más pollo, chancho, verde para poder incrementar el negocio. En el futuro quiere ampliar el local y poner sucursales.
texts.en:
Jofre C. lives in a peri-urban area located in Paraíso de Guayaquil. He has a house made out of cement that had basic services like running water and electricity. His wife is 25 years old and helps him with his fast food business. He has one daughter who is a year and five months old.

Jofre started working in a restaurant but seeing that it was better and more profitable to own your own business, he became independent and set up a fast food stall. Now Jofre works from 5 am selling fried chicken with potatoes and pork with potatoes alongside of his wife.

With this loan he will buy more chicken, plantains, and pork to be able to increase his business. In the future he wants to expand and have other local branches.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying pork, chicken, and plantains

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery de 37 años es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa  propia junto a sus 2 hijos; Karen de 12 y Cristian de 6, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.Para Mery el negocio de la venta de ropa ha sido una actividad que le a permitido obtener los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, se dedica específicamente a la venta de polos, lo cuales compra del un mercado importante de su ciudad, para llevarlos a vender a su centro de trabajo, ya que también realiza la labor de limpieza en un centro hospitalario. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientas, lleva 2 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que llevar las prendas hasta su centro de trabajo, ya que los fardos pesan mucho. Para más adelante, espera que su negocio crezca y que le brinde mejores ingresos económicos.Es su primer préstamo con  MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y esta dispuesta a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y responsable.Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más mercadería en polos, para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
37 year-old Mery is a very sensible and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her two children: 12 year-old Karen and 6 year-old Cristian, who are the motivation for all of her efforts. For Mery, the business of selling clothes has been an activity which has allowed her to obtain the necessary income to maintain her family. Specifically, she sells polos, which she buys from an important market in her city to bring them to sell at her work, since she also works cleaning a hospital. What she likes the most about her work is conversing with her customers. She has been doing this for two years and she considers the most difficult thing is to have to bring the garments to her work, as the bundles weigh a lot. In the future, she hopes that her business will grow and that it will bring her a better income. This is her first loan with MFP. She knows that she has to pay the money on time and is prepared to do so. In her community bank, she is a very happy and responsible member. With the requested $350 (1000 PEN), she will buy more polo merchandise to offer a greater variety to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy merchandise to improve her business

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es: Juana Antonia tiene la edad de 52 años y es casada. Sus propósitos son de seguir manteniendo su clientela ya que es la fuente de ingresos necesarios con la que cuentan. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general como: ropa, cosméticos y calzado, la ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante, el tiempo que tiene su negocio es de 20 años, Doña Juana inicia este negocio en busca de otro trabajo que le generara ingresos para su familia  por lo que decidió dedicarse a la venta de mercadería, al comienzo no le fue tan difícil ya que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y así recurre a todas sus amistades  para mostrarles los productos de venta además empezó a realizar los financiamientos con el fin de invertir más en su mercadería por lo que siempre ha trabajado con Fundación y decidió quedarse con este apoyo. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado para ropa interior, perfumes, vestidos entre otros productos debido a la temporada que se acerca.
texts.en:
Juana Antonia is 52 years old and is married. Her intent is to continue to maintain her customer base as it is the fountain of necessary income on which they count. Her economic activity is the sale of general merchandise like clothes, cosmetics, and shoes. The location of her business is itinerant. She has been in this line of work for 20 years. Doña Juana began this business looking for another line of work that would generate income for her family, so she decided to sell merchandise. At the beginning, it was not very difficult for her, as she has always liked to work. She drew on all of her friendships to show them the products for sale. In addition, she began to use financing in order to invest more in her merchandise. She has always worked with Fundación and decided to stay with this support. The loan is for work capital destined for underwear, perfumes, dresses, and other products depending on which season is approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for work

loans.name: Por Un Futuro Mejor (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Por un Futuro Mejor se formó en el cantón Paute, este cantón se encuentra en el corredor Nororiental de la Provincia del Azuay, tiene una amplia variedad de gastronomía, paisajes hermosos, cuenta con la central eléctrica  más grande del país como es la Hidroeléctrica Paute, su gente es cordial y muy amable haciendo que las personas que visitan este cantón se enamoren del mismo. Sus integrantes son mujeres luchadoras que tienen una gran amistad entre todas formando casi una familia en busca de mejores condiciones de vida para ellas y  los suyos.

Laura P.  Z. es socia otra socia del banco comunal Por un Futuro Mejor, ella tiene 23 años de edad  y es madre soltera de una hermosa niña de un año ocho meses  a la cual si reconoció su padre, Laura vive en casa de su madre compartiendo las obligaciones y gastos del hogar.

Nuestra socia  se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de frutas en su puesto ubicado en el mercado de Paute en donde atiende  de 8 a.m. a 5 p.m. excepto los días miércoles y domingo que trabaja de 6 a.m. a 8:30 p.m, lleva dos  años en este negocio y  nos comenta que en este momento las ventas se encuentran bajas pero tiene la esperanza que todo cambie muy pronto.

Lleva tres ciclos en la fundación y  los préstamos recibidos los ha invertido en incrementar su negocio, con el nuevo préstamo solicitado  va a comprar piñas, melones, manzanas y sobre todo uvas que es la fruta que más se consume en ésta época del año por las tradiciones propias de nuestra cultura.

Su sueño es poder viajar a los Estados Unidos para dar una mejor presente y futuro a su hija.

Diana P.  tiene  22 años de edad es  una de las socias más jóvenes  de su banco comunal, es madre soltera de una niña de dos meses de nacida a la que sí reconoció su padre, actualmente vive en casa de su madre con quien comparte los gastos  del hogar.

Nuestra socia  es comerciante  tiene un puesto en el mercado de Paute donde comercializa dulces que los adquiere para revenderlos, su horario de trabajo es de 8 am a 5pm todos los días, lleva un  año y medio en este negocio y se siente contenta porque le va bastante bien.

Este es su segundo ciclo en la fundación y nos comenta  que  los préstamos recibidos los ha invertido en su negocio y  el nuevo préstamo solicitado  va a invertir en los cuidados de su tierna niña, comprar leche y pañales.

Su gran sueño es tener un negocio más grande para dar  un mejor servicio y productos surtidos  a su exigente clientela.
texts.en:
The community bank Por un Futuro Mejor (For a Better Future) was formed in the cantón (a type of territorial subdivision) Paute. This cantón is located in the northeast of the providence of Azuay. There is an ample variety of fine food and dining and beautiful landscapes. The have the largest electronic plant in the country, Hidroeléctrica Paute (Paute Hydroelectric). Its people are cordial and very friendly, making people that visit this cantón fall in love with it. Its members are women fighters who have a great friendship, almost forming a family. They are in search of better living conditions for them and theirs. Laura P. Z. is a member of the community bank Por un Futuro Mejor. She is 23 years old. She is the single mother of a beautiful 1 year, 8 month-old little girl whose father recognizes her. Laura lives in the house with her mother, sharing in the obligations and expenses of their home. Our member sells all kinds of fruits in her stand, located in the market of Paute where she goes from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., except on Wednesdays and Sundays when she works from 6:00 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. She has been in this business for two years. She tells us that at this time the sales are low, but she has hope that everything will change soon. She has had three cycles with the foundation and she used the loans she has received to invest in increasing her business. With the new loans she requests, she’s going to buy pineapples, melons, apples, and above all else grapes because it is the most consumed fruit in this part as the year because of the traditions of our culture. Her dream is to be able to travel to the United States to provide a better present and future for her daughter. Diana P. is 22 years old. She is one of the youngest members of her community bank. She is the single mother of a two month-old girl whose father recognizes her. Currently, she lives in her mother’s house with whom she shares household expenses. Our member is a merchant. She has a place in the market of Paute where she sells sweets that she acquires in order to resell them. Her work schedule is from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. everyday. She has been in this business for a year and a half and she feels happy because it is going well for her. This is her second cycle with the foundation. She commented to us that the loans she received have been invested in her business, and the new loan she requested will be invested in the care of her tender little girl, to buy milk and diapers. Her dream is to have a bigger business to give better service and assorted products to her discerning clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pineapples, melons, apples, grapes and to buy milk, diapers, and medical expenses for the child

loans.name: Abiola

texts.en: In 2000, Abiola started her business selling wine and other juice products. She is happy doing the business as this has always attracted her to her customers. Abiola lives in Lagos. She is 43 years old and married to a printer. She has one child who is still growing up. Abiola wants to make her business bigger. She is requesting a loan of N70,000 to purchase more juice products and wine to sell. She thanks all her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more juice and wine

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 42 years old.  He is married and has four children. Three of his children are in school and one is learning a trade. George has been a baker who uses flour for his production for the last two years.  He is also a chainsaw operator. He bakes bread, cakes, meat pies, etc. and retails them to his customers. He supplies them mostly by himself in the market center. People also take bulk delivery from him. His only problem now is having adequate funds to buy raw materials, as prices are going up. He is requesting a loan to refurbish his business. With the loan, he believes he can provide for his family and most especially his children's education.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more building materials

loans.name: Marina Del Carmen

texts.es: Marina del Carmen H. D. M. D. 34 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos D. 12 y 11 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar y residen en el departamento D. Usulután. Marina posee una venta D. ropa para niños y adultos, así mismo venD. cremas y ganchos para el cabello, la cual lo comercializa en uno D. los lugares con mayor comercio en Usulután. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. ropa, D. manera que pueda tener más prendas D. vestir que ofrecer a las personas, como tallas, color y estilos, y así poder aumentar sus ventas. Marina es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo la cual desea seguir adelante con su negocio y poder mejorar las condiciones D. este, ya que es gracias a su venta D. ropa como ella pueD. obtener una estabilidad económica junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Marina del Carmen H. D. M. is 34 years old and lives with her husband and their two children aged 12 and 11. Her children are both in school, and the family resides in the department (administrative region) of Usulután. Marina has a business selling clothing for children and adults along with creams and hair clips; she sells these items in one of the places with the most traD. in Usulután. She requests a loan to buy an increased quantity of clothing so that she will have more clothing to offer her customers with a variety of sizes, colors and styles, and in this way increase her sales. Marina is a person who is very dedicated to her work. She wants to proceed with her business and be able to improve it; as thanks to her clothing sales she is able to obtain economic stability for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing and hair accessories

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is married and has no kids. He is a 31-year-old trader. He lives with his wife in a rented apartment in a community in the western region of Ghana. He trades in garment tie dye material. Tie dye is designed from the combination of plain white cloth soaked in mixed dye to get the actual design. Tie dye is very useful and beautiful, so many people purchase it. The fabric can be sewn into African wear and it can also be used to sew a traditional style of clothing. Benjamin treks to Takoradi to buy his stock of goods. For lack of adequate working capital, he buys only a small amount of lace material and sells through hawking. He believes the loan will enable him to grow his business to the expected level. With the loan, he wants to purchase lace materials and textiles in bulk. He hopes to use part of his profit to expand his output.

loans.use: To purchase lace materials and textiles in bulk

loans.name: Alade

texts.en: J. is happy with her drinks business and has been doing it for some time now. She normally buys her drinks from a distributor and restocks every three weeks. She is 44 years old and married with three children. J. wants to use her loan to purchase more drinks to help her to support her family and make her business grow. Though her husband is a civil servant, with her business they are able to carry the family along. She needs a loan of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She resides in Lagos and she thanks Kiva lenders for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: María Elsy

texts.es: María Elsy Q. M. de 49 años de edad, reside en el municipio de San Jorge, en el departamento de San Miguel. Vive junto a su esposo el cual se dedica a la ganadería. María posee una venta de pupusas, chocolate caliente, café y sodas, negocio el cual esta ubicado frente a la alcaldía de San Jorge, lugar el cual es muy transitado por las personas, las cuales en su mayoría son empleados que se dirigen a su trabajo. A pesar que el trabajo de maría es bastante pesado por el hecho que no solo debe hacer las pupusas sino que día con día debe llevar la cocina, mesas, sillas y todos los ingredientes para hacer las pupusas, hasta su lugar de trabajo, María es una mujer que siempre esta sonriente, ya que reconoce que su negocio es una bendición de Dios el cual le permite brindarle la ayuda necesaria a su esposo. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar materia prima para la elaboración de pupusas, esto con el fin de poder contar con todo lo necesario para vender más de su producto.
texts.en:
Maria Elsy Q. Martinez is 49 years old and lives in the San Jorge municipality, in the department of San Miguel. She lives with her husband, who works with livestock. Maria owns a business that sells pupusas, hot chocolate, coffee and sodas. It is located in front of the San Jorge mayor’s office. This location has a great deal of foot traffic, mainly from employees on their way to work. In spite of all this, Maria’s work is very hard because not only must she make the pupusas, but day in and day out she must transport to her place of work the stove, tables, chairs, and the ingredients for pupusas. Maria is a woman who is always cheerful because she recognizes that her business is a blessing from God that allows her to give her husband the necessary help. She requests a loan through which she will be able to buy the basic ingredients for making pupusas, with the goal of having everything necessary to sell more of her product.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase drinks and basic ingredients for making pupusas.

location.town: Municipio de San Jorge, departamento de San Miguel

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 35 years old. She is a married woman with five children. Currently all her children are in school. She lives with her family in Axim in the western region of Ghana. She has been a baker for the last 10 years.  In spite of the challenges she faces, she bakes bread, cakes, meat pies, chips, etc. and retails them to her customers. She sells them herself in the market center to her customers. People also take bulk delivery of bread from her. Her only problem now has to do with having adequate funds to buy raw materials, as prices are shooting up. She requests a loan to help her remain in business. With the loan, she believes she can provide for her family and most especially her children's education.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood etc.

loans.name: Nike

texts.en: Nike's business is booming.  She is 50 years old and married with two children. She sells drinks, which she buys from distributors. She also rents plates, cups, etc for occasions. She has been in business for 10 years. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. Nike wants to see her business grow bigger than this but one of the challenges she faces in her drinks business is capital.  She hopes for a loan of NGN 180,000 to purchase more drinks to sells. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Ana Beatriz

texts.es: Ana Beatriz S. G. de 26 años de edad, reside en el municipio de San Jorge, en el departamento de San Miguel. Vive junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como cobrador de buses, y junto a su hijo de un año de edad. Ella posee una venta de paletas y helados, los cuales los comercializa en su hogar, esto los vende por unidad y así mismo los vende por mayor a los vendedores ambulantes. Ana es una persona la cual trata de esforzarse día con día, ya que es consiente que el sueldo de su esposo es muy poco para poder solventar todos los gastos del hogar, es por esto que ella solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más helados y paletas, de manera que pueda contar con más cliente que compren el producto al por mayor, de esta manera ella espera aumentar las ventas y brindarle la ayuda necesaria a su esposo.
texts.en:
Ana Beatriz S. G. is 26 years old and lives in the municipality of San Jorge, in the department of San Miguel. She lives with her husband, who works as a bus conductor, and their 1 year-old son. She has a business selling popsicles and ice cream from her home; she sells these individually, and also sells wholesale to street vendors. Ana is a person who tries to work hard day by day, since she is aware that her husband's income will not cover all of the household expenses. For this reason she requests a loan which she will use to buy more popsicles and ice cream, so that she can increase her wholesale business. In this way she hopes to increase her sales and provide the necessary support to her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ice cream and popsicles

location.town: Municipio de San Jorge, departamento de San Miguel

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es: Olivia de 43 años es una mujer muy sencilla y alegre, vive en su casa propia  y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.La actividad a la que se dedica Olivia es la venta de jugos y yogurt, compra su mercadería en una ciudad  fronteriza con el país de Bolivia y la trae hasta su ciudad para distribuirla en las distintas tiendas donde ya tiene contratos anticipados. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es vender su mercadería, ya que siente que su trabajo produce, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los productos, ya que son muy frágiles. Con el tiempo, espera tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender en mayor cantidad  sus productosEste es el primer préstamo de Olivia con  MFP y sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo; en su banco comunal es muy alegre y siempre esta pendiente de  todos los acuerdos que tienen entre socias.Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos, ya que en la actualidad tiene mayor cantidad de  pedidos.
texts.en:
Olivia is 43 years old. She is a humble and content person that lives in her own house and hopes to improve the quality of her life. Olivia sells yogurt and juices. She buys her merchandise in a border town with Bolivia and she brings it to the city in order to distribute it to certain shops that have promised to purchase her merchandise. What she likes most about her business is selling her merchandise. She feels like her work is productive. She has been doing this activity for four years. The difficult part of her work is transporting her products, as they are very fragile. With time, she hopes to have a larger store where she can sell greater quantities of her product. This is the first loan that Olivia has requested from MFP and she knows that she has to pay her payments on time. She is happy to be a member of the community bank. She knows the bank is counting on the members to meet their commitments. With the 800 new soles that she is requesting, she will buy more products. If she has more merchandise she will be able to fulfill more requests for her products.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase more merchandise in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Jesús Antonio

texts.es: Jesús Antonio R. M. de 45 años de edad, reside en Jayaque, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertar. Su grupo familiar esta conformado por su esposa, y sus dos hijos de 17 y 13 años de edad, los cuales estudian y colaboran con su padre en el negocio familiar. Jesús posee una panadería en su propia casa, pan el cual él se encarga de elaborar y repartir, ya cuenta con muchos años de experiencia en este oficio él tiene amplia clientela, debido a que ofrece pan de muy buena calidad y a un buen precio. Jesús solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar harina al por mayor de manera que pueda obtenerla a un precio más bajo, así mismo comprar otros utensilios los cuales utiliza para cocinar el pan. Jesús anhela poder brindarles siempre todo lo necesario a sus hijos y que nunca le haga falta nada, es por ello que desea invertir más en su negocio y mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Jesús Antonio R. M., 45, lives in Jayaque in the La Libertad department. His family is comprised of his wife and their two children, 17 and 13. The children go to school and work with their father in the family business. Jesús has a bakery in his own house. He is in charge of making and distributing the bread. He has lots of years of experience in this job. He has a lot of customers because his bread is very good quality and he sells it for a good price. Jesús is asking for a loan to be able to buy flour wholesale in order to get it at a lower price. He also will buy other utensils to use when making the bread. Jesús yearns to be able to always give everything necessary to his children so that they will lack nothing. That is why he wants to invest more in his business and improve his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material to make bread

loans.name: Las Violetas Group

texts.es:
EL GRUPO LAS VIOLETAS,ESTA INTEGRADO POR 10 PERSONAS, MUY SOLIDARIAS Y TRABAJADORAS QUE VIVEN EN LA ZONA DE AÑO NUEVO EN EL DISTRITO DE COMAS,LA SRA. R. ES LA SECRETARIA DE LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO, TIENE 51 AÑOS Y TIENE DOS HIJOS YA ADULTOS.
HACE CUATRO AÑOS ELLA SE DEDICA A LA ATENCIÓN Y ADMINISTRACIÓN DE SU PROPIO NEGOCIO QUE ES UNA FUENTE DE SODA DE NOMBRE "ROSITA" UBICADO EN UN MERCADO.
LA SRA. R. INICIÓ TRABAJANDO PARA OTRA PERSONA DONDE APRENDIÓ EL MANEJO DEL NEGOCIO, FUÉ ADQUIRIENDO EXPERIENCIA Y CUANDO SE SINTIÓ SEGURA Y CAPAZ SE INDEPENDIZÓ, Y CON MUCHO ESFUERZO HA LOGRADO SACAR ADELANTE SU NEGOCIO.
HACE POCO FUÉ OPERADA POR LO QUE NO PUEDE DEDICARSE AL 100% A LA FUENTE DE SODA, LAAPOYAN SUS HIJOS. PERO ELLA QUE ES UNA MUJER TRABAJADORA E INDEPENDIENTE NO DEJA DE PRODUCIR Y SE ESTÁ DEDICANDO POR EL MOMENTO A LAS MANUALIDADES.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO INVERTIRÁ UN PARTE EN SU FUENTE DE SODA Y OTRA PARTE A LOS PAGOS DE REHABILITACIÓN POR LA OPERACIÓN QUIRÚRGICA QUE TUVO,LO CUAL LE PERMITIRÁ RECUPERARSE PRONTO Y REGRESAR AL TRABAJO.
texts.en:
The “Las Violetas” Group is comprised of 10 very supportive and hardworking people who live in the Año Nuevo zone in the Comas district.

R. is the secretary of the board of directors of the group. She is 51 years old and has two children who are now adults. She has managed and attended to her own soda fountain business for the past four years. It is called “Rosita” and is located in a market. R. began working for another person, which is where she learned business management. She acquired experience and when she felt confident and capable of becoming independent, she was able to advance her business with much effort.

Not too long ago, she had an operation and was not able to commit 100% to the soda foundation. Her children supported her, but as she is a hardworking and independent woman, she has not stopped producing and is working on handicrafts at the moment.

The requested loan will be invested partly in her soda foundation and partly in the rehabilitation payments for the surgical operation that she had, which will allow her to recover soon and return to work.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in their business

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice sells drinks. She is 47 years old and married with five children. I. has been in business since 2006. She uses part of the proceeds from the business to help her husband with the upkeep of their house. Alice is a focused and hard worker. She puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers.  She hopes for a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more drinks. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Funke

texts.en: Funke is 50 years old. She is married with six children. She manages her business with her children to make a living in Lagos State, Nigeria. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She hopes for a bigger stall in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Wilber Javier

texts.es: Wilber Javier  tiene 26 años, a esta edad es un joven que ha sabido ganarse la vida por lo que su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, ya que cuando el inicio fue por una herencia de su abuelo y quería sacar adelante este negocio que sería la fuente de ingresos necesarios para mantener a sus 2 hijos y su familia así trata de mantener esta actividad. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan, galletas y detergentes. El sueña con mejorar su vivienda y también proporcionarles a sus hijos los estudios necesarios.
texts.en:
Wilber Javier is 26 years old. At this age, he is a young man who has known how to earn a living with his mini market. He has had this business for over six years. When he started it was because of an inheritance from his grandfather. He wanted to get the business ahead because it would be the source of the income necessary to support his two children. His family tries to maintain the business. The loan he is asking for is for working capital to buy basic grains, sweets, natural beverages, bread, crackers, and detergent. He dreams of improving his house and providing his children with the necessary education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains, sweets, natural beverages, bread, crackers, and detergent

loans.name: Delmy Del Rosario

texts.es: Delmy del Rosario L. C. de 37 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a sus cuatro hijos todos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Delmy posee un taller de costura en el cual elabora prendas de vestir para las diferentes personas que hacen sus pedidos y así mismo comercializa la ropa que elabora de manera ambulante. Ella es una persona que debe esforzarse mucho ya que desea poder brindarles todo lo necesario a sus cuatro hijos. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar telas y repuestos para sus maquinas de coser, esto con el fin de poder aceptar mayor cantidad de pedidos, sobre todo en la temporada de inicio de clases la cual esta pronta y todas las personas mandan a hacer los uniformes de sus hijos. A pesar que Delmy recibe ayuda del padre de sus hijos, ella trabaja mucho para poder solventar todos los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Delmy del Rosario L. C., 37, lives in the city of Arce in the La Libertad department. She lives with her four minor children. They go to school. Delmy has a seamstress shop. She makes articles of clothing for different people who place orders. She also works as a street vendor to sell the clothes she makes. She is a person who must put forth a great deal of effort because she wants to be able to give her four children everything they need. She is asking for a loan to be able to buy fabric and replacement parts for her sewing machines. That way she will be able to accept more orders, especially in the season when classes start. That season will be here soon, and everybody has uniforms made for their children. Even though Delmy receives help from the father of their children, she works hard to be able to pay all of the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric to make clothes

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Zulma Yaneth

texts.es: Zulma Yaneth Z. D. P. D. 32 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad y vive junto a su esposo y un hijo en casa propia, la cual con mucho esfuerzo están logrando pagar junto a su compañero D. vida. Ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos y D. primera necesidad para el hogar. Negocio el cual ella desea poder verlo surtido, lo cual ha sido imposible para ella, es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar muchos más productos como papel higiénico, pasta dental, embutidos y otros productos más, los cuales las personas consumen más. Esto lo hace con el fin D. aumentar sus ventas, D. manera que pueda seguir adelante con su negocio y seguir ayudándole a su esposo a pagar la casa y pagar todas las cosas que como familia necesitan para vivir.
texts.en:
Zulma Yaneth Z. D. P. is 32 years old. She lives in the La Libertad department with her husband and son in their own home, which she strives to pay for together with her life partner. She has a small shop, which sells perishable items and general goods for the home. She would like to see the store stocked, which has been impossible for her. For this reason, she has requested a loan so that she can buy many more products such as toilet paper, toothpaste, cold meat, and more products that people use frequently. She hopes to increase her sales in this way so that she can get ahead with her business and continue helping her husband pay for the house and all the things that the family needs to live.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perishables

loans.name: Moris Alexander

texts.es: Moris Alexander M. H. de 21 años de edad, reside en Zacatecoluca, departamento de La Paz. Vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de 5 años de edad. Moris posee una venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado de Zacatecoluca, negocio en el cual su compañera de vida trabaja junto a él, ambos son personas que a pesar que son muy jóvenes han sabido esforzarse y trabajar muy arduamente para seguir adelante como familia y poder pagarle los estudios a su pequeña hija. Moris es una persona que desea mejorar la economía de familiar, es por esto que desea surtir su negocio, es por ello que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de frutas y verduras las cuales las obtiene al contado, es por ello que es muy necesario contar con el dinero al momento de comprarlas. Moris sueña con crecer en su negocio y de esta manera poder brindarle un mejor estilo de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Moris Alexander M. H. is 21 years old. He lives in Zacatecoluca, La Paz. He lives with his life partner and their five-year old child. Moris has a fruit and vegetable stand in the Zacatecoluca market. His life partner works alongside him. Both, though very young, have worked hard to get ahead with their family and to pay for the studies of their young daughter. Moris wants to improve his family’s finances, and thus would like to stock his business by purchasing larger quantities of fruits and vegetables, which he would pay for in cash. Thus, it’s necessary to have the money when he buys them. Moris dreams of expanding his business, so that he can bring a better quality of life to his child.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Sandra Elizabeth P. O. de 24 años de edad, reside en Zacatecoluca, departamento de La Paz. Vive junto a su compañera de vida el cual trabaja como policía y su hijo de 6 años de edad el cual estudia en el Kinder Nacional de Zacatecoluca. Sandra posee una venta de sabanas, trastes, baterías de cocina y todo lo relacionado con el uso del hogar. Ella vende sus productos al crédito o al contado y cuenta con varios clientes fijos  con los cuales sabe que tiene una venta segura. Es por esto que Sandra solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar su producto al por mayor, y de esta manera tener más que ofrecerle a sus clientes. Sandra es una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual goza de muy buenas referencias, ya que se destaca por ser muy responsable e ingeniosa, quien siempre esta velando por el bienestar de su hijo.
texts.en:
Sandra Elizabeth P. O. is 24 years old and lives in Zacatecoluca, La Paz. She lives with her life partner, who works as a police officer, and their 6-year old child, who studies in the National Kindergarten of Zacatecoluca. Sandra has a business selling sheets, utensils, kitchen tools and everything related to home use. She sells products on credit and cash sales, and has various steady customers, for which reason she feels the business is secure. Sandra requests a loan so that she can purchase products in bulk, and in this way offer more to her customers. Sandra is a hard-working woman, who enjoys many good references. Those that stand out are that she is very responsible and clever, always watching over the wellbeing of her child.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Celia Marleny

texts.es: Celia Marleny G. D. M. D. 45 años D. edad, resiD. en Rosario D. La Paz, ubicado en el departamento D. La Paz. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como conserje y junto a sus tres hijos menores D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee una pupusería en su propia casa, así mismo venD. bebidas frías y calientes. Celia solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar maíz en mayores cantidades, ya que este el ingrediente principal D. las pupusas, así mismo comprar queso, frijoles y más bebidas. Celina desea mejorar las ventas D. su negocio ya que ha sido a través D. este como durante años le ha brindado la ayuda necesaria a su esposo para poder seguir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Celia Marleny G. D. M. is 45 and lives in Rosario D. La Paz, which is located in the department of La Paz. She lives with her husband, who works as a caretaker of a building, and their three young children, who go to school. She has a pupusería [a store where pupusas or sold, which are corn tortillas stuffed with beans, cheese, and/or meat] in her home. She also sells cold and hot drinks. Celia is requesting a loan so she can buy corn in large quantities, since this is the main ingredient in pupusas, as well as cheese, beans, and more drinks. Celia hopes to improve the sales of her business since through it, she has been able to give her husband the necessary help to take good care of their family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains and drinks

location.town: Rosario de La Paz, departamento de La Paz

loans.name: Elena's Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios, pertenecen al banco comunal “QOLQUEWASI”. El nombre del banco comunal es de origen de la lengua quechua que traducido al castellano significa “Casa de Oro”. Nuestros socios se reúnen cada treinta días en la oficina principal de la Asociación Arariwa Cusco. 
 
Nuestros socios alternan sus diversas actividades del hogar, con la venta de frutas, comestibles, comida y perfumería. Otros socios brindan el servicio de secretariado en un estudio contable, empleado publico, pintura de cuadros y atención de laboratorio dental. En el comercio de venta de frutas la socia Yolanda vende papayas, naranjas y plátanos en el mercado de Zarzuela del distrito de Santiago de la provincia del Cusco. La socia Nely tiene 28 años es casada tiene un hijo y hace el servicio de llamadas en la calle Belén. La socia Nely en la vereda de la calle Belén ofrece a los transeúntes llamadas a celulares móviles a un precio de cincuenta centavos de nuevo sol (moneda peruano S/. 0.50) por minuto. La socia Agustina tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos. La socia Agustina se dedica a la venta de comestibles como arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc., ella acomodo una habitación en su domicilio donde actualmente funciona su tienda de abarrotes, ya son 7 años que tiene el negocio de venta de comestibles y le ha ido bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Los socios requieren el préstamo para aumentar el capital de negocio. Los socios que se dedican a la venta de abarrotes desean comprar arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc. y otros socios desean comprar más insumos para preparar más platos de comida y así esta manera los socios desean incrementar sus ingresos y darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

El banco comunal Qolquewasi ya son cinco años que trabaja con Arariwa y se sienten felices y contentos por ser parte de la institución y les encanta el proyecto Kiva.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the communal bank “Qolquewasi.” The name of the communal bank is of Quechua origin and translated to Spanish it means “House of Gold.” Our members meet every month in main office of Asociación Arariwa [Kiva Field Partner] in Cusco. Our members alternate their diverse home activities with selling fruit, groceries, food, and perfume. Other members work as a secretary in an accountant’s office, one is a civil servant, one paints paintings, and another works in a dental laboratory. Yolanda sells papayas, oranges, and bananas in the Zarzuela market in the district of Santiago in the province of Cusco. Nely is 28 years old, is married, has one child, and she has a telephone services business on Belén street. She offers cellular phone services to passersby at 50 cents of the Nuevo Sol (Peruvian currency, S/. 0.50) per minute. Agustina is 49 years old, is married, and has five children. Agustina sells grocery items such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc. She arranged a room in her house that now functions as her grocery store. She has had this business for 7years and it has gone well for her thanks to the hard work she has put into it. The members need the loan to increase their working capital for their businesses. The members that sell groceries would like to buy rice, sugar, noodles, etc. and other members want to buy more ingredients to prepare more food so they can increase their income and give their children a better quality of life. The members value and appreciate the loan granted to them this way and they also promise to make their payments in the established time frame. The “Qolquewasi” communal bank has been working with Arariwa for five years and they feel happy and content to be part of the institution and they love the Kiva project.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Some of the members need the loan for rice, sugar, noodles, perfumes, food ingredients, and others need it for personal expenses

loans.name: Javier Alexander

texts.es:
Javier T., vive en una zona periurbana ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su esposa es abogada con ella tienen 3 hijos uno de 14 años, 8 años y 12 años todos estudiando en una escuela fiscal.

Javier empezó con un pequeño puesto vendiendo verduras y así poco a poco pudo ampliarla como tienda con casi todas las necesidades de sus clientes, ahora Jofre se levanta desde muy temprano a veces con la ayuda de su esposa atender la tienda vendiendo fideos, colas, agua, etc. Una de las dificultades que el tiene es el dolor de su cuerpo por lo que hace ya unos años atrás tuvo un accidente de transito. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar aceites, arroz, colas para así incrementar más su tienda. En el futuro quiere poner otra tienda en un lugar mas necesitado.
texts.en:
Javier lives in the suburbs of the Paradise of Guayaquil. His wife is a lawyer and they have three children, fourteen, eight and twelve years old. The children are studying in public school. Javier began with a small stall selling vegetables and little by little he was able to expand his business until now he has a store that supplies almost all the needs of his customers. Now Javier gets up very early to work at his store selling noodles, colas, water, etc., sometimes with his wife's assistance. One of the difficulties that he has is body pain because he was in a traffic accident several years ago. With this loan he would like to buy oil, rice, colas in order to increase the merchandise in his store. In the future he would like to open another store in a good location.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will buy oil, rice and cola.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo de 55 años, desea salir adelante por sus  tres hijos a quien lamentablemente ve cada quincena; debido a que esta separado de su esposa, él vive en su casa propia ubicada en la selva central del Perú.Desde hace 17 años maneja un vehículo de servicio urbano donde traslada pasajeros  dentro de su  ciudad; los fines de semana también lleva  algunos productos con una camioneta que alquila, ambas actividades ,según refiere, son rentables y le permiten ahorrar por lo que quiere  terminar de construir su vivienda para alquilarla ; además le gusta el trabajo porque es tranquilo ;ahora que los años han pasado,lamenta no haber invertido bien el dinero antes , por eso para el futuro planea comprar su propio vehículo para trabajar y enseñar el oficio a sus hijos.Es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP y desea seguir siendo puntual como siempre para acceder a más créditos; el trabajo en su banco comunal le agrada bastante porque está integrado por personas  responsables.Ya tiene planeado invertir  el dinero del préstamo en mejorar su auto para seguir trabajando además de comprar algunos materiales que le falta para terminar de construir su casa, como 400 unidades de ladrillos y  varios metros de fierros.
texts.en:
Gerardo is 55 years old and wishes to be successful for his three children who sadly he sees every 15 days as he is separated from his wife. He lives in his own home located in the central jungle of Peru. For 17 years he has driven an urban public transportation vehicle where he transports passengers within the city. On weekends he also takes some products with a small truck that he rents. Both activities, he indicates, are profitable and enable him to save as he wants to finish building his home in order to rent it. In addition he likes to work because it is tranquil. Now as the years have passed, he is sorry that he hadn’t invested his money well, but for the future he plans to buy his own vehicle for work and teach his sons his profession. This is the fifth loan he has with MFP and he plans on being punctual as always in order to be able to access future loans. He is pleased with the work in the communal bank because the bank is made up of responsible people. Now he plans to invest the money from the loan in improving his vehicle in order to continue working, in addition buying some materials that he needs to finish building his home, such as 400 units of brick and various meters of metal.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve his vehicle and buy construction materials for his home.

loans.name: Letty Aurora

texts.es:
Letty A., su casa esta ubicada en la zona de Paraíso de Guayaquil, su esposo repartes pollos con el tienen 3 hijos uno de 26 años, 22 años y 18 años ya todos terminaron sus estudios colegiales. 
 
Letty comenzó vendiendo pollo poco a poco en su sector, con algunos ahorros pudo comprar un vehiculo donde comenzó a repartir los pollos y después lo convirtió en expreso, ahora Letty trabaja con su vehiculo haciendo expreso a alumnos los recoge desde las 05h00 hasta las 08h00, de hay en adelante reparte pollos con su esposo, una de las dificultades que tiene es que tener cuidado de los accidentes de transito.

El préstamo lo quiere utilizar para la reparación de su vehiculo y así mejorarlo. En el futuro quiere comprar otro vehiculo para hacerlo expreso y tener otro ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
Letty A.’s house is in the Paraíso de Guayaquil zone. Her husband distributes chicken. They have three children; 26, 22, and 18. All of them have finished their education. Letty started selling chicken, little by little, in her area. With some savings she was able to buy a vehicle, and she started to deliver the chickens. Later, she converted it into an express vehicle. Letty now works with her vehicle as an express for students. She picks them up from 5:00 a.m. until 8:00 a.m. From then on she delivers chickens with her husband. One of the difficulties she has is being careful of the accidents while driving. She wants to use the loan to repair her vehicle and improve it. In the future she would like to buy another vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair her vehicle

loans.name: Pahxi Gricelda

texts.es: Pahxi es una mujer muy alegre y a demás responsable ella tiene dos hijos y los dos  están  a su cargo. esta señora dio inicio hace 12 años, su actividad es la compra de ropa dicha actividad la realiza de una manera permanente porque cuando comenzó a trabajar que como madre comprometida y responsable decidió ayuda a los ingresos de la familia ya que tenía que sacar adelante a su familia. Ella ha buscado la manera de salir adelante por lo que cada día se preocupa por mostrar sus productos a sus diferentes clientes. Actualmente solicita un financiamiento para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos y trajes por lo que se acerca la temporada navideña ya que tiene muchos pedidos. Su deseo es seguir esforzándose para que a sus hijos no les falte el pan de cada día.
texts.en:
Pahxi is a very happy and responsible woman. She has two children for whom she is responsible. She began her business 12 years ago buying clothing and kept this job because when she began to work as a dedicated and responsible mother she decided to help provide her family’s income as she had to ensure her children’s future. She has looked for a way to be successful so every day she makes sure to show her products to different customers. Today she seeks financing to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, and suits because the Christmas season is near and she has many orders. Her wish is to continue strengthening herself so that her children have their basic needs met.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for her busines

loans.name: Jhudy

texts.es: Jhudy de 28 años es una mujer muy empeñosa y esta casada con José, también de 28 años, ambos viven en su casa propia junto a sus 2 inquietos hijos, Roselin de 11 y Anthony de 2 años.Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles con la ayuda de su esposo y su hija, cada día es de constante lucha y sacrificio porque mantienen abierta la tienda las 24 horas del día para obtener mayores ganancias, ya que el negocio esta ubicado cerca de un puente por donde pasan los carros y éstos se detienen a comprar principalmente bebidas heladas, debido al calor que hace en la selva peruana; lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es hacer  amigos, quienes por el buen trato que les brinda regresan a comprar; la venta de sus productos le resulta bastante rentable porque el dinero que  obtiene le permite aportar en los gastos del hogar, además esta  ahorrando  para comprar un terreno, pues  desea ampliar el espacio de su negocio y vender al por mayor ,hasta sueña en convertirse en una gran distribuidora de productos comestibles.Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y sabe que seguirá progresando porque pagará  puntualmente sus cuotas, asimismo le entusiasma trabajar con los integrantes de su banco comunal.Piensa invertir el dinero del préstamo en la compra de más mercadería para mejorar  su tienda y atraer más clientes.
texts.en:
Jhudy is 28 years old and married to José, who is also 28. She is an earnest woman who lives in her own home with her two active children, Roselin (age 11) and Anthony (age 2). For the past four years, she has been selling food products with the help of her husband and daughter. Each day is a constant struggle that requires great sacrifice because she keeps her store open 24 hours a day in order to earn the most income possible. Her business is located near a bridge where cars pass through the area. People stop to buy cold drinks in order to deal with the heat of the Peruvian jungle. What she enjoys most about her job is making friends with her customers, who return to make more purchases because of the good service they receive. Jhudy says selling her products is profitable and allows her to contribute to the household expenses. In addition, she is setting aside money to buy land so that she can have enough space to expand her business. Her dream is to become a wholesale distributor of food products.

This is her third loan with MFP. Jhudy knows that in order to make progress, she must make her payments on time. She is also excited about working with the other members of her Communal Bank. The funds will be used to purchase more merchandise so that she can improve her store and attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of merchandise

loans.name: Mi Cajero Group

texts.es:
MI CAJERO

Esta alcancía comunal alcanzó su noveno ciclo de préstamo, sus diez integrantes están muy contentos porque el negocio que cuenta cada uno aporta en la economía para su hogar, con el tiempo han mejorado su calidad de vida de estas personas pero aún saben que los préstamos que requieren le ayudarán mucho para continuar trabajando en sus negocios. Jacinta y Eusebio nos cuentan en esta vez sus historias como microempresarios.

Jacinta es madre de cuatro hijos, tiene 42 años de edad, con las ganancias de los trabajos que realizó de mesera en restaurantes y limpieza en casas alquiló un kiosco pequeño para vender gaseosas y golosinas lo que al comienzo no vendía mucho porque recién se estaba haciendo conocida. Adquirió créditos para implementar su kiosco, los ingresos fueron mejorando debido a que el lugar se convirtió en paradero de carros, empleando las ganancias en pagar a su hija la carrera superior de farmacia en un instituto particular y a su último hijo educación escolar en una escuela del estado.
Comprará mercadería (piqueos, gaseosas, galletas, caramelos) con el préstamo que recibirá a fin de apoyar a su conviviente en los gastos de su familia. 

Eusebio tiene 75 años, es viudo hace varios años. Hace 39 años trabajaba vendiendo abarrotes y verduras en la casa donde alquilaba, tenía buenos ingresos para ello tenía que comprar la mercadería en el mercado mayorista de Lima. Se dedicó lo que son golosinas, venta de cerveza y gaseosas a partir del año 1975 lo hacía en su casa propia que compró. El primer crédito que recibió lo invirtió en galletas, dulces, caramelos. Las ganancias de estos negocios educaron y mantuvo a sus dos hijos. El trabajar de esta forma paga sus gastos de alimentación, salud y servicios básicos del hogar.
texts.en:
MI CAJERO

This comunal bank achieved its ninth loan cycle. Its ten members are very happy because the business that each of them has, supports the household economy. With time, they have improved their quality of life, but they still know that the loans that they need will help them greatly to be able to continue working in their businesses. This time, Jacinta and Eusebio tell us their stories as micro-entrepreneurs.

Jacinta is 42 years old and is the mother of four children. With her job earnings that she made as a restaurant waitress and in household cleaning, she rented a small kiosk to sell soda and candy. At the beginning, she didn’t sell much because she was still making herself known. She acquired loans to set up her kiosk and the earnings improved because the place became a stopping place for cars. She has used the earnings to pay for her daughter’s pharmacy studies at a local institute, as wells as pay for schooling for her youngest son at a state school. With this loan, she will purchase merchandise (snacks, soda, cookies, candy) in order to assist her live-in partner with the household expenses.

Eusebio is 75 years old and has been a widower for the past several years. Thirty-nine years ago, he used to work selling groceries and vegetables in the house that he rented. He had good earnings and he would have to purchase merchandise in the wholesale market in Lima. Since 1975, he has been running the business from his own house that he bought. He has sold candy, beer and soda. He invested the first loan that he received in cookies, sweets, and candy. He used the earnings from his business for the education and upbringing of his two children. His work pays for his food, health, and basic household service expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soda and candy

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina de 35 años  esta casada con Jorge de 49 años, con quien tiene 6 hijos, Liz de 15, Jorge de 13, Ricky de 11, Herry de 7, Diana de 5 años y Wilson de 4 meses de nacido; todos viven en su humilde casa propia ubicada en una zona alejada de la selva central peruana.Desde hace 23 años se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva  plantaciones de plátanos, café y palta para un mayorista , por lo que recibe un jornal diario; realiza esta actividad con la ayuda de su esposo , lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede cosechar algunos frutos y llevárselos a sus hijos todos  los días, como su salario es diario considera que su trabajo es rentable porque le permite distribuir el dinero en lo que necesita y así puede ahorrar para cubrir otros gastos, en el futuro desea comprar sus propios terrenos, sembrar en cantidad café, plátanos y palta, además de aperturar un pequeño negocio de venta de frutas de la selva central.Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete  a pagar puntualmente cada cuota en agradecimiento a la confianza que la entidad depositó en ella.El dinero del préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de frutas, las que empezará a vender en la puerta de su casa, además comprará algunas aves para criar y más adelante comercializarlas a buen precio porque les brindará  un cuidado especial.
texts.en:
Justina is 35 years old and married to Jorge, who is 49. They have six children: Liz (age 15), Jorge (age 13), Ricky (age 11), Herry (age 7), Diana (age 5), and Wilson (age 4 months). They live in their own modest home located in a remote area of the central Peruvian jungle.

Justina has been involved in farming for 23 years. She grows bananas, coffee, and avocados on behalf of a wholesaler and receives a daily wage. Her husband helps her with the work. What she likes most about her job is being able to keep some of the fruit and bring them home every day to give to her children. Justina says her daily income is sufficient to provide for her necessities and she is able to save for future expenditures, such as a buying her own land so that she can grow more coffee, bananas, and avocados. In addition, she plans to open a small business selling fruits produced in the central jungle.

This is her first loan with MFP. Justina promises to make each of her payments on time and is grateful that the Institution has confidence in her. She plans to use the loan to buy fruit that she can sell from the doorstep of her house. Justina will also purchase poultry to care for so that she can sell them later for a good price.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Start a new business selling fruit & raising poultry

loans.name: Jacaranda Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. emprendimiento D. JACARANDA se compone por una mesa directiva: La Presidenta es la Señora Rosio que se dedica a la venta en tienda D. barrio,que vive en casa familiar junto a su esposo y su  hijo en la zona D. santa ana los dos comparten los gastos del hogar. 

La Secretaria  es la Señora Wendy que se dedica a la artesania y venta D. temporada durante 6 años ella venD. en ferias que se realizan en distintos lugares con esta actividad colabora con los gastos D. la casa, vive en casa D. sus suegros en la zona central junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos.

El Tesorero es el Señor Jose Luis el se dedica a la  venta D. celulares y es tambien transportista se dedica a esta actividad durante 18 años  vive en casa D. anticretico junto a su esposa  y sus 4 hijos en la zona D. colquiri norte. El grupo es dinamico y sus integrantes se apoyan ya que se encuentra bien organizado
texts.en:
The Jacaranda comunal bank is composed of a board of directors: The president is Rocio, who is involved in sales in a neighborhood store. She lives in a house together with her husband and son in the Santa Ana zone. The two share the household expenses.

The secretary is Wendy, who has worked in handicrafts and seasonal sales for 6 years. She sells her products in different local markets and this contributes to the household expenses. She lives in her in-laws’ house in the central zone, together with her husband and two children.

The treasurer is Jose Luis, who works in cell phone sales and also in transport. He has been involved in these for 18 years. He lives in an anticrético (a special rental arrangement available in Bolivia) in the Colquiri Norte zone, together with his wife and four children.

The group is dymanic and its members support each other, as they are well organized.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 35 años y vive feliz en su casa propia junto a  su esposo Carlos de 40 años, aún no tienen hijos, pero igual buscan mejorar cada día.Desde hace 18 años se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas al por mayor y menor, dentro de su casa; esta actividad la realiza junto a su esposo y lo que más le gusta es poder terminar una  cantidad de mercadería a diario, porque es una meta trazada que tiene que cumplir, lo que le disgusta es que cuando no le salen las frutas debe coger un triciclo y empujarlo por diferentes lugares aledaños a su vivienda ofreciendo sus productos “esa rutina es bastante cansada, al final del día terminas sin fuerzas, ni garganta por haber gritado mucho, pero el hecho de terminar sin frutas hace que valga la pena”, señala Rosa, a la vez explica que su trabajo es muy rentable porque le ha permitido construir su casa, mantener su hogar y cubrir sus necesidades, en el futuro desea aperturar varias tiendas de venta  de frutas las que sólo tenga que administrar como lo viene haciendo con la tienda en su casa.Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y esta segura que pagará puntualmente para acceder a más créditos, además esta muy contenta con el trabajo que desarrolla en su banco comunal porque aprende mucho.Con el dinero del préstamo tiene  previsto comprar frutas al por mayor, para luego venderlas y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa is 35 years old and lives happily in her own home with her husband Carlos, who is 40. Although they have no children, they are always looking to improve each day. For the past 18 years, Rosa has been buying and selling fruit in bulk and in small amounts outside of her house. She manages this business with her husband. What she likes most about her job is being able to sell all of her merchandise by the end of the day since that is a goal she tries to accomplish. The part she dislikes is hauling the fruit to her house in her tricycle from various places nearby. Rosa says her daily routine is very tiring. She lacks the strength by the end of the day after shouting a lot to attract customers. However, she says selling all of her fruit by the end of the day makes the effort worthwhile.

Rosa says her work is profitable because it has allowed her to build a home, support her family, and meet their basic necessities. In the future, she wants to open more fruit stands that she can manage in addition to the one she has established at home. This is her second loan with MFP. Rosa is careful to make her payments on time so that she will be eligible to access future loans. She is pleased with the work of her Communal Bank because she has a learned a lot through this experience. The loan will be used to buy fruit in bulk so that she can sell them at a higher profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit to sell

loans.name: Tania Elizabeth

texts.es:
Tania González de 23 años de edad, vive en una zona periurbana ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de caña y solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico. Es madre soltera tiene 1 hijo y su mama la ayuda con el.

Tania empezó vendiendo arroz a los clientes de la mama por lo que ella tiene un comedor y así poco a poco comenzó vendiendo aceites, sal y azúcar hasta que puso en su casa una pequeña tienda. Ahora Tania vende legumbres y víveres desde las 06h30 hasta el anochecer con su hermano que a veces le ayuda, una de las mayores complicaciones que tiene es transportar la mercadería a tienda por lo que el bus la deja muy lejos de su casa.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar 2 cajas de aceites, 2 cajas de atún, 1 caja de sardinas para poder así agrandar el negocio. En el futuro quiere tener mejor surtida su tienda, ayudarla a su mama y que su hijo pueda estudiar.
texts.en:
Tania González is 23 years old and lives in the semi-urban district of Paraíso in Guayaquil. Her home is constructed of reeds and receives electricity as the only basic service. She is a single mother with one child. Her mother also lives with her.

Tania began selling rice to the customers of her mother, who operates a diner. Eventually she also started selling oil, salt, and sugar until she was able to open a small store. Tania now sells vegetables and other foodstuffs beginning at 6:30am until sundown. Her brother sometimes helps with business. One of her biggest problems is transporting the merchandise to her store since the bus stop is quite a distance away from her house.

Tania will use her loan to buy two cases of oil, two cases of tuna, and one case of sardines in order to expand her business. In the future, she hopes her store will be better stocked. She also wants to support her mother and provide for her child’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase oil, tuna, and sardines

loans.name: Lizzy

texts.en: Lizzy sells cooking oil (palm oil) and her husband is a retired civil servant. She is 50 years old and a mother of four. Her children are in school. Lizzy lives in Lagos State, Nigeria, and has been in business since 2004.
