In order to increase the size of her business, she is requesting a loan of 150,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more palm oil to sell at retail prices. She puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. With the business, she will be able to take care of her children. She thanks all her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more oil to sell

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Carmela es socia del Banco Comunal Fraternidad.
Carmela es casada, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, Carmela tiene una bodega en su casa en donde vende verduras, carne, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hija. Además viaja a las ferias de la selva ayacuchana en donde vende bebidas entre otros productos.
Carmela necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Carmela son comprar un carro para transportar su mercadería y que brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carmela is a member of the Communal Bank “Fraternidad” (Fraternity). She is 39 years old, married, and has three children.

Carmela operates a grocery store out of her home where she sells vegetables, meat, and fruit. She manages her business every day with the help of her daughter. In addition, she travels to fairs in the Ayacuchan jungle where she sells beverages and other products.

Carmela needs a loan of 750 soles in order to purchase milk, rice, and sugar. Among her dreams are to purchase an automobile for transporting her merchandise and to provide a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase milk, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Santa Cruz De Cocachacra Group

texts.es:
SANTA C. D. COCACHACRA

Grupo conformado por nueve mujeres y un varón todos ellos microempresarias quienes se dedican a L. venta D. comidas, frutas, golosinas. El negocio que cuentan permite ser un apoyo importante en su familia; así tenemos los siguientes testimonios: 
Mercedes es una mujer D. 53 años D. edad, hace diez años trabajó vendiendo en un kiosco propio jugos y golosinas para apoyar a su esposo en L. educación superior a sus hijos porque los ingresos D. éste solo cubría los gastos básicos D. su hogar; como toda madre es el deseo que sus hijos sean mejores que ellos. Salía a vender desD. muy temprano, al comienzo no vendía mucho cambiando esto en el transcurso del tiempo debido a que el lugar se volvió paradero D. micros con destino a pueblos D. L. sierra peruana. El primer crédito que recibió compró mercadería para su negocio (galletas, gaseosas, caramelos, piqueos u otros) y sus ganancias en los estudios superiores a sus hijos, y otra parte en alimentación, asimismo renovó el kiosco por uno nuevo. Requiere del préstamo para comprar gaseosas y golosinas. 

Norma es casada, madre D. tres hijos uno aún está al cuidado D. elL.. Cuando tuvo 20 años D. edad se subía al tren que pasaba en su pueblo con destino a Huancayo esto lo hacía era en horas D. L. mañana aprovechaba en vender frutas que elL. embolsaba en casa colocándolos en una cesta, recordaba cómo lo hacía cuando era niña para ayudar a su abueL. quien L. crió. Y en las tardes nuevamente salía a vender los frutos D. melocotones, mandarinas, manzana a los pasajeros del tren que iban a Lima, así terminaba D. vender toda su mercadería mientras su cuñada veía a sus hijos pequeños por unos momentos. Esto lo hizo porque su esposo no contaba con una estabilidad laboral queriendo darles lo mejor a los suyos L. impulsó trabajar así. D. igual modo los fines D. semana preparaba dulces (mazamorra morada, picarones, calabaza, arroz con leche) y platos como pollada, picante D. cuy, pachamanca a L. olL. ofreciendo a los pobladores D. su comunidad y en fiestas D. los pueblos D. L. sierra, llegando a tener los ingresos que permitieron dar educación a sus hijos, mejorar su casa, y comprar algunas cosas para el hogar que no contaban antes. Los préstamos que recibió los empleó en insumos, así mismo L. operación que tuvo D. L. vesícuL. y medicina dado a que elL. no cuenta con un seguro. Requiere D. este préstamo para comprar insumos, ganancias que ayudará en terminar D. educar a su última hija D. 14 años.
texts.en:
The Santa C. D. Cocachacra group is comprised of nine women and one man, all of whom are microbusinesspeople. They are dedicated to the sale of food, fruits, and candy. The business that they have is an important source of support to their families. We received the following testimonials:

Mercedes is a 53-year-old woman. She has worked for 10 years at her own kiosk selling juice and candy to support her husband with the higher education costs of their children. Her husband's income alone only covers their home's basic expenses. Like every mother, her dream is that her children have a better life than their parents. She used to start selling very early. At the beginning, she didn't sell much, but this changed in time because the location where she sold became a bus stop with a lot of buses heading towards towns in the Peruvian mountains. She used her first credit to buy merchandise for her business (cookies, soft drinks, candies, snacks, etc.), and she used her profits to pay for the higher education costs of her children as well as food. She also renovated her kiosk. She needs a loan to buy soft drinks and candy.

Norma is married and is the mother of 3 children who are still under her care. When she was 20, she would take the train that passed by that went to Huancayo. She did this early in the morning to make the most of selling fruits that she packaged in her house and put in a basket. She remembers that she did this when she was a girl to help her grandmother who raised her. In the afternoons, she also went out to sell peaches, mandarins, and apples to the passengers on the train that went to Lima. So she sold all of her merchandise while her sister-in-law watched her children. She did this because her husband didn't have a steady job, and her desire to give the best to her children motivated her to work. On the weekends, she prepared sweets (pudding, donuts, arroz con leche, etc.) and dishes such as chicken, guinea pig, and pachamanca (a traditional dish where meat and vegetables are baked in the ground with hot stones). She sells this food to people in her community and at festivals in towns in the mountains. She makes enough money to educate her children, to improve her home, and to buy some things for their home that they didn't have before. She has used the loans she has received to buy supplies for her business. She also used it for an operation she had on her gallbladder and for medicine because she does not have insurance. She needs this loan to be able to purchase supplies. Her profits will help her pay for the education of her youngest daughter, who is 14.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Fausta Gregoria

texts.es:
Fausta es socia del Banco Comunal Fraternidad.
Fausta es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 4 hijos, Fausta tiene una bodega en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, bebidas, golosinas. Además Fausta viaja a diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende frutas y de allá compra cereales quesos.
Fausta necesita un préstamo de 2200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, cebada.
Los sueños de Fausta son construir su casa y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Fausta is a member of the Banco Comunal Fraternidad. Fausta has a common-law partner. She is 39 years old and has four children. Fausta has a grocery store in her house where she sells groceries, drinks and sweets. In addition, Fausta travels to different markets in the region where she sells fruits, and there she buys grains and cheeses. Fausta needs a loan of 2200 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of wheat and barley. Fausta's dreams are to build her house and to educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wheat and barley.

loans.name: Mayra De La Trinidad

texts.es: Mayra De La Trinidad tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, desde muy joven ha sido trabajadora  y en el transcurso de su vida ha emprendido muchos negocios de los cuales no todos le fueron viables por lo que decidió empezar con  ofrecer los servicios de sala de belleza, ella inicio este negocio hace mas 10 años empezó como una aprendiz y poco a poco esta actividad le fue gustando y mejoro cada día. Es así es que ella logra obtener su propio negocio y a lo largo ha podido contar con Fundación León 2000 el cual le ha proveído de muchos financiamientos. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra cosméticos, cepillo, tijeras, tintes, shampoo y acondicionadores por lo que en esta temporada recibe a muchos clientes. El deseo de ella es mantener este negocio activo para que sus hijos tengan el sustento diario.
texts.en:
Mayra De la Trinidad is 45 years old. She is a single mother and has two children that she supports. Since she was very young she has been a worker, and through the course of her life she has taken on many businesses, not all of which were viable. For that reason, she decided to start offering beauty salon services. She began in this business more than ten years ago. She started out as an apprentice, and little by little she came to enjoy the work and she improved every day. It was in this way that she managed to get her own business, and throughout it all she has been able to count on Fundación León 2000, which has provided her with many loans. This loan is for capital for her work, for the purchase of cosmetics, brushes, scissors, dyes, shampoo and conditioner, because at this time she is getting many customers. Her wish is to keep her business lively so that her children may get their daily sustenance.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty salon products and instruments.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita es socia del Banco Comunal Fraternidad.
Rita es casada, tiene 44 años y 2 hijos, Rita tiene una bodega en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hija, además vende comida en su misma casa, también realiza bordados.
Rita necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y telas.
Los sueños de Rita son terminar de construir su casa y comprar otro terreno.
texts.en:
Rita is a member of the Banco Comunal Fraternidad. Rita is married. She is 44 years old and has two children. Rita runs a general store in her house, an activity that she carries out every day with the help of her daughter. In addition, she sells food in her own home, and also does embroidery work. Rita needs a loan of 1200 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar and fabric. Rita's dreams are to build her house and purchase more land.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar and fabric.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Trinidad es socia del Banco Comunal Fraternidad.
Trinidad es casada, tiene 50 años y 5 hijos, Trinidad compra quesos D. los intermediarios y ls venD. D. casa en casa y también lleva a instituciones sus ventas son al crédito y contado.
Trinidad necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. quesos.
Los sueños D. Trinidad son que sus hijos estén mejor que ella y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Trinidad is a member of the Banco Comunal Fraternidad. Trinidad is married. She is 50 years old and has five children. Trinidad buys cheeses from middlemen and sells them from door to door and to business establishments. Her sales are for credit and for cash payments. Trinidad needs a loan for 900 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of cheeses. Trinidad's dreams are that her children be better off than she is, and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cheeses.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Fraternidad.
Victoria es casada, tiene 38 años, Victoria vende comida de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Magdalena, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su sobrina. Además viaja a las ferias de donde compra animales menores.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gallinas y cuy.
El sueño de Victoria es mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Banco Comunal Fraternidad. Victoria is married and is 38 years old. Victoria sells food as she walks through the Magdalena market, an activity she carries out every day with the help of her niece. In addition, she travels to village markets where she buys small animals. Victoria needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of hens and guinea pigs. Victoria's dream is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther es socia del Banco Comunal Fraternidad.
Esther es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Esther vende abarrotes en general en la selva ayacuchana, a donde viaja una vez por semana, y de allá compra frutas y madera, para lo cual cuenta con carro propio.
Esther necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la reparación de su carro.
Los sueños de Esther son comprar un carro nuevo, terminar de construir su casa para la comodidad de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Esther is a member of the Fraternidad Communal Bank. Esther is 36, in a common law marriage, and has four children. Esther sells general groceries in the Ayacuchana jungle. She travels there once a week. She buys fruit and wood there, and she uses her own car for this. Esther needs a loan for 600 PEN to fix her car. Esther dreams are to buy a new car and to finish building her house for her children’s comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair her car

loans.name: Simbiat

texts.en: Simbiat is a focused, hard worker. She puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. She is 50 years old and has been in business for the past nine years. With the business, she has been able to meet the needs of her family while maintaining her business. She is married with four children and they all live in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs and wants to increase the size of her business. This will help her to attract more customers and also meet other needs of her family. She hopes for a loan of 70,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more foodstuffs for her business. She thanks all her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Fraternidad.
Maria es casada, tiene 38 años y 4 hijos, Maria tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa en donde vende también verduras, frutas, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Maria siembra papa y compra y vende quesos.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gas y cerveza.
Los sueños de Maria son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Fraternidad Communal Bank. Maria is 38, married, and has four children. Maria has a grocery store in her house where she also sells vegetables, fruit, and meat. She does this everyday. Maria also plants potatoes and buys and sells cheese. Maria needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy gas and beer. Maria’s dreams are that her children become professionals and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy gas and beer

loans.name: Ayde Noymi

texts.es:
Ayde es socia del Banco Comunal Fraternidad.
Ayde es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 4 hijos, Ayde tiene una ferretería en su casa, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hijos, además tiene un carro con el cual su esposo realiza transporte interprovincial.
Ayde necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tiner.
Los sueños de Ayde es comprar un volquete y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Ayde is a member of the communal bank, "Fraternidad". She has a live-in boyfriend, is 30-years-old, and has 4 children. She has a hardware store in her house, which she attends to with the help of her children. She also has a car that her husband uses to transport items between provinces. She needs a loan of 1,200 PEN, which she will invest in the purchase of paint thinner.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of paint thinner

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa de 42 años  vive feliz con su esposo Anaclo de 48 años, con él tiene 3 hijas que son su orgullo; Verónica de 23, Deysi de 19 y Ángela de 5 años, juntos  viven en una cómoda vivienda propia ubicada en una lejana zona de la selva central del Perú.Desde hace 7 años se dedica a la venta de  frutas , como manzanas, plátanos, naranjas, sandías, melones, duraznos, granadillas, entre otras frutas secas, con la ayuda de su hija mayor Verónica, que cada mañana apertura  el local e inicia el negocio; lo que más le gusta de vender las frutas es que sus hijas están en casa junto a ella y  consumen lo que vende  cuidando su alimentación; “vendiendo frutas he  podido construir mi casa, educar a mis hijos, mantener los gastos del hogar  y hasta vestirme ,no me puedo quejar de las ganancias” refiere Rosa ,a la vez resume que por esta razón su negocio es muy rentable. Para  el futuro tiene planeado ampliar su negocio hasta el patio de su casa y surtirlo de más variedad de frutas para satisfacer a sus clientes.Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y sabe que debe pagar puntualmente si quiere seguir progresando para lograr cumplir sus objetivos.El dinero del préstamo quiere invertirlo bien, por ello comprará más frutas las cuales venderá al por mayor, sobre todo desea comprar uvas por la demanda que tiene este producto a fin de año y así poder obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa, 42, lives happily with her 48 year old husband, Anaclo, and their three daughters. Verónica, 23; Deysi, 19; and Ángela, 5, are their pride. They live together in their own comfortable house, which is located in a far away area in the central jungle of Perú. For seven years she has been selling fruit like apples, bananas, oranges, watermelons, melons, peaches, passion fruit, and other dried fruits. She does this with help from her oldest daughter, Verónica. Every morning she opens the place and starts the business. What she likes best about selling fruit is that her daughters are at home with her. They consume what they sell, taking care of their nutrition. “By selling fruit I have been able to build my house, educate my children, pay the household expenses, and even dress myself. I am not able to complain about the earnings,” Rosa says as she summarizes why her business is very profitable. In the future she plans to expand her business out to the patio of her house. She will stock it with a greater variety of fruit to satisfy her customers. This is the fourth time that she has had a loan with MFP. She knows that she needs to pay punctually if she wants to continue progressing in order to meet her objectives. She will use the money from the loan to invest it well, buying more fruit to sell wholesale. Above all, she wants to buy grapes because of the demand there is for this product at the end of the year. That way she will be able to get greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a greater quantity of merchandise for her business

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan sells frozen foods. She has been in the business since 2006 and has been making a living out of it. She is 40 years old and is married with four children who are doing well in school. To increase her stock of frozen foods, which she buys from another distributor, she needs a loan of 150,000 Nigerian naira. She will use the loan to purchase more frozen foods to sell and meet her customers' demands. This will help to boost her income.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace, 27, is excited to have a Kiva loan. She sells a variety of frozen foods and has been in business for the past three years.  Grace wants to increase her stocks with a loan so she can sell more food and make more profit.  She is asking for NGN100000.  Grace thanks all of her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Claudia Eugenia

texts.es: Claudia Eugenia C. Equite  39 años de edad, casada desde hace 10 años, tiene 4 hijos.  Ella se dedica a la  de venta de huevos juntamente con su esposo desde  hace 2 años, a iniciado como vendedora ambulante a los  alrededores de su localidad, San Pedro Sacatepequez, Guatemala.  Ella va a utilizar su prestamo para comprar huevos para vender.  Su hija mayor cursa el grado de 6 primaria,  por lo cual ella anhela en un futuro, en su negocio llegar a  engrandecer y  tener  su propio local, y así poder distribuir su mercadería  a las tiendas de su comunidad, y así podrán  seguir ayudando con los estudios de sus hijos y que lleguen a una carrera profesional en el futuro. Ya que para ellos esto es un sueño ver prosperar a su familia,  que es algo esencial en la vida.
texts.en:
Thirty-nine-year-old Claudia Eugenia C. Equite has been married for ten years and has four children. She and her husband have sold eggs for two years. At the beginning, they worked as traveling salespeople, selling throughout the outskirts of their town, San Pedro Sacatepequez, Guatemala. She will use the loan to buy eggs for her business. Her oldest daughter is in the sixth grade. Claudia longs to have her own place of business, from which she would be able to sell merchandise to the stores in her community; in this way, she could continue to help her children with their studies and could help them become professionals in the future. The dream of Claudia and her husband is to see their family succeed, which is important in life.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase eggs

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa de 20 años es una joven muy alegre y sincera, vive en la casa de sus padres, a quienes desea ayudar con los gastos del hogar.Con mucho esfuerzo y pese a su juventud pudo ganar la licitación del cafetín en un centro hospitalario, con la ayuda de sus padres, quienes tenían la licitación antes, ha logrado equiparlo muy bien y ha contratado a unas personas para que la ayuden en la atención. La comida que sirve es muy buena, es por eso que es muy concurrida por el personal de este centro.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tener su negocio limpio, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que atender a tantas personas a la vez, ya que muchas veces ella y sus ayudantes no se dan abasto. Para más adelante, espera mejorar las instalaciones de su negocio y así brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.Este es su  primer préstamo con  MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, si es que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde ha sido muy bien recibida.Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará los ingredientes que necesita para elaborar los platillos que vende en su cafetín, y así empezará a implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is 20 years old and is a sincere and happy young woman. She lives with her parent and she want to help them with the household expenses. With a lot of work and in spite of her young age she was able to win the contract for a small coffee shop in a medical center. With the help of her parents, who had the contract before her, she has been able to equip it well and has hired individuals to help with the service. The food that she serves is very good and therefore the personnel of the center often frequent her establishment. She likes to keep her business very clean. After 10 years in this activity, she finds attending to so many people at the same time the most difficult task. Many times she and her helpers cannot cope with all the work. In the future she plans to improve her facility thus being able to provide her customers with better service. This is her first loan with MFP. She know that she has to pay all the installments on time if she does not want to cause problems for the other members of her community bank, where she has been very well received. She will use the thousand New Soles that she is requesting to buy the ingredients for the dishes that she prepares and sells in her coffee shop, this way she will begin to better supply her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to stock her business.

loans.name: Mariela Adela

texts.es: La Sra. Mariela tiene 43 años D. edad, tiene 2 hijos menores D. edad D. 13 y 6 años  en edad escolar, ella es casada  su conyugue esta laborando en la ciudad D. Trujillo, ella vive en la tinguiña en la Av. Jorge  Chavez en casa alquilada , D. una amiga ella vive en esa hace tres años, ella se dedica a ala venta D. ropa como recorredora  se dedica a este negocio hace  5 años, su sueño es poder tener su propia casa, con el credito que solicita invertira en capital D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Mariela is 43 years old and has 2 school-aged children, aged 13 and 6. She is married, and her husband works in the city of Trujillo. She lives in the Tinguiña district on Av. Jorge Chavez in a house she rents from a friend. She has lived there for 3 years. She has been selling clothing door-to-door for 5 years. Her dream is to be able to have her own house. With the loan she requests she will invest in working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Hermécides

texts.es:
Hermécides es una madre de familia de 64 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en la ciudad de Cayaltí, ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de embutidos desde hace más de 11 años, ella ofrece sus productos todos los días, desde muy temprano, en los exteriores del mercado de su zona. Este negocio es de mucha ayuda para el sostenimiento de su familia, por lo que da todo de si para sacarlo adelante.

El negocio de Hermécides es muy conocido en la zona y la calidad de los productos que brinda ha hecho que su puesto de venta tenga siempre mucha clientela, por lo que desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más embutidos, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es seguir haciendro crecer su negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida y darle a sus hijos una buena educación. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra Institución demostrando ser una cliente responsable al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Hermécides is a 64 year old mother who lives with her husband and their two children in the city of Cayaltí, located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. She has sold cold meats for more than 11 years, her products are available every day, from very early, on the outskirts of the market in her area. This business really helps support her family, therefore she gives it everything to get ahead. Hermécides' business is very well known in the area and the quality of the products that she offers has ensured her stall always has a lot of customers. Therefore she wants to expand her business with the purchase of more cold meats. For this reason she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles. Her greatest wish is to continue growing her business in order to improve her quality of life and give her children a good education. She has already previously worked with our institution showing herself to be a responsable customer at the time of taking on her installments.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cold meats for sale

loans.name: Mariela Adela

texts.es: La Sra. Mariela tiene 43 años D. edad, tiene 2 hijos menores D. edad D. 13 y 6 años  en edad escolar, ella es casada  su conyugue esta laborando en la ciudad D. Trujillo, ella vive en la tinguiña en la Av. Jorge  Chavez en casa alquilada  D. una amiga ella vive en esa hace tres años, ella se dedica a ala venta D. ropa como recorredora  se dedica a este negocio hace  5 años, su sueño es poder tener su propia casa, con el credito que solicita invertira en capital D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Mariela is 43 years old, has two school-aged children ages 13 and 6, and is married. Her husband works in Trujillo city. She lives La Tinguiña on Jorge Chavez Avenue in a home she rents from a friend. She has lived there for three years. She has been selling clothing for 5 years. Her dream is to be able to have her own home. The loan will be used as working capital for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for her business

loans.name: Navil

texts.es:
Navil es un padre de familia de 29 años de edad, que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 7 y una año de edad en el distrito de Zaña, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de dos años se dedica a crianza y venta de ganado vacuno y animales menores. El cría los animales en su casa y los vende a los compradores ocasionales que visitan su zona, también comercializa la leche que producen sus vacas entre sus vecinos. Estos negocios son la única fuente de ingreso familiar por lo que da todo de si para sacar su negocio adelante.

Navil desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de una vaca pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Navil desea seguir ampliando su negocio para brindarle a sus hijos una educación de calidad. El es un padre responsable y entregado a su familia y a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Navil is a 29 year old father who lives with his wife and two children (ages 7 and 1) in the district of Zaña, which is located 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past two years, he has been raising and selling cattle and small animals. He raises these creatures at home and sells them to occasional buyers who visit the area. In addition, he sells milk produced by his cows to his neighbors. These businesses provide the only source of income for him to support his family and move his business forward.

Navil wants to grow his business by purchasing another cow, but he does not have sufficient capital in order for this to happen. For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles so that he can meet his objective.

Navil hopes that his business will continue to grow so that he can provide his children with a quality education. He is a responsible father who is dedicated to his family and to his work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cow

loans.name: María Esmeralda

texts.es:
María tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, y vive junto a su esposo, su hija de 20 años de edad y sus padres, ya mayores, en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace seis años, gracias a los ahorros familiares, pudo adquirir una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros), con la que brinda servicio de transporte en Cayaltí y sus anexos. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad son de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia.

Debido a lo accidentado de las carreteras que comunican Cayaltí con sus caseríos, el vehículo ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas mecánicas que requieren de urgente reparación, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

María desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, en especial de sus padres, que son de edad muy avanzada. Ella es una madre de familia responsable, trabajadora y emprendendora.
texts.en:
María is 50 years old, married, and lives with her husband, her 20 year old daughter and her elderly parents in Cayaltí district, which is located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. Six year ago, thanks to her family's savings, she was able to acquire a "mototaxi" (a motorized vehicle used to transport cargo and passengers), with which she provides transportation services in Cayaltí and its annexes. The income she receives from this venture is a great aid to her family's finances. Because of the rough roads that connect Cayaltí with its outlying areas, the vehicle has begun to suffer some mechanical failures that require urgent repair. That is why she needs to request, for the first time, a loan of 500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. María hopes to improve her family's quality of life, in particular that of her parents, who are very advanced age in age. She is a responsible, hard working and enterprising mother.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and Maintenance costs for a mototaxi.

loans.name: Ida Minday

texts.es: Ida tiene 38 años de edad es soltera, vive en la casa de sus padres juntamente con ellos , ella es una persona muy joven y activa siempre a  trabajado  sustenta sus propios gastos desde muy joven, actualmente esta trabajando  en el cafetin de la empresa de transporte SOYUS, ella viene laborando hace un año en dicha empresa,  tiene muchos ueños y objetivos uno de ellos es poder tener su propio negocio, con el dinero que solicita invertira en  la compra de  juguetes para su venta.
texts.en:
Ida is 38 years old, single, and lives with her parents in their home. She is a young person who is very active. Ever since she was very young she has always worked to cover her own expenses. She currently works in the cafeteria of the transportation carrier SOYUS. She has worked in this position for a year. Ida has many dreams and goals; one of these is to be able to have her own business. With the money that she requests she will invest in the purchase of toys to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital (to purchase toys)

loans.name: Jaime Rodolfo

texts.es:
Jaime es un padre de familia de 41 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a su hijo de 3 años de edad en el distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de carne de pollo en el sector La Compuerta, un anexo del distrito de Cayaltí. Todos los días viaja hacia ese lugar para ofrecer su mercadería a sus clientes. Su negocio goza de mucha acogida porque es el único de su tipo por la zona.

Jaime da todo de sí para sacar su negocio adelante ya que es la única fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta su familia. Debido a la demanda por su producto, se encuentra planeando ampliar su negocio con la compra de más carne de pollo , pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utlizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Su más grande anhelo es seguir haciendo crecer su negocio para sacar adelante a su hijo y a su familia, el es una persona bastante conocida y estimada en la zona donde trabaja, sus clientes lo consideran un padre de familia trabajador y responsable.
texts.en:
Jaime is a 41 year old family man who lives with his wife and 3 year old son in the Oyotún District of Chiclayo Province, which is located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. For 10 years, he has made his living selling chicken meat in La Compuerta Sector, an annex of Cayaltí District. He travels to this area every day to sell his merchandise to his customers. His business is well-received because it is the only one of its kind in the area. Jaime gives his whole self to make his business successful, since it is the only source of income his family has. Because of the demand for his product, he is planning to expand his business by purchasing more chicken meat. He does not, however, have sufficient capital to carry out his plan, which is why he finds himself, for the first time, requesting a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. He plans to use the loan to achieve his objective of expanding his business. His greatest wish is to continue growing his business in order to improve his son's and family's situation. He is a well-known and valued person in the area where he works; his customers consider him a hard working and responsible family man.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicken meat to sell.

loans.name: Livia Soledad

texts.es:
Livia tiene 35 años de edad, es separada y tiene una hija de dos años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 10 años tiene instalada una pequeña bodega en su casa donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite) y abarrotes a sus vecinos y clientes que frecuentan su negocio. Adicionalmete brinda servicio de venta de comida a diversos pensionistas y turistas de la zona.

Su negocio cuenta con buena acogida gracias a su buen trato y a la buena sazón con la que prepara sus platos. Livia se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más abarrotes para ampliar su negocio.

Su más grande anhelo es brindarle a su hija una educación de calidad. Ella es una madre responsable y que siempre lucha por salir adelante a pesar de las dificultades.
texts.en:
Livia is 35 years old, is separated from her husband and has a 2 year old daughter. She lives close to her family in Cayaltí District, located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. For 10 years she has had a small grocery store set up in her house. She sells basics necessities (rice, sugar, oil) and groceries to her neighbors and to the customers who frequent her store. Additionally, she offers a food service to the various lodgers and tourists in the area. Her business is welcomed thanks to her good nature and her talent for cooking. Livia finds herself, for the first time, requesting a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa, which she plans to invest in the purchase of more groceries so she can expand her business. Her greatest wish is to provide her daughter with a quality education. She is a responsible mother and always works to get ahead in spite of her difficulties.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries for business expantion.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C. D., 49, is from the village of Catarman. She is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Gloria runs a general store, selling a variety of products in the local community.  Gloria has been in business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 1999, Gloria joined PMPC to access financial services, improve her living situation and engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC to purchase additional products to sell.  Gloria is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory. This loan will be her 15th from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 
--------------------------------
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory to sell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda D. is from the village of Catarman. She is 48 years old, married and has three school-aged children.  To make a living, Imelda raises livestock, primarily pigs. Imelda has been in business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 1999, Imelda joined PMPC to access financial services, improve her living situation and engage in business.  Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and supplies.  This loan will be her 17th from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 
--------------------------
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase livestock feed and supplies.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna B. is from the village of Catarman. She is 49 years old. Myrna is married and has four adult children. Myrna raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos a month from these activities.

In 1999, Myrna joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 16th loan taken out by Myrna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies
